Reviews.Title: “Took son for 21st B-day to 4 queens on freemont st”
Reviews.Author: beach_kids70
Reviews.Content: First, this is not our 1st trip; just the 1st time son's been to LV @21. The 4 Queens is the place we stay on Freemont which offers Friendly staff, older decor, but clean rooms, plus cheapest price at the time. Any problems, the staff does anything in their power to make it right (i.e. from experience). We walked into a room that was smoked-filled and walked straight-out & they upgraded us to a suite for free!! Oh, no matter where you stay ask for a mini-fridge it helps so you can got to Walgreen at corner of Freemont & stock -up on drinks& goodies. There are plenty of gifts/trinkets for $1 & dasani/sodas, too @ stores. Freemont Street was a good spot to take my son for his 1st time gambling (i.e. turned 21). Freemont offers $1 tables along Freemont Street & penny/nickel slots (i.e. 4 queens, Fitz, binions, golden nugget). You just have to ask employees or look for them. Cheap good quality food all-day-long on Freemont st. Lots of incentives if you pick-up hotel club cards (i.e. offer coupons for gambling & food). We never left Freemont. Money stretched far on Freemont compared to the strip (i.e. which can break-the-bank in a day or less if not careful). Four Queens was the best price hotel after New Year’s. We stayed for 6 nights. Money stretched far, free drinks everywhere even if you’re sitting on penny slots. Once son got comfortable and figured tables out, he won a good bit. He also took advantage of the free gambling lessons and the

Reviews.Title: “Super location alont Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: wallysaskatoon
Reviews.Content: A great location where you walk out the front doors and are right in the center of the Fremont Street Experience. Lots of live entertainment on street, several good restaurants and brew pubs within a short walk of the hotel, and when you are tired of walking, you are never more than two blocks from your room unlike the hotels along the strip,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people great stay!”
Reviews.Author: coxdenny17
Reviews.Content: Four Queens is not one of your fancier hotels but.... The room was clean the beds were good the people from the desk clerks to the attendants were friendly. The food at Magnolias is good and reasonably priced. The slots let me play a long time. For the price it enables you to go more often and Fremont Street is where it happens!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Old Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: robinsdl
Reviews.Content: Fun, easy access to the Strip with all the newer Casinos but this feels good in "Old Town". Nice clean hotel, good gambling, lots of good shows around the Casino, Interesting and a good time. We traveled to Hoover Dam and had a good day there seeing the new Bridge over looking the dam. Nice short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Las Vegas' best value all around”
Reviews.Author: ERMESR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times now and it is consistently a great place to use as "home base" when visiting LV. 3 blocks from US 93/95 and a 10 minute drive to the south end of the "strip". Not overly fancy, and small enough that you don't need a map and compass to get around. I'm not a big gambler but enjoy video poker and $5 blackjack (6/5) and they actually had a non-smoking table open most evenings. The casino is not intimidating at all....Rooms are clean, beds good quality, and the dining at Magnolia's Veranda is excellent. Friendly staff and great service everywhere. My wife was skeptical the first time she accompanied me on a return trip but now agrees it is our destination of choice in LV. I am disabled and like the accessibility of a small hotel. We used to stay at the LV Hilton but as the rates have crept up, we won't be going back. Fremont St and several other casinos are right outside the door - the Golden Nugget is next door and Binion's is across Fremont St.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Dean G
Reviews.Content: This hotel smells like smoke in the parking lot, let alone the hotel or the casino. This is an aged, dirty, disgusting place, and is not worth the price. The room has old decor, carpeting, etc., with a running (not leaking) tub that made loud noises in the night. Toilet was cracked, and the bed was lumpy and uneven. Pay a little more and stay on the strip or the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Queens!”
Reviews.Author: Sarvin4
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at the Four Queens. If you are looking for a bargain hotel, in a great location away from the overpriced, overrated strip, then the Queens, in fabulous downtown Vegas, is the place to stay. We purchased our hotel/air package through Allegiant. I agree with other reviewers that the front desk staff needs some lessons in greeting folks. While they are efficient, they aren't particularly cheerful or welcoming. They are the first impression that guests receive of the hotel and you should feel like they are "glad that you are here". Our room was in the south tower. While the decor is a little shopworn, we found the room to be exceptionally clean. The amenities in the bathroom were bar soap, shampoo and lotion. Yes, there is a 4-cup coffee maker and coffee in the room. Not a great cup of coffee, but it does indeed provide that initial jolt of caffeine to start the day out right. We were pleased. I would suggest using bottled water and bring quality coffee from home to enhance your cup of joe! We always feel that leaving a couple of dollars a day for housekeeping is very appreciated by the staff. They thanked us when they saw us and once left a nice note of thanks. These folks work hard and I can burn a couple of dollars in slots in a matter of seconds, so do tip! Our bed was very comfortable, the sheets were clean and the pillows also comfortable. Wi-fi is available at a charge. We stayed on the 16th floor and, although we didn't mind, to get ice we had to go either up or down two floors. We never had to wait long for an elevator. We've always enjoyed the casino. In fact, it's my favorite place to play video poker! I've always come out either ahead or broke even. The cocktail waitresses come by often and are very friendly. Security saw a guy talking to me at one of the machines and approached to make sure everything was okay. I think he was a panhandler and he saw them coming, so he left. Kudos to security! We ate at the Magnolia Cafe a couple of times and on preceding stays. The food is quite good. Look for their specials requiring your player's card. Some good values are there. My husband had a ham steak breakfast for $6.99. It was a huge ham steak, bread, hash browns and eggs; and hubby said it was wonderful! If you go during prime meal times, expect a longer wait to be seated. If you want super-fancy accommodations, stay at the Nugget, but if you want a reasonable place to stay at a great value, stay at the Four Queens. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great casino and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: noble3771
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens again this year in February. It's our second time staying there. We think it's a great price for a great place!

Reviews.Title: “NIce location in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: DRoachBlackRock
Reviews.Content: If you like staying downtown, this place has some great rates. The rooms are slightly smaller than average, but are fairly modern and clean. The casino is situated between the Golden Nugget and Fitzgeralds as well as across from the Fremont, so there are plenty of dining options both in the place and close by that run from dirt cheap (99c shrimp cocktail at Fremont) to high end gourmet (Hugo's Cellar at the 4 Queens). The coffee shop, Magnolia's, is one of the two best downtown (the other being at the California) as far as quality and value. Overall very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “good place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: roxi72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 4 queens for 7 nights. The beds very comfortable and the rooms were clean. The rooms in south tower quiet. We started out in the north tower (oldest rooms in the hotel) and the rooms are much smaller/dated. They were very nice and switched us to the south tower the next day. Front desk,housekeeping and casino beverage servers are very nice, but the server we had at Magnolias was rude beyond belief and the food just so so. We didn't eat at the hotel again during our stay. It was our 3rd time staying at the 4 Queens, and have always liked it because of the reasonable cost and nice location. I LOVE that they have a coffee pot in the room!! We always thought the food and servers at Magnolieas were good in the past and were quite surprised at the poor quality of servers and the so so food. The slots were ok. Win a little, lose a little sort of thing, but we didn't go thinking we would make a fortune, but we didn't lose a lot either.

Reviews.Title: “BIG BOUQUET to the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: donna l
Reviews.Content: Had another great stay here. Our second time and it was as great as the first stay.Check in lady was very helpful and very pleasant. Room was very clean and ribs at Magnolias were yum, yum. All casino workers were very pleasant which is so nice .Will surely stay again. No complaints here. Got to love the 4 Queens. Donna & Norm Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psychdz
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four nights at the Four Queens. The room was clean with flat screen tv and was cleaned by housekeeping each day. The room was a basic hotel room with two beds and a desk. The bathroom was also clean but somewhat small. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was certainly nothing fancy but a good basic hotel from which to enjoy the area. I would return to the Four Queens and would recommend it for anyone wanting a basic, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “solo weekend in vegas”
Reviews.Author: TImm1565
Reviews.Content: Went to vegas to meet some friends and stayed alone at Four Queens Hotel on Fremont Street, Room was clean and the casino was on the small size which i liked, right in the middle or Fremont Street so your close to all the action. Staff was helpful. would stay there again. price was right also.

Reviews.Title: “Room too hot to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: It was too hot in my room to sleep. Tried turning on the a/c but all that did was push around the warm air. Turns out the staff decides whether or not to activate the a/c for the entire building. They told me to open the window. All that did was make it noisy in the room and draw in the warm air from the hallway. They did offer to move me to the other building but I had to get up in a few hours and by the time I packed, moved, and settled in it would be time to get up. Other than the heat, the room was ok. But it does not matter how nice the room is if one can't get any sleep. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Tommy C
Reviews.Content: Everytime I tell my friend that I am going to Vegas - They say I must be rich. 4 Queens has affordable gambling, rooms, and food. Lots to do and see on Fremont Street. One of my favorite places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: Diana7Michigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown one night just to see what it would be like. Room was clean and decorated nice. Bed was comfy and clean. Did not find any critters. Bathroom was tiny but everything worked. Nice flat screen TV and one cup coffee maker. I pack instant coffee,creamer,sugar. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: Rainey4
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd year in a row that we have stayed here. The rooms are worn but clean. This time the service was lacking. In the past we were given a coupon for a buy one get one meal at Magnolia's. This time we were given absolutely no coupons. We were a group of 12 and so had 6 rooms. In one room there was no coffee pot. In 2 of the rooms the hair dryers did not work. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: chiefs159
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the 4 queens hotel and casino last october and i had a great time,the hotel is the best on freemont st. the staff is friendly and helpful. the maid service was great the made sure you always had clean towels and linen and that the room was spotless. i would recommend this hotel to anyone. i am planning another trip to vegas in june and i am staying at the 4 queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: maurbol
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2:15 and luckily a king room was ready, desk clerk very nice. Room was very small, clean though, chair back was a little cockeyed, bedspread had a hole in it. Bed was comfortable, TV worked well, good shower. Maid service did a good job. We only paid 50 bucks for the room. An average good clean place to stay.right in the middle of the Fremont experience. Maybe there are more updated rooms in the south tower we were on the 9th floor of the north tower. We did not eat there, but they have Hugo's Cellar which is supposed to be really really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Four Queens in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Westerncanuck11
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four queens started with a late evening check in around 8:15 PM. when we arrived we stood in line (the only ones by the way) while our desk clerk talked on the phone for what seemed to be about 10 minutes but that was ok. Our room was a standard room on the 14 floor and we found it to be quite satisfactory. the room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. The maid service was dependable and there was never a problem getting extra towels and such. The staff were always friendly and always had a smile to give us. As far as dinning nothing to speak of really, if you wanted a quick snack there was the subway located just off the casino but we found many good little spots to eat on Fremont street. If there was any thing that we could complain about it was the loud music on Fremont street until about midnight but then who goes to Las Vegas to sleep any way. All pin all we would have to give the Four Queens Hotel and casino a 4 out of 5 stars rating for. We would stay there again in a heart beat. Susan and Elvis Kyle. From Edmonton Alberta Canada.

Reviews.Title: ““pleasant stay””
Reviews.Author: Tyrone B
Reviews.Content: friendly staff and clean comfortable room at bargain price, good dining choices at hotel and nearby casinos.

Reviews.Title: “A Layover Experience”
Reviews.Author: PeterRuthWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip homeward from Lake Haveseu City AZ, we chose to stay @ Four Queens,Freemont. Our room was prebooked and got the 6th floor. Fearing the location facing the Freemont experience, we were pleasantly surprised. The street noise ended with the final light show @ midnight, and we had a perfect view of the action thru the day and night. The casino was not crowded and personnel were friendly, especially Joseph @ the Players Club. We enjoyed the comp coupons and the fellow @ the micro brewery even trusted us with his giant mugs for our room! Breakfast was cheap @ the Fitz, but we enjoyed a stack of hotcakes @ the Magnolia as well as delicious dinner of ribs. The helpful bellhop kept our luggage before leaving on the quick shuttle to the airport. An adequate experience for a quick stopover in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Jozcat
Reviews.Content: We decided to split our 4 day stay in Las Vegas into 2 nights in Fremont and 2 nights on the Strip to get the different perspectives. When we arrived at the Four Queens after a long day and a long trip from the airport in the shuttle (being out at Fremont you are the last to be dropped off) we found it all a bit overwhelming at first - having to take our bags through the very smoky and brightly lit casino to our elevator and opening our room door to the blast of music from the Fremont Experience we really did wonder if we'd done the right thing booking in to the Four Queens..............but after we settled in, went downstairs and had a great meal at the hotel's restaurant, joined the casino club for some great freebies and went back upstairs we really weren't too bothered by the noise and had a pretty good sleep! We were a bit surprised to have no fridge in our room - this is something we'd sort of come to expect - but it really didn't matter - it wasn't like we spent a lot of time in the room! The reception staff were very helpful, the room was clean if a little in need of refurbishment and yes, being part of a casino it was smoky. Great access to everything from here - we loved the Fremont Street Experience - and we ate nearly all our meals in the hotel's restaurant - we made good use of the funbook they gave us as part of our deal. I'd probably ask for a quieter room when we go back. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn F
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas many times always staying on the Strip. I had never been to Freemont Street so decided this time I wanted to go there. The Four Queens is one of the Casinos along Freemont Street. It has covered parking and all the amenities. The room was great, the atmosphere great this is my news favorite.

Reviews.Title: “have stayed in 4 queens for years”
Reviews.Author: RichardVA
Reviews.Content: Small, convenient, and very nice staff. We go to rodeo every December and stay, play, and eat here. Not luxury but very good and we feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “pick the nugget instead”
Reviews.Author: matt s
Reviews.Content: location is key in this hotel,. however if you like clean rooms you may want to pick somewhere else. Do yourself a favour and stay at the nugget. The room was dirty,dingy,dark and overall unpleasant. Bring you own pillows

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens - FUN on Fremont Street! - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: CharleySays
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels coast to coast. The Four Queens is well kept, a bit worn in a few places, but completely acceptable! The easy access to Fremont street and all the casinos in VERY close proximity make this a wonderful choice. With the bus you can go down to the strip, but there is plenty of action on Fremont street and I have to say I love the LIVE Sax player outside my 6th floor room crooning away. Just beautiful! If you come to Vegas and want a simply good time with no driving or parking hassles, without have to walk a mile to the front desk and then a mile to your room. This could be your new favorite. I sure would come back! (and good rates on the web too!)

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting room ever;”
Reviews.Author: PearlyD
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was leaving!! I arrive at 12:30 am and there's only two rooms available. We get one on the smokers side because it's the only ones available.. With me is my husband, 1 1/2 year old son and 4 month old daughter. My kids are exhausted and if you're a parent you know how tired kids get. We check in go to our room. I sit my son on the bed, turn to the side and there's fingernails all over the counters and floor!! The bathroom sink has brown liquid all over it, trash is full, bathtub has hairs and other people's shampoos! Are you kidding me!!! I call the front desk and all they say is "we'll call someone to clean it"!!! They take 20 minutes to get here and another 30 to clean it.... My kids are so tired I can't take it.... Agghhh! I would NEVER recommend anyone to stay here!!! Horrible service. They don't even have a manager! House keeping lady was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Thesfam1
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. About 3 miles from the strip but really nice area for the Fremont street experience. Rooms were clean. We bring our service dog everywhere and the staff loved her too.

Reviews.Title: “The 4 Queens Hotel in Las Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: rbwebb25
Reviews.Content: What a dump. Rude staff, more pubic hair in the bathroom than a head, management did not recognize my concerns

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens - Jan. 2012”
Reviews.Author: Glitzie967
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, bathrooms extremely small and need repair. Price is good. I paid $34/night.Location is xlnt as other casinos are right next door. The "Fremont Street Experience" is pretty neat especially if you haven't seen it b4. However, if you go to sleep b4 midnight request a room in the back away from the "Experience" which is pretty loud. The dealers in the casino are not very friendly. One guy at the craps table was doing well throwing the dice and they kept harassing him regarding not throwing the dice hard enough. Of course if he was losing they wouldn't have said a word. Once he started throwing the dice hard enough they raised the table minimum from $5 to $10 in an effort to recoup the house losses. When that happened I walked away. Pretty uncool behavior by the table staff. Magnolias coffee shop is good. Sports book is small but staff is nice. I've heard good things about "Hugo's Cellar" so if you want a quality meal, give it a try. (around $20-$40 person)

Reviews.Title: “Good location -- horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: clvisions
Reviews.Content: Old outdated and dirty rooms. Dirty hallways, very mediocre look. If your room faces the light show it will be really LOUD every time they perform the light show, which is every hour from 6-2am Next time i would prefer to stay on the strip and go downtown for a while to see the show.

Reviews.Title: “location and price are the only reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: soxfan814
Reviews.Content: just stayed here for five nights dec 11-16.was part of package so i thought i would give it a shot.would i stay here again?most likely not.rooms are small but clean,water pressure on shower created its own weather system(very high pressure),staff seemed nice however walls are very thin you can everything next door.some advice in north tower even room #'s face freemont street and floors 7 and above overlook the freemont canopy not much a view.very loud

Reviews.Title: “Husband and I stayed @4 queens for one week”
Reviews.Author: beach_kids70
Reviews.Content: If this isn't your 1st rodeo in LV, Freemont is a nice more toned version of strip (not as quite as chaotic, but as it get later it get crazy), much cheaper side of Vegas. It is located on the north end, far from the Main LV Strip. But, you don’t break the bank staying at Freemont hotels, either. You have more $ to play and your $ stretches a heck of a lot on Freemont (i.e. food specials are super cheap, good bogo free entertainment specials, gambling is affordable, rooms are affordable). Now, the week we stayed at 4 Queens we never left Freemont Street. We stayed busy there, but we've been to LV so many times this was a very good experience as far as cost vs. staying on the strip (so freaking expensive)! They offer all kinds of gambling & food incentives all over Freemont. I will be taking my son to stay on Freemont for his 21st b-day. Gambling is cheap if you look around one place offers $2 blackjack and other deals. 4 Queens is a Great place to learn how-to-play & great place if you know how to gamble. They offer unbelievable b-fast & dinner specials (big servings), too. It's an average older decor hotel, but clean & in center of Freemont Street. Taxi from airport was costly $40 or $45, but much better than a shuttle bus, in my opinion. We were very happy w/our stay. Bingo is fun too; Never played before and won tons of $ several times

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jckj
Reviews.Content: I Visit Vegas Ones A Year and Allways stay At the Four Queens. They Send Me Free Coupons To Stay At The Hotel 2 Nights Free, If I Stay And Pay for Two More for Only $26 dollars per Night. All You Have To Do Is Get A Gambling Card. & Is Free. Good Deal

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the 4 queens(Luz from Ocala)”
Reviews.Author: luz o
Reviews.Content: the service was uotstanding food prices very affordable situated in the heart of downtown las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the price or service!”
Reviews.Author: irish9000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Queens in Las Vegas for 2 nights 11-14 and 11-15-11. Stayed in room 1408 North. They have 2 towers (north and south). The north tower is closer to Fremont Street and can be a little noisy until 1 a.m. The south tower faces the Strip. Although checkin is not until 3 p.m., they happily checked myself and my buddy in at 12:15 p.m. Took all of 90 seconds. Very fast and the young lady clearly knew how to do her job. The bell service was terrific. Had to rent a scooter the second night due to an ankle injury (yes the first night was like the movie the Hangover) and Steve at the bell desk was a great help. Here is a quick breakdown of the hotel/casino: Room: Small (though all rooms are kind of small on Fremont St.) but very clean. Housekeeping was very professional while I was there. Great view of Fremont Street and the mountains from my room. New HDTV with 34 free channels and pay per view movies. Bathroom was clean and stocked with plenty of towels and pretty good size. Casino: Yes, it looks like 80's. All of the lights and gold scream of a different time, but the video poker is terrific and $5 blackjack tables everywhere. Small sports book has all the games to bet on. From what i heard from other players around me, getting comped at the Four Queens is easier than at other Las Vegas casinos. Food: Chicago Brewing Company! Good food but as a beer lover myself, their housemade crafts are excellent. Ate breakfast at Magnolia's in the casino. HUGE breakfast burrito that was very good. Service in both was very speedy and polite. Overall, if you are in your 20's looking for a hotspot, the Four Queens is probably not for you (try the Plaza down the street). The average age was clearly over 40. However for a clean hotel, awesome location walking distance to everything and quick service you cannot beat the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: gmagap
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four Queens was from Nov.8-Nov.14th 2011. We have been going there for 20+ years and it has always met our expectations. Not much has changed and the location and price is great as it always has been. The machine payouts are as good or better than any other casinos we tried. Magnolias food, service and price were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan48302
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of our week-long vacation in Vegas. The front half was on the north end of the Strip for a conference. The Four Queens is right in the middle of the Freemont Experience. Lots of entertainment right out the door of the casino. The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is an older hotel, so the rooms aren't as spacious as in newer hotels. Also, the room decor is a bit dated, but not at all ratty. It is a different, slightly retro experience so keep that in mind when judging the rooms and casino. We wanted to see the "old" Vegas and Fremont Street delivers. The Magnolia restaurant has excellent food at reasonable prices, and the hotel offers coupons for buy one/get one free. Look for the coupons. The players club has comps you can earn, too. The staff is very friendly. We had no problems. We saw the La Cage show, and it was very good. Small lounge atmosphere and very entertaining. The hotels offers $10 off coupons for hotel guests. Heard the Mike Hammer comedy show was also excellent. We didn't have time to see it, though. Plenty of places to eat, and there's nightly music shows up and down Fremont Street. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay - not spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: Angie_Ohio
Reviews.Content: This stay was the first time I stayed in downtown Vegas. I had always stayed on the strip. We stayed there at the prodding of friends. The people at the hotel and casino were very pleasant and friendly. The smoke was bothersome especially for me. (I have strong issues with cigarette smoke.) It was fun to see the Fremont Experience. I felt like I was at a lower end budget motel. To make it through the stay, I kept reminding myself of how little we were paying. It was not awful, but a shock for someone who stays at the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gene V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the 4 Queens from 10/16/11 to 10/20 and then again from 10/23/11 to 10/27 (two different rooms – one on the South Tower, one in the North Tower). This was our first time staying downtown. We had a great time, and we will most likely book a room at the 4 Queens next time we visit LV. Prior to this trip we always stayed on the Strip (MGM Grand, Harrah’s, Luxor, Riviera, Hilton.) For the sake of comparison, Vegas.com rates the Queens as a 2-1/2 star hotel, the Riviera is 3 stars, and the MGM is 4 stars. In our opinion, these ratings are pretty accurate. Our rooms at the Queens were nothing special, but they were clean. The décor is dated but they are in the process of slowly refurbishing the rooms. Similarly, the food there (except for Hugo’s which is expensive & excellent) was just OK to Good. The best things about the Queens were the room rates, the location and the slot play. Table games were only OK, but $5 single- or double-deck Blackjack was only a short walk away. If you want a nice or really nice room, and are willing to pay the higher room rates, stay at a 3-star or higher hotel. If you want an OK room, stay at the Queens or another a 2-1/2 star hotel. If you just want a place to sleep, stay at 2-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hugo's Cellar Restaurant at Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: DReed1952
Reviews.Content: You must make reservations to dine at Hugo's Cellar inside Four Queens. The cost may seem pricey but your meal includes salad (made at your table), main course (Prime Rib, Chilean Sea Bass, Ribeye, etc.) with all the trimmings and desert. The plates of food are huge so come hungry. The atmosphere was leisurely and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Four Queens was fun!”
Reviews.Author: CanIgo
Reviews.Content: I returned on Monday 11/14/11. This was my first time to stay downtown and my first stay at the Four Queens. This is an older casino and is much smaller that some of the monster spots on the strip. Most of the employees were very nice. The food at the Magnolia Restaurant was really good and had reasonable prices. I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs for breakfast one day. I tried the ham and eggs for a different breakfast. Both were very good. I had the ribeye one evening and the prime rib another evening. They were both great for the price! The gumbo and shrimp cocktail were also good. They have a fancy five star restaurant in the basement. The menu is posted but there were no prices on it. I was not a winner so I passed that on by! The bar that served the mirco-brew was very nice and the staff were friendly. The rooms adjoining Freemont Street were a bit loud in the mid evening. If you like to go to bed early you should book a room on the other side of the hotel. My room was not fancy. It was of adequate size and clean. There was a flat screen TV that I never turned on. There were plenty of towels in the bath. There was a coffee pot but NO COFFEE. A small sign suggested that you buy the coffee at the gift shop. I thought that was a bit cheap....what would it cost to provide some coffee? I think the hotel drops down in class a little for this! I spent hundreds of dollars in the slot machines without seeing anyone bringing a drink. You could die of thirst in the slot areas! That is no problem however, just go to one of the many other places located within a block or two to play! I wanted to play at the craps tables. I went there several times but the cigarette smoke was so bad that I would not have been able to stay long. I am not a prude as I smoked for over 30 years. I just cannot seem to stand or sit and smell that anymore. If given an opportunity I would stay at the Four Queens again and would recommend the hotel / casino to others wanting a fun trip at a fair price!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value!”
Reviews.Author: bb311
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at the Four Queens Hotel and Casino and had a great time. The entire trip was so reasonable and when we checked-in we were pleasantly surprised with a free suite upgrade. Our room was clean, away from the noise and the bed was super comfortable. They have great staff there and a fun casino. For a fun party experience, I definitely recommend staying in downtown Vegas at the Four Queens is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: randi_0
Reviews.Content: great staff,great bang 4 your buck. Very freindly and helpful floor people. Liked that Macdonalds right next door for morning COFFEE...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: GARYA2424
Reviews.Content: Despite Mrs Perfect of Berlins critique below, i must stand up for the Four Queens. I stayed there from 07/10/11 until 15/10/11 and found almost all of the staff, from bartenders to check-in, to maids, to security, all friendly and helpful. The rooms were ok too, and quite clean and well kept, but i agree they could do with a refurb at some stage. The Four Queens has its frailties, from the outdated decor and the 70s furnishings, but this surely reflects the rates. The main positive however, is the value for money. If you wish to pay for the surroundings of the high end names on the strip, then fine, but surely if you wish to stay at the Four Queens and pay the applicable rates, then you should expect to lower your sights accordingly. If you are prepared to lower your expectations then i am sure you wont be disappointed, because overall the Four Queens has a good location, is safe and friendly with a good mix of clientele. Enjoy, Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “We ate at the Four Queens coffee shop 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: travelsatlast
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying downtown, we chose to stay at the Golden Nugget but did not see any dinner specials so we went looking under the canopy and we saw that the Four Queens was offering Prime Rib for 7.99. We signed up for their casino card and we were given a coupon for a 2 for 1 special so our Prime Rib dinner was 7.99 plus tax and drinks. It was quite good. The next evening we ate there as well and it was quite good, especially for the price. We would defintely eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average for downtown, so not so great”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: If you are able to get a great deal, AND dont have great expectations this place is ok. just ok, Its old, need refurbishment. What if they took a downtown hotel and didnt care? The Four Queens. Though one of the best gourmet- with high VALUE exists at this property "Hugos cellar" Discounts for over 55 throughout the property

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel and terrible service. Stay clear!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPerfectBerlin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since most reviews on TripAdvisor were quite positive about it and we thought we wouldn't spend much time at the hotel anyway, but it was a great disappointment. The hotel interiors are depressing to say the least. Now, I admit I generally have fairly high standards when I travel, but I do not mind staying in no-frills hotels, if clean. Well, this hotel is everything but clean. The walls, the carpets, everything in the rooms needs a good make-over, or at least a good scrub. Bathrooms are tired-looking, room curtains have never been washed and neither have the filthy bed throws. On top of that, everything is so kitsch. No, not Vegas-kitsch - just horrible quality and taste. Our bed sheets were dirty and stained, I could not wait to leave that place! Blah. There is no security whatsoever, nor you are required to swipe your room key in order to use the elevator, that means that basically anyone can get to the rooms undisturbed. Including prostitutes visiting their clients (yes, we did see that). Charming! The staff at check in goes from unfriendly to unbelievably rude, besides being completely scruffy-looking and not at all groomed. I would like to mention Jennifer for her particular rudeness when my husband complained about receiving a slightly damaged $10 note at the hotel and she refused not only to accept the note (a tiny bit at the corner of the note was missing) but also to offer any sort of assistance. Great customer service. On top of this, the clientele of the hotel is a little...dubious. I am not a great fan of casinos, but the atmosphere is by far nicer on the strip. The hotel valets were the only friendly and hard-working souls at this miserable hotel. If you can afford anything nicer, do yourself a favour and stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mahavir_49
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not too big. The view outside is nothing to be happy about. The bed was comfortable. The room overall is quite small and not many facilities inside, like no fridge, no microwave. Felt the rooms and hallways were old. Internet is extra and expensive. Parking is available for $3/day. The rooms were quiet but casino and restaurant was not as expected. Too much of smoke in casino. Since i am a non-smoker, didn't felt good. Didn't take much service so won't comment on that. Its quite far from the strip. For what i paid, it was worth the stay since we spent most of the time outside and went there to just sleep. Will i go back to same place. No!! I guess i will try other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: kmbkat
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas from Virginia every 6 weeks or so for short trips just to take a break from my hectic work life. Downtown Vegas is an acquired taste and will not suit folks who have particularly high expections for room size, location, etc. Having said that obviously I am not one of those folks. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and I've had my fill of them. I love downtown and I've stayed at several downtown hotels and finally settled on the 4 Queens as my favorite. It's an older property, it's not fancy, it has no glitz or glamour and I absolutely love it there. The rooms are a decent size and are cleaned pretty well. The beds are comfortable and the sheets won't scratch you to death. The bathroom is tiny but unless you are a huge person the facilities are adequate. The 4Q was one of the only places that had a coffee maker in the room which was a touch I always appreciated. But be advised that on my August trip they had removed the 4 cup coffee maker and replaced it with a Keurig pod machine with a note saying that for a fee you could purchase k-cups in their gift shop. Holy Crow! If I have to go to the lobby to buy coffee I may as well go to McDonalds and get my coffee, which is what I did. For my upcoming trip I'm taking my k-cups with me and all should be well. There are plenty of dining options in the area so you should be able to find something to suit your tastes. Some folks complain of the "seedy" area but I don't think it's all that bad. I've encountered much worse on the strip. I usually travel alone and I feel perfectly comfortable walking around the area by myself, although I will admit I will not venture to the El Cortez after dark; I'd suggest you save your long walks for daytime hours. I've never encountered problems during check in or during my stay. The majority of the staff at the 4Q have been very friendly and professional. I've never been disappointed at check in as they have always accommodated my request for a room away from the elevator and the Fremont light show. A final bit of advise---if you're traveling to downtown from the airport book a limo and save yourself the aggravation of dealing with the cabbies. I always use Bell Trans and they are always waiting for me when I arrive in the airport and departing from the hotel. They have never been late; not once. I had more than one negative experience with Vegas cab drivers and have never used their services since. For a few bucks more you will have a much more pleasant transportation experience; trust me on that.

Reviews.Title: “Too much smoke and slot machines”
Reviews.Author: jtnycny
Reviews.Content: The room was okay and quiet but the casino and restaurants were difficult unless you like to breathe a lot of cigarette smoke

Reviews.Title: “It's downtown. Manage your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: sprintf32768
Reviews.Content: Don't bring your wife here, or your mother! I'm kidding. I'm a kidder. But seriously, if my wife asked me to take her to Vegas, I would want her to get pampered and see the best and brightest and most beautiful aspects of Las Vegas. I would want her to see fountains and the eiffel tower, and maybe a giant gold nugget. BUT I LOVE THE FOUR QUEENS. So, if you are coming here with your pals, and you want a hotel where you can really let it hang out, don't hesitate to choose the four queens. The casino is great, the bars are great. It's not swanky! Don't be a silly billy. The 4Q is not about swank. It is about hitting the pai gow table and having sassy dealers and drinking a football of beer. It is about smoking too many cigarettes and overtipping the waitress and meeting some really cool people. A perfect central location for your jaunts to the shoe, the el cortez, the mss. Boom! Maybe you want to know what the room was like. Well, I was totally able to sleep, and I have no complaints about the pillows or the sheets. The showerhead was high enough. The bathroom was perfectly fine. Not fancy! Of course not! But fine. If you ever stayed at Binion's Horseshoe before it closed, you may remember that they used sandpaper instead of cotton sheets. This is not the case at the 4Q! So anyway, I'd like to say I like the 4Q. If you are headed to Vegas because you want to drink your face off, this is a good headquarters for you and your crew.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on Fremont Street!”
Reviews.Author: SavvyFaire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and liked the atmosphere. Smaller and more intimate than some of the hotels on Fremont, but still has a good-sized casino and several restaurants. (The $7.95 prime rib dinner is incredible!) Convenient to everything on Fremont St and easy to catch the bus to the strip. Rooms are plenty big enough with everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: This can be a really good value for downtown with the location and setup. I would stay here again for a deal. Fremont facing rooms can be noisy late and waiting for elevators can be a drag. Not much on the casino, since I play Hold'em poker at Binions across the street. The view pool is rooftop at Binions, their brother property. The Veranda Cafe is lame. Flatscreen, decent bed and bath is what I needed, which 4Q provided, adequately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Four Queens. It's our third time staying there, and overall another pleasant experience. While not fancy, they've put money into things that matter. Our room had two queen beds. The mattresses seemed to be quite new and were excellent (fairly firm with a "pillow top"). The carpet also appeared to be newer, as were the bathroom fixtures. Everything was very clean. Linens, towels and toiletries were good quality. The heating and air conditioning are internal (not through the wall) and have an easily adjusted thermostat and fan speeds. The system was relatively quiet, providing good "white noise" at night. Unlike most casinos, the window actually opened (about a foot), providing fresh air when wanted. The room also had a coffee maker (a rarity in LV) and a flat screen TV. Rooms around us were occupied, but we heard very little noise from them. It was a non-smoking room, and other than a fairly strong cleaning solution odor when we first arrived (which cleared up quickly once we opened the window), the room was odor-free. We've consistently found the staff to be friendly and helpful (yes, there's the occasional grump, but it's the exception). For instance, the first room we were given backed up to the elevators and smelled somewhat smokey. We returned to the front desk and asked if she could make a change. She said it was not a problem and gave us another room (the one described above). She said if we didn't like that one we should come see her again, adding "I'm here til midnight". We also spend a lot of time gambling at the Four Queens. They do very well with their slot machine and video poker choices (some good video poker pay tables). Table games are a little less consistent. For instance, there is typically only one 3:2 $5 blackjack table during the day. Others are 6:5. Funny thing is, I've seen full 6:5 tables while the 3:2 table had empty seats, so I guess if I were the casino I wouldn't change things either. There is no poker room, nor is there a sports book (well, there is, but only enough to say they have one). The Four Queens seems pretty generous with comps compared to most other downtown or strip casinos (we belong to a number of player's clubs). Cocktail service on the floor is usually very good if you're gambling. The servers are always friendly, and frequent if you tip them decently. The Four Queens is not a large property. It's really nice if you're playing there and need to go back to your room for something to be able to do it in five or ten minutes, unlike the mega casinos on the strip. If you want a pool, you have to go to the rooftop of Binion's. That's a pain, but it's actually a cool setup. The view is amazing, and though the pool is small, the deck area is very nice and often almost deserted. If you like downtown (we became converts a few years ago, and rarely stay on the strip any more), and if you don't care too much about "fancy," you'll probably find the Four Queens to be a good choice . I don't find much difference between the rooms we've had at the Four Queens and the Carson Tower rooms at the Golden Nugget, though of course the Golden Nugget is a larger and fancier property overall. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: randykay10
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at The Four Queens in Las Vegas, Sept 19-22, 2011. Had a great stay. The Security at this hotel is Top Notch. Especially a Security Guard named Juan. He looked after our safety the entire time. The only thing I would change about the room we had is that I would have the bathroom door open outward. Currently when the door is open, you can't get around in the small bathroom. Nice hotel, casino, easy parking, coffeemaker included.

Reviews.Title: “Great economical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lordbarney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2009 and from the moment I arrived I was treated very well. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and let me know the do's and don'ts of Fremont street. The room was lovely and clean and the bed very comfortable. The only down side was the bathroom which was outdated and small. The shower did not work that well. But all in all I enjoyed my time at the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaMujer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay on Fremont Street therefore, we chose Four Queens. I would regret this choice. First the hallway leading up to the room was a powder need re-painting blue. The room itself was very tiny. The bathroom was very tiny. We felt like rats in a trap. Do not let yourself get trapped by the Four Queens. Do not stay there....no matter how good the price is. I was very very disappointed and I definitely will not stay here again at all.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: bigcat37
Reviews.Content: We love to go to the 4 Queens in Vegas. It is on Fremont St and there is so much to do just outside the door. This time the light show at night was a tribute to our servicemen. The are lots of street vendors and the had zip rides. I was lucky enough to win enough to cover the trip. The hotel staff and the casino dealers are the best. The Chicago Brewing Company has a bistro and they have Filet Mignon Sliders you get 3 as an appitizer and they are wonderful.Also Magnolia's has the best food. We celebrated our 50th Anniversary a little early (11/11/11). The rooms are a little out of date but very comfortable and the price was great we were comp'd for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for price & to see Downtown”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGina
Reviews.Content: Four queens is def. in need of an update but they worked hard to make it an enjoyable experience. The staff was very friendly from the front desk to the room staff to TJ at the Chicago Pizza place...we felt very welcome. If you go in understanding that this is an older smoke-filled property at a low price, you won't be disappointed. For us, it was just enough to be there one night and then to move onto the strip - the Cosmopolitan....wow! A brand-new over-the-top comfort...check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: bellabullets
Reviews.Content: Had plans to book with this hotel, but ended up staying at The Fitz across the street. The front desk staff is terribly rude, and tried to charge me twice for my hotel room and deposit. Can't tell you about the room quality, because I didn't even make it past the front desk. Casino seemed alright. If any Four Queens management is reading this, you guys really need to work on customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back in Sept. 2012”
Reviews.Author: gord L
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, they gave me an early check-in no problem. Room was clean, well appointed, lots of towels, food a deal and very good. All hotel and casino staff pleasant and helpful. Special thanks to front desk staff Yvonne and Terry who got me the info on bus routes and connections so I could see the Jerry Lewis Telethon. Freemont st. experience was great and free evey night. Casino slots payoff YEAH. Will stay 7 nights next year. Gord LeGresley Dollard Des Ormeaux Quebec Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Randy A
Reviews.Content: I've been to Fremont Street several times but this was my first stay at the Four Queens. The room was very nice for the price. Beds were comfortable and clean and had a flat screen TV. My only complaint, which has nothing to do with the room or hotel, is a few of the crap table dealers were pricks. They should be more polite to people spending their money at their casino. I went to Fitzgeralds and my money went with me. If you don't like your job, find something else to do. Because of them, I'll choose to spend all my money at Fitzgeralds next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: jamey s
Reviews.Content: After reading some of your recent reviews, I was a little concerned about my stay, but found the hotel, staff and casino the same wonderful places and people I remembered. The hotel was Steve Wynn's first, and you can still see glimpses of his style coupled with 70's glitz, giving the whole resort a nostalgic "retro" feel. Table games abound and there are enough slots for everyone. The only concern I had was that Magnolias, which is the 24-hour cafe, did not seem to have the same good food and low prices as in previous trips...this was easily solved by eating at the Fitz next door. And for you itchy people, not a sign of a bedbug...the rooms, bathrooms, linens, etc. were immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Madmex1217
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 12-15 and had a great time the room was clean with a great view of the strip, not one thing to complain about would absolutely stay at the Four Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying near Fremont St., but it's not quiet!”
Reviews.Author: realpatontheback
Reviews.Content: Was given the weekend by a friend who couldn't use the room, last minute. We were directly above the Fremont St. experience, so it wasn't quiet. Fortunately, I sleep like a log, so I wasn't kept awake. Arrived after 11 & the music was still going. Comfy bed, small bath, a bit dated, but we enjoyed it. We were also given some coupons @ the players club for great dining bargains. We used both. Not bad casino food, & reasonable. I had to rate the value as 4m but I don't know the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: bean602
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the 4Queens many times on our treks to Las Vegas. We prefer Downtown. The 4 Queens is our preferred Hotel. Everything from booking to checkout always goes smoothly. The staff at the Four Queens is friendly and efficient. Magnolia's restaurant is excellent for both service and food quality. I've never had an experience at Magnolia's that is less than good. The daytime crew at the back bar are far-and-away, the best bartenders I have ever encountered. Although all all of the day shift bartenders are excellent; I would like to call out one in particular. Mike is an an exceptional bartender that is always on top of customer's needs. Not only does he keep the customer happy, he has a great sense of humor and keeps us laughing as we are feeding the video poker machines at the back bar. I would go so far as to say that he is the main reason we keep returning to the 4Queens. We are not bar people, but he entertains us so much, we keep returning! Kudos to 4Queens for having such excellent staff! Sincerely, Mary Dickens & Paul Barry

Reviews.Title: “Could be better....could be worse”
Reviews.Author: fancy2572
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Four Queens for 7 nights, 8 days last October, booked a standard room for around $25 a night through Hotwire and then decided to upgrade to one of their Jacuzzi suites which we had to do through the hotel itself. The upgrade cost an additional $68 per night which was still a bargain considering how cheaply we got the standard room. When booking our upgraded room; we were assisted by an outstanding reservations agent named Alba. Extremely helpful and went out of her way to provide great customer service and answer all of our questions. We had an early arrival at the hotel, getting there right around noon. The front desk clerk processed our reservation with no trouble and was very friendly but did tell us that our room was not ready and to come back at 1:30 to get our room key. We would be able to leave our luggage in the room then, although we shouldn’t expect it to be cleaned and ready for our use until 4:00 pm (the hotel’s listed check-in time) We left our luggage with the bellman and returned at 1:30 to get our key as instructed. Upon our arrival at our North Tower room (after a long and confusing hike from the desk to the room elevators), we saw that it was not yet cleaned from the last guests so we deposited our luggage and left again, returning at 4:30 pm to find that it was STILL not cleaned. Since it was then past the “official” check-in time, we went back to the front desk and consulted with the desk clerk who informed us after a call to housekeeping that the room would not be ready for at least a half hour to 45 minutes. After about 15 minutes of waiting in the casino; the front desk called and offered us the use of a standard room that we could use to get ready until our suite was finished by housekeeping. We accepted since we had dinner reservations in less than an hour that we needed to make ourselves presentable for. Given the inconvenience we had already suffered it wasn’t such a great way to begin our stay. However; upon returning to the hotel four hours later, we FINALLY had our suite cleaned, ready and waiting for us. The suite itself was definitely older but then again, so is the hotel so no bones to pick there. Everything was clean and fresh with plenty of linens. The suite was actually two rooms; a bedroom and then a small sitting area with a loveseat, chairs and the sunken Jacuzzi. The bathroom was rather small for a suite but still clean and perfectly functional. (An aside: the standard room that we were forced to make use of for a brief period was definitely smaller all around, including an even smaller bath. That being said, it was still clean and well-maintained.) After the not-so-great beginning, we had no further issues till the end of our stay when we had returned to our room around 4 pm to that it had not been made up by housekeeping. When I called housekeeping to inquire, I was quite rudely told that they had received a “no service” call from our room that day. I assured them that we had made no such call & would like the room to be made up as soon as possible and was told that they would be there within the hour to do so. However, when we arrived back in our room around midnight, the room was still not made up. Another phone call to housekeeping, another assurance that someone would be “right there”. After twenty minutes, housekeeping called our room to tell us that they were in the middle of a shift change and it would be awhile before someone could get there. At 1 am in the morning, we heard a knock at the door. When we opened it, we found a pile of sheets and towels left there. No housekeeper, just linens. Wow. Overview: the hotel is older but seems to be in relatively good condition. It is extremely inexpensive and it's possible to get rooms for as little as $25 a night. Even if you get an upgraded room or suite, it’s still relatively inexpensive especially compared to those hotels on the Strip. The rooms are all clean and have been updated with flat-screen televisions. The hotel has several dining options including an inexpensive 24 hour cafe (Magnolias). We ate there for lunch one time and it was average food quality with very slow waitresses. The casino is fairly large for a down-town hotel but is very poorly laid-out, making it very confusing to learn your way around. We were there for several days before we got our sense of direction and even after that, we had to pay attention to signs and “landmarks” in the casino to find our way to the correct elevator to our room in the North Tower. The slot machines seemed about on-par with other hotels on Fremont as far as payouts although we preferred going to other casinos to do our gambling because we just didn’t care for the casino layout. Also be prepared for cigarette smoke! It’s definitely an issue with all of the older casinos although Four Queens seemed to have a fairly good ventilation system in place. The parking garage is huge and free for guests staying at the hotel; all you have to do is show them your room key when exiting. Most of the employees that we encountered semed to enjoy their jobs and were friendly and helpful; although I will say that housekeeping didn’t really impress us much! All in all, it was just a pretty average hotel. I might stay there again...but I've also stayed at Fitzgeralds and would probably choose it over The Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: neoncheer
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in a basic room at the 4 Queens. It was perfect for one night. The room was clean and well appointed. We had a decent view of the Las Vegas Strip from afar. I'm not sure I could spend more than one night on Freemont Street, but it was a fun expeience. If you are looking for a high class establishment, this is not your place. If you are looking for simple, clean and fun, this place was great and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was tiny.”
Reviews.Author: anetvramos
Reviews.Content: Room was old but clean. Bathroom was tiny, only one person at a time in the bathroom. Casino was good.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs ... never going back”
Reviews.Author: TeraYaworski
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for our room months in advance so we were very surprised when we arrived Sunday night at 1030pm to check in, and they had given our room away. Instead of a non-smoking room with a king bed, we were given a smoking room with two queen beds. The room was disgusting. Reeked of smoke, one bed had no blanket, the lights didn't work. We let the front desk know and they fixed the lights, sprayed the room and gave us a blanket. Found out when I went to bed that the blanket on my bed was saturated in someone else's body odor. I spent the night trying not to vomit. Happy birthday to me. The next morning we spoke to the front desk and we were upgraded to a lovely suite. It was nice and we were happy. We tried to be out of the room so housekeeping could come clean but around 2pm we decided to have a nap. Of course that's when they showed up and because we were in the room, no cleaning was done. We had to request later that someone come in and at least make our bed. We went to Magnolia's for food, but the service was slow, the waiter got both of our orders wrong, and the next time we tried to eat there, they were closed for the night for maintenance, despite being a 24 hour cafe. On day two I noticed a bunch of welts on my calf. I assumed they were mosquito bites but after researching when we got home, they turned out to be bed bug bites. I've contacted management but am still waiting for a response from them. On our last day we arranged a shuttle with the bellman. The shuttle ended up being behind an hour and the bellman scrambled to find us another one. Thanks to him we didn't miss our flight. This was my birthday as well as wedding anniversary and staying at the 4 Queens was a huge mistake. This was our 3rd time in Vegas and we won't ever stay on Fremont street again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaLeigh615
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute so were stuck with a smoking rooms but survived. Casino was nice with plenty of gaming tables. Room was average but comfortable and the price was right. I would recommend Fremont St. if you want a good price and don't mind staying off the strip. The Duece is a bus that runs 24 hrs and is very convenient for getting down to las Vegas blvd. $7 will get you a 24 HR pass. The hotel has a diner (very yummy and good prices) a romantic establishment, and a brewery. The other casinos on Fremont also have dinin options. The Fremont experience was awesome. All the street preformers and the live music opened up the floor for some great people watching opportunities. The drinks are flowing, the food is decent, and Fremont st is deffinately something that everyone should experience at Least once. The four queens is a good place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrdbake
Reviews.Content: An older hotel, part of the original "Strip", that's been kept in pretty good shape. During the week you can get a $25 a night rate on the hotel's website. Cleanliness: 7. I give it a 7 out of 10 for an older hotel. If it were a new hotel I'd give it a 5. Nothing gross. Service: 7. The dealers are mostly foreigners and not much in the personality department. Restaurants had good service. Food: 8. Magnolias does a $7.95 Prime Rib dinner every night($8.95 if not a club member). Chicago Brew Co. does a pretty decent pizza. I do quite a bit of business in Vegas and always stay here. You just can't beat the price. Plus, it's on Fremont St.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next trip!”
Reviews.Author: Szyque
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Just returned from a 3 night stay. After a 5 hour flight, we were pleasantly surprised that our room was available for check-in at 10am. The front desk woman was pleasant and offered a complimentary parking pass. Our friends arrived one night prior and when I booked my reservation I requested that our rooms be assigned near and was happy that our rooms were directly across from each other. Comfy bed, clean room, great location for a very low price! We've stayed on the strip at the Wynn, Mandalay, Mirage, MGM.. but prefer 4Queens! The $ we saved on the room we used for gambling, shopping and taking in a show. We met a couple that we're staying at the Paris but chose to gamble downtown since the blackjack minimums were too high on the strip and they were in shock when we told them the price we paid for our room. Yes, the Fremont street light show & music is loud and can be heard in the rooms, but you're in Vegas and if you expected quiet evenings then maybe downtown is not the place for you. If you're looking for complimentary cocktails, low table minimums, cheap eats and festive atmosphere then this is the place. We travel to Vegas every year and we're already looking forward to our next trip. Thank you Four Queens!!

Reviews.Title: “So Pleasantly Surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anitalilly
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at the hotels on Fremont street , only the strip and were very happy with the choice. Our room was very clean, the casino and restaurant were very nice.It was actually a much less chaotic experience than the strip. Much more classy than I expected. Evenings get busy but daytime is pretty quiet . Lots to do and see but not near as hard as walking with the crowds on the strip.. Will go back and explore more.Fun!!

Reviews.Title: “No water and RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamJen1970
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the four queens , we noticed a very irrate individual involved in a heated conversation with the woman at the front desk. Our first thoughts were he is drunk and where is security when you need them. As the conversation continued we got closer and now could hear what was making the man upset, no running water and the whole building. At this time we advised the woman at the front desk that we wouldn't be checking in if there wasn't any water, to which she replied, " fine, but we will have to bill you for cancelling". This was her first mistake and customer relations 101, her next mistake was telling a young man who asked if he could have bottled water due to the fact they had no water, she advised him to go to the casino bar and they had water, here's the kicker, she wanted him to pay for it. Long story short we called expedia who not only changed our hotel, but gave us 100 dollars off our next trip, 25 dollar voucher for travel and upgraded our room to a two room suite next door at the Golden Nugget. Thanks to expedia the trip was great and I would never advise anyone to stay at the Four Queens, a terrbile place.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing royal about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripWrangler
Reviews.Content: My husband, two friends and I reserved rooms several months in advance so we would have a guaranteed destination at the midpoint of a two week road trip. From the website and other sources it looked to be a great balance of cost and amenities. What a disappointment. Our "deluxe" room had no seating other than two wobbly desk chairs, no working alarm clock and only one functioning bedside lamp. The bad lamp and clock were plugged into a household extension cord which was (apparently) plugged to a broken outlet located beneath an immovable bed pedestal. The king bed was made up with stained queen sheets and a sticky bedspread. The walls were badly scuffed all around the bed, and there had clearly been no attempts at repair the damage. The bathroom was also a deluxe mess. The countertop was newly redone but not clean, the floor was dirty, the visibly dirty tub had been ineffectually disguised by an equally dirty vinyl mat, the showerhead dripped, and a dirty wash cloth was hanging from the shower curtain bar. The room was not even supplied with a bath mat. The whole carpet was damp underfoot and the air was so heavily scented with deodorizer I was worried about mold. We soon learned that the dampness was due to a very recent carpet cleaning. One of our group was assignd a room that he discovered was still so wet that it contained two industrial (loud!) blower fans. When he complained at the desk, he was told the fans could not be removed because 'engineering' was not in the building. Since his room was uninhabitable, he was assigned a different room and then informed that he would have to present himself at the front desk the next day between noon and 1PM to switch rooms yet again. After a late dinner and some temper-wrestling, further enquiries were made. It was revealed that he did not -have- to change rooms, but because his new room was in a different section, it was not considered deluxe -- but -- he could not be refunded the difference in price if he stayed there. No explanation was ever given for why this option hadn't been mentioned earlier, nor for why the hotel refused a refund for their error. Simliar communication troubles had started at check-in. We rolled into town at 8 pm after a day of hiking and driving; all ready for hot showers, cold drinks and clean beds. We had been assured by phone a week before arrival that it would be no problem to get our reserved deluxe rooms near each other and that free wifi would be available, but at check-in it turned out that rooms with king beds meant 3 rooms on 3 different floors and the wifi was $9 a day. Then came the scary news that online reservations were being dropped/lost and the staff were not even certain ours were in the system. We might have been better off if they'd lost our info. The desk staff tried to be helpful when I informed them of the broken outlet, but their only suggestion -- to attempt repairs during our stay -- was absurd, given that we had ample cause to doubt the maintenance staff's competence already. Avoid this hotel if you can. The low price and the fun of being near Fremont St, if it can be deemed fun when the show goes on until 2AM and the hotel has inferior soundproofing, does not come close to making up for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you get a great price”
Reviews.Author: brbarnes
Reviews.Content: They had a $25 per night when we stayed. Rooms were clean and did not have any problems. There is a McDonalds and Walgreens in walking distance. Enjoyed the Fremont concerts and sights. It is difficult getting through the casino from the parking garage to the room elevators, but this is Vegas. Parking garage is easy to get in and out of onto the street. Would stay again for sure at this price and location! No free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: donnalasvegas6512
Reviews.Content: Booked a room because of the low price and remodeled rooms. We're locals who like to try different properties in Vegas. We asked for a room that had a view of the Fremont Street Experience, and yes it was noisy, but we had a perfect view of the show every hour and a great spot to people watch. Show ends at 12am so if you want to go to bed early, the North Tower is not for you, but for us, it was so fun to be able to see all the action down below us. The room was small but clean and comfortable with a few good cable tv channels to watch. My only complaint was the surprise that we would be charged $3 to park there, which was not disclosed to us when we booked the room and the lady at registration was kind of rude and unapologetic about it which makes me think they get alot of complaints about it. The staff in general there seemed to be grumpy and unfriendly. No one I dealt with said hello, thank you or good luck. But grumpy employees aside, we enjoyed our time there and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: azeddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Queens from June 9th - 12th on the recommendation of a friend. After reading some of the reviews I was anxious about my stay, but decided to give the Four Queens and the Freemont Street Experience a chance. Let me say the Four Queens is not the Venetian/Palazzo, or the Bellagio, or Caesar's Palace nor did I pay the rates the high end strip resorts demand. I was greeted by Jennifer (i think) at the reception desk and did the $20 trick asking her simply for a comfortable quiet room where I can rest when I am tired. I had read reviews saying the noise on Freemont Street can be bothersome in the evening. Jennifer gave me room 1042 in the south tower and the $20 back telling me "I don't need a tip to give you a quiet, comfortable room." I was surprised at this level of professionalism and courteously which I have never seen on the strip. Had Jennifer kept the $20 I would have considered the money well spent as the room was wonderful. Room 1042 in the south tower is easily large enough for me with a pillow top king size bed. The room was clean and in good condition with a good view out the window. The bathroom is small, but it is clean and in good condition with good water pressure. The entertainment on Freemont Street was great from the three stages with the bands to the Sax player and the various interesting people to watch. The gambling in the casinos is good with lower minimums on the table games than on the strip often with dealers who were often very pleasant and helpful. In short the Four Queens has a new customer and will be a go to place for me in future visits to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Will go back”
Reviews.Author: FrontRoow
Reviews.Content: I booked a KS, NS room for four nights and got the North Tower for $29 a night (M-Th). The hotel / hallways / room was clean and cool. Check-in was friendly and quick. There was NO Resort Fee and parking was FREE (eventhough the 4Qs website says $3/nite). I got a FUNBOOK and saved some bucks ($10 MatchPlay coupon, 2-4-1 Dinner AND Breakfast at Magnolia's, etc.). Plus I asked for and got lots of EXTRAS while joining the Players Club Card ($10 FREE Slot play, which I netted $5 AND buy $10 to get $15 in chips for table games AND 2-4-1 Dinner at Magnolia's). I recommend the PrimeRib and Ribeye steaks, which end up costing $5/person and the portions were genererous. The waitstaff was always fast and courteous so I tipped extra. The lineup into Magnolia's looks long (~50 ft) in the evenings, but we were usually seated in 20-30 minutes. The music from Fremont St. does gets loud from 7pm til 2am (I was on the 9th floor). Stuff some tissues in your ears or bring ear plugs just in case. There is FREE WIFI across the street at the McDonalds in Fitzgeralds. The screen over Fremont Street provides shade for those blazing hot summer days. And of course at night it is tranformed into a giant screen about three blocks long. The Zipline, DJs, live bands and street performers create an exciting atmosphere. At the end of my trip, checkout was quick at 10am and I tipped the Garage Attendant on my way out. Felt that I had to show Vegas some love. I WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “"Can a Trip Be This Good?"”
Reviews.Author: IchabodCraneSH
Reviews.Content: We arrived seven hours before check-in, hoping to check our bags... and they had our room ready for us! We were expecting a lower quality of room for the bargain rates... we were really pleased. Every member of the staff was very friendly and the location for a Fremont Street hotel could not have been better. We were very very happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Older but well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Tiers
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was pleasant and check-in was fast and simple. We had booked two regular rooms for 5 nights and when we were checking in, the lady at the front desk up-graded both rooms, at no addition cost, to suites due to the length of time we were visiting. We normally stay on the Strip and decided to change our habit. So, we booked the Four Queens on Fremont Street. The Four Queens does not have the elegant style that the Strip hotels have and it is definitely older than most of the hotels on the Strip. Nevertheless, I was completely impressed with the hotel and the stay. Our room was clean and spacious and the hotel was clean for its age. I would recommend that you try to book a room facing away from Fremont Street due to the noise from the light show and the live bands that play on Fremont Street. Overall I would definitely stay here again when I’m in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: No1Fox
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not difficult to find, nor was the multi-story car park. You do have to walk several hundred yards from the car park to the hotel/casino as there is almost never any room at the hotel entrance to stop and drop off your luggage. The price of the room was reasonable. When we were given our keys, I noticed the room number was 1701 and asked if it was at the far end of the hallway or the end nearest the elevator. As I had asked for a non-smoking quiet room, I hoped for the best. When told it was nearest the elevator and ice machine, I asked to be moved towards the opposite end. Thank goodness I did and they had a better room available as the elevator and ice machine were being used 24/7. The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable. The biggest problem started about 9 p.m. every evening. The music and street noise from the Fremont Street Experience (right outside the front door) got so loud you could hear it on the 17th floor in a room facing away from the activity on Fremont Street. It carried on until about 3 a.m. every night. Unfortunately, this hotel was built before the right type of wall and window insulation was available (like the type used at newer airport hotels where you can't hear jets!). All in all, the best thing about this hotel was the food. The prime rib was fabulous and cheap at $7.99 on the Thursday night we had it. The other meals we had there were also great and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: rich0976
Reviews.Content: another trip to the four queens this time for six days the rooms are small and sparsely furnshed but clean and well maintained.everything works, but they really need to do some refurbishing.the bell desk and valet parking are very efficient. housekeeping is excellent.the casino and resturants are very good.the four queens is a good choice down town. rh

Reviews.Title: “four queens best for buck”
Reviews.Author: foxwoods2l4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Four Queens again this year from June 8th till June 14th and the experience was the same great! Kimmy and Mike at the Chicago cigar bar are still the best in vegas for service and hospitality.Food at Magnolais is still excellent and 2 for 1 is even betterWe also staayed at Fremont and what a let down sends me back to old faithful Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: world_in_my_eyes
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Four Queens and Fremont Street and probably our last. Everyone at the hotel was very nice but I don't think we will stay there again. I went into it knowing that it was an older hotel and not super luxurious or anything. The rooms were small, dark, and the bed was old and bouncy. It was clean. There was a coffee maker which you don't always find in rooms on the Strip and a newer TV. We liked the Fremont Street Experience but the crowd was not really our speed. The people partying in the street with their infants & toddlers disturbed me. If you like people watching, this is the place to come. Personally, I prefer the Strip but I did want to try Fremont Street at least once. Overall, I think the hotel was fine, but the Fremont St. vibe was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pualani4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dimly lit, a little too dark for my taste but I guess that is how the all night gamblers like it. Fremont Experience is right outside the door which made it great.
