The zip lines were just a couple steps away also. Souvenir shops are plentiful around that area. Casinos and restaurants are plentiful which makes it easy hopping from one place to another.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Four Queens and can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: kenny264
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Four Queens. This is my third stay at the Hotel and I always have fun. Magnolia's is great for breakfast, the prime rib wasn't as good as it usually is but the other menu items were good. The casino is fun and Fremont street was hopping even on a Monday night!!! My room was nice and clean. When you book your room ask for one in the South Tower it is nice and quiet. You can catch the Duece bus not far from the Fitz and head out to the strip. This is my favorite hotel downtown!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprized on Fremont street”
Reviews.Author: LeafsFan82
Reviews.Content: We booked into a standard room at 4 Queens mostly because of the price, and wanted to take in old downtown Vegas this time around. I loved it! I don't normally stay at Vegas hotels twice but I would consider staying at the 4Q again. The room was small (I'm used to suite's) but comfortable. Soft beds, good water pressure, cold air conditioning, and a window that opened.. very strange for Vegas. Some things were a little dated but nothing was really worn, added to the charm of the old place. The restaurants were very good, especially the prime rib special - one of the best in town for the price anyway. We also got a fun book with our room and ate 2/4/1 the whole time we were here. Beer lovers must also check out the micro brewery, very good suds! Fremont street isn't the strip, but if you prefer the gambling or party over the glitz and glam it's worth a stay, especially at the 4Q!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Joli6
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it was in the "real" Las Vegas, it was not expensive and we had Avis at the hotel - close to rent a car. It was a very good experience for a first-comer! Fremont Experience is FANTASTIC! With all the music and all the lights.When we were there it was 42-43 degrees Celsius so it was good to have a roof when you left the hotel. The hotel had all we needed. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Family/Friends VB 2011”
Reviews.Author: mkdwils
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed at 4Queens. Nice rooms and attentive staff. Great food and service at Magnolia's. With Royal Player's card, food was even less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I've won twice here so it's my favourite place Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Bee_Middlesex_UK
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas five times now but this is the first time we had stayed Downtown and were a bit unsure what to expect. OK, so it was not a Vegas Strip hotel with all the flashy luxury extra touches but the room was cheap, it was reasonably clean (not counting the tobacco stained net curtains) and, hey, we're in Vegas, we're not there to spend all day in a hotel room. The staff throughout, from the reception and porters to the restaurant & bar staff and the croupiers were all very friendly and polite. Whenever I am in Vegas, I always get the impression that people are genuinely pleased to serve you. Ideal location, right on Fremont Street although it must be said you cannot hear the music and mayhem from inside the hotel room. Fabulous breakfasts to be had at Magnolias Veranda restaurant (the front booths overlook the poker tables weirdly enough!). There's a micro-brewery in the casino, Chicagos, which also serves pizzas, the biggest garlic dough balls I've ever seen, club sandwiches, fries and the other staples of an American diet. We ordered "beer flights", which was a set of 7 different "sampler sized" beers and then once we found our favourites (Allnighter and Old Town Brown), we went on to order the 64oz Growler of each. The croupiers in the casino were very happy to show you how to play the table games and didn't make you feel as if you were getting in the way or holding up play. There's also a lot of low stake slots (video poker was our favourite). It was a good hotel and ideal for the Downtown area (the real Vegas). The Deuce bus was cheap and regular for trips to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A great adult playground.”
Reviews.Author: randi_0
Reviews.Content: Freindly, helpful staff, clean affordable rooms. Good security. Had a great stay,willbe recomending this hotel to freinds,and fellow poker players.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for chick weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: needtovacation
Reviews.Content: We were 2 females traveling for a quick "chick weekend" getaway. We were looking for clean, secure,SAFE for females traveling solo and a good location. We found that here at the 4 queens. It's right on the Freemont Experience for nightlife...the casino has a brew pub with a good bartender MIKE who took great care of us. Great beer and pizza. The food at Magnolia's was fine 2x1 coupons for breakfast,and 2x1's for lunch/dinner entrees, and we got a 2 for one coupon from the front desk and used it for the brew pub beers. Shopping is close by for souveniers. Nightlife is right there by being on the street or wandering in/out of all the casino's, and barhopping. From 8:00 p.m. till 1 p.m. or so there are 3-4 band playing in different locations right on the Freemont street experience. Lots of artists doing their things, the zipline running etc.. Very well lit and safe here. The bus stop is close by in two locations you buy your bus pass from a dispenser at the bus stop super easy. Super clean buses. Take the DEUCE ($7.00 unlimited for the day p/p) all the way from Las Vegas Blvd by our hotel all the way down the strip to Mandalay bay for a great site seeing tour on your own for cheap. We sat on the top deck in the front seat...perfect view. Get on and off as many times as you want w/ your bus card. Plenty to do and see on the strip for the $7.00 fare. Don't bother w/ a taxi lots of $$ and the buses were actually faster it seemed as they have a bus lane in many locations. Another day we took the bus to the North Outlet malls..very nice shopping area. New and lots of choices for name brands. Not far from our hotel by bus. If you are expecting "upscale" this is not the location for you, plan on staying on the strip and paying 3x the price. If you are good with Basic, clean, secure, good location for fun this is what you are looking for. We bought a bundle package online thru orbitz, including airfare and it was a very good deal. Rooms were very,very clean. Maids came daily. The rooms are a bit dated with floral pix, bedspread etc...but who cares we used the room to shower, and sleep. We wanted clean and secure...we got it! We got a fun book from the front desk and we used many of the coupons from it : magnolias, brew pub, Match play etc...well worth it. Again...If you are looking for fluffy, frills...go to the strip. For good, fun, LOTS less busy location stay here or even the Gold Nugget. Cheers! Safe travels to you.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable just not Exciting”
Reviews.Author: FollowMyGPS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Four Queens Las Vegas. Had a Petite Suite for $99 night. Most downtown hotels have an AAA discount but don't publish it on their websites so calling for a reservation is best as this gave me an additional 10% off the posted rate. The hotel is in reasonable condition but there is no hiding its age. The room was in the South Tower and was spacious and included a mini fridge, wet bar and coffee maker. The bed was passable, although newer mattresses would certainly help. The bathroom was a more worn than the rest of the room but I did not experience significant drain issues as reported by others. Housekeeping showed up 2 out of 4 days which I found somewhat odd. The casino area is relatively small by Las Vegas standards but the Golden Nugget, Binion's and Fremont are less than 200 feet from the doors of the Four Queens. Travel on the elevators was always expedient. I wouldn't consider the hotel "luxurious" by Las Vegas standards; even the suite was rather banal but sufficient. The staff service level (other than housekeeping) was very good. Room service was very expedient and although not expensive, it was not particularly inexpensive. Valet parking was very quick and efficient. I ate at Magnolia's once, it was acceptable. Wait staff was very efficient. Did not utilize any of the other restaurants. As a "downtown hotel" it would be a "top 3" pick relative to the others (Golden Nugget being a strong first choice) and I would consider staying here again for the right price. I would like to see a little more attention to details particularly in the housekeeping areas throughout the hotel, not just the rooms. What the hotel fundamentally lacks though is something to get excited about. It is acceptable and functional but there is just not much of a "Wow" factor. If you are on a budget and like staying downtown it would be an acceptable choice for the price unless you are expecting more of an "experience" in your hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Quality”
Reviews.Author: TVtraveler15
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how clean, tidy and comfortable the rooms were at 4 Queens. The Magnolia Cafe had very good food at very reasonable prices. I've stayed at many other Fremont Street Hotels with budget prices (the cost of 4 Queens was $44 on Hotels.com) and usually been pleased with the savings; but disappointed in the quality of the hotel. Old carpets, dirty bathrooms, fraying wall paper, and the appearance of being run down is the norm. At 4 Queens, this was not the case at all. My only disappointment was the lack of a swimming pool. I recall that there used to be a pool on the roof - but I suppose it must be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: vipers_2
Reviews.Content: After years of staying at hotels on the Strip, we decided that we have more fun at the casinos downtown so we decided to stay at the Four Queens. We were not disappointed. It is an older hotel so the rooms can't compare with some of the newer hotels, but our room was clean and well maintained. The bed was comfortable. Check-in and check-out were quick and painless. I'm not sure who the rude receptionist referred to in the previous review was, but we didn't meet her. We ate at Magnolia's Restaurant and the Chicago Brew Pub and we were happy with both the food and the service. The location is extremely convenient. There were probably six casinos that we could get to in less time than it took us to get out to the street from a room in one of the megahotels on the Strip. We always have a great time gambling at the Four Queens and we will probably stay here again the next time we come to Vegas. In summary, if you want a high-end hotel, you might want to go somewhere else. If you are not planning on spending a lot of time in your hotel room, the Four Queens is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat trip; Always Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Wgou
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd or 4th time I've stayed at the 4 Queens. It's convenient, the rooms are quite serviceable, the staff has always been courteous and helpful. I like the convenience of many possible casinos in downtown within walking distance. Hugo's Celler, their upscale restaurant equals many on the strip and is a lot less trouble to get into. Service is great. If you're looking for a good deal for your money, this is it. If you're looking for a five star hotel, there are none in downtown LV and you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Billbojr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different hotels in las vegas In the past 30 years. The four queens has been the worse by far! When we arrived they did not have my reservations, that took 1 hour for them to fix. The entire place was old and wore out looking. The staff were very rude. Magnolias restaraunt had to be the rudest out of all of them! it took for ever to get our order taken and when she brought our meals to us, she literally dropped our plates and drinks on the table and we never seen her again. Our mattress was slanted on both sides with a cone shape in the middle of the bed. we both were sliding off all night! ( i'm not making this up) and we paid $95.00 for 1 night! this place is a big stink whole of a hotel. It should be leveled and rebuilt. Please folks look hard before you make reservations anywhere in Las vegas! You work hard for your money you deserve to be treated well where ever you stay In las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Security at the Four Queens is horrible.”
Reviews.Author: hrogersjr
Reviews.Content: I had my wallet lifted at the hotel in the early morning hours and proceeded straight to the first security guard I could find. He accused me of pandering, and refused to take a statement from me. After complaining he brought me to a secluded spot and called the police so I could talk to them. During this call, two different security guards took the phone from me a total of three times, each time, one of them threatened me with bodily harm. After the phone call, which resulted in the police essentially telling me I had to go to a station to file a complaint, one of the security guards got in my face and threatened me again, and then they escorted me out, all the while continually threatening me with bodily harm. Not only will I never enter that property again, but I advise everyone else to do the same. The place is run by thugs.

Reviews.Title: “4 star looks, 1 star price!”
Reviews.Author: NWtraveller83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens in July 2010. We didn't know what to expect, but had paid $20 a night (sale price) so were a bit apprehensive about the quality of the rooms etc. The Four Queens is located in the oldest part of Las Vegas on the corner of the famous "Fremont Street experience", which has the largest video display in the world (really quite something and worth a look). THE AREA: Fremont street, is a bit of a way off the strip and slightly less convenient, but worth it for the cheaper prices. There are still plenty of casinos and bars but fewer places to eat. THE HOTEL: The Four Queens has the grandeur of the old style hotels, while still feeling fairly modern. It has it's own casino downstairs and two restaurants. The food is OK but it's on the same level as TGI Fridays or Frankie and Benny's. We were a bit disappointed as the restaurant itself looks a bit more upmarket than that. There is a gift shop that's not too expensive and parking is ample. Room service is available. There isn't a pool but you can use the pool at the Four Queen's sister hotel across the road. This is on the rooftop and there are amazing views of Las Vegas. THE ROOM: I was really pleased with our room which was huge, with glass and gold rim furnishings. We had a flat screen TV and a very nice bathroom. The room was spotlessly clean and had a daily maid service. We could access WIFI from our room but it was very expensive (apparently this is the same in most Vegas hotels). Overall, if you can get a sale price on a room (I hear these are quite frequent), then you really can get a Vegas bargain here. I'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens was more than I had expected great place to stay and eat”
Reviews.Author: penwicks
Reviews.Content: After reading many different reviews wife and i decided on the 4 Queens. We could have not made a better decision. The room was spotless, no need to bring your pillows, both the pillow and bed was very comfortable, May have added a few pounds, food was great. We stayed for a week and cannot wait to return to Las Vegas and the 4 Queens. One small problem being 6 ft /230 lb. it would be nice to have an injector toitel seat, to help getting up from the throne it's a long way down

Reviews.Title: “Another Solid Stay at Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Cratt97
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two queen room in the North tower. Check in was quick and efficient. We had a very entertaining view of the Mcdonald's at Fitzgeralds. Great people watching. The room and beds were quite comfortable. The bathrooms could use some spiffing up but they are clean and adequate. The service in the casino is generally good, although we did come across one bartender who wanted $3 for a tiny bottle of water. Seemed as if he was having a bad night. Aside from that, great drink service and friendly bartenders and dealers on the floor. I definitely recommend beers, garlic knots and pizza at Chicago Brewing, but its worth noting that they allow cigars so, be prepared. Its also worth participating in the players club if you are going to game a reasonable amount. They provide nice benefits and the staff at the club is great. This was my fourth stay and I will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: BruceManor_texas
Reviews.Content: For the value and location we had a great time. Staff was very freindly and helpful and casino was placed just right. Food was execlant and service right on time. Had family join us made it even better. I will go again when I can.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - especially for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ladd25
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and served its purpose well. Let's be honest, its a basic room and would never be considered fancy. But the showers had hot water and you receive plenty of coupons for the diner, Magnolia's for some decent, filling, basic meals to start your day. If you are going to have a problem with minor inconveniences like water draining slowly from the shower, you may want to head up to the strip and stay someplace with granite and silver for much more $.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxwoods2l4
Reviews.Content: Great old hotel and casino! For the price no better around and everyone was so friendly.At the end of my stay the host wanted to give me the whole week comped but i with my master mind booked thru hotel.com and she could not do it.This June when igo out i booked everything on its own so i get my comps.The Chicago cigar bar i had a blast and very reasonable.This year a have friend out with me so it should be better.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: debster805
Reviews.Content: ThefFact that I was charged MORE than what I was quoted is my first concern. The 2nd is the fact that they charged me for a night that i did not even stay there. When I spoke to the manager (Walt is his name) about this charge he clearly told me "Im afraid but this will be your last visit to the Four Queens because I will not be refunding you the night stay." When we arrived our room (room # 133) had a view of a 24 oz. can of Miller Light beer and a tagged up wall. The rooms are horrily small and old. The wall paper was peeling off the walls, I didnt even want to srep on the floor without shoes or slippers because of the scum on the carpets and there was hair of others left behind on our bed, the bath tub and the floor of our rest room. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND STAYING AT THE GOLDEN NUGGET IF YOU PREFER STAYING DOWNTOWN LAS VEGAS! The customer service is 210% better than the Four Queens. The Golden Nugget will make your stay and expierence even more enjoyable! I MADE THE MISTAKE TO OVERLOOK SOME OF THE REVIEWS ON HERE I SUGGEST YOU NOT OVER LOOK MINE!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love , love Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Emcasino
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister for a 2 night, 3 day stay. In the past I have stayed on the strip (TI) and downtown (Fitzgerald's). For the price, we chose the 4 Queens. My sister had never really experienced Fremont Street so I was excited & a little anxious about her reactions. What a great trip! The 4 Queens, while undeniably old, was welcoming, clean and comfortable. We were in the South Tower, away from Fremont Street. The room was just fine for a quick Vegas trip. The bathroom was a little small when the two of us were in there getting ready in the morning, but, hey, this is not the Strip. Beds were extremely comfortable -no bugs. The few times we dealt with the front desk personnel, they were both friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the coupon book and ate at Magnolias (breakfast & soup & sandwiches were delicious) and Binions (burgers & fries very good). We are not fancy eaters so bargain dining was right up our alley. We took the free shuttle from The Fremont to Sams Town for a great time & ended up on the Strip. We spent half our time on the Strip seeing those hotels we wanted to see, but always enjoyed heading back down to Fremont Street. The intimacy down there allowed us to go our separate ways at times and meet without having to walk blocks & waste time. The entertainment was great (spray paint artists were amazing). We visited each of the downtown casinos and, although, The Plaza was a sad sight, you can see how elegant they were "back in the day". A "must see" is Mermaids. What a ball we had there. Coins still come out of slots and hands get dirty-just like the good old days. Best attention we got for drinks (waited 30 minutes for 2 Diet Cokes at Palazzo). A definite good time & Mardi Gras beads for all. The slots were just as tight downtown as on the Strip so no winning trip for me but had the best time. My sister is now a great Fremont Street fan. Bottom line is - whatever you're looking for you can find it in Vegas. If glitz is your thing, the Strip is where it's at. For me, I'll stay downtown every time.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at 4 Queens!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmychips
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in Nov because I can't imagine going to Vegas without some quality DT time. Checked in at 6:00pm was very easy. I was given a north tower room on the 19th floor. The room was a good size with a 32" flat screen but no sitting or lounge area & bathroom was a little small. The room was very clean & beds were comfortable. The casino is the same as I remember from 2 years ago but regretfully I didn't play much there, spent more time gambling at Golden Gate. All in all I would have no problem staying at 4 Queens in the future they offer fine rooms at a decent price but I will probabally end up going back to the Fitz next time because Fitz rooms are bigger & offer sitting areas & can have great views.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning again!”
Reviews.Author: Southwedge
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Las Vegas, for over 15 years or so, until last year. I decided to check out the Four Queens, and have returned for 5 visits within the last year or so! The location is great! Easy to get around. Transportation to and from the strip, but had more fun in the Fremont Street area. The staff at the Four Queens from the registration desk to houskeeping staff were very accomodating. Maganolia's was my place of choice for breakfast every morning! My room was definitely spacious and clean. The Casion floor staff were very customer-friendly and helpful. Great cocktails and fun slots! Making plans for another visit very soon. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: noble3771
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay on Freemont Street rather than the strip. The Four Queens was very nice. The bed was comfortable & the shower worked, which is all we need when we are in Vegas. You want fancy rooms and lots of luxury, stay on the strip. You want free entertainment every nite and less expensive rooms, stay on Freemont Street. The prime rib at Magnolias in the Four Queens was excellent. Great hotel and casino to stay, eat and play!!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: STACII28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great clean and the staff was even better we stayed for 7 days and not one thing went wrong we had so much fun the slots were fun we won money and the food at the hotel was great. I cant not wait to go back this year I will stay at this hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “teriible stay”
Reviews.Author: DestryC
Reviews.Content: I will never be back, security and the front desk treated me like a criminal when I forgot my key in the room and needed back in, Rodney specifically was incredibly rude, I can not believe I was treated so poorly by a place that I was paying to stay, seriously very, very, not happy with service and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: pgirl1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Queens January 31-February 3 for 3 nights with my husband. Purchased trip through Allegiant Air out of Fresno and paid $224 for round trip flight and 3 nights at the hotel. My in-laws traveled with us and paid $204 for round trip and 3 nights. We asked for a room in the south tower which has the temperature controls in the room. Check in staff accomodated our request to have rooms close by. They offered adjoining rooms but we selected rooms across the hall from each other. We were put on the 15th floor facing the Fitz parking garage but has a nice view of the downtown and the tall strip casinos. Very quite and well kept room. Bed was comfortable and pillows were good. Easy access from the elevators. Rooms were clean with flat screen TV and a coffee maker (with coffee supplies). The bathroom was a bit small and utilitarian but clean. Sheets were clean (no bed bugs), room was clean, and furniture was good. Definitely a good deal for the price. I would stay again. Don't miss the zip lining that is available in front of the CVS on the strip. Great deal for $15 day time and $20 evening. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “More Things Change More they Stay the Same”
Reviews.Author: elliott78212
Reviews.Content: I can tell you these rooms are bigger than some and smaller than others this time I had a room near the freemont street it was noisy. I wasn't uncomfortable but since I stay up late but it was noisy trying to watch tv. My bathroom overflowed but they took care of it right away I have stayed her more than a dozen times. Machines were loser than my last visit but I guess the economy has affected how many drink staff is walking the floor and the waiters in the Magnolia Cafe. I had some solid low end wins on several quarter and penny machines nothing mindblowing but enough to keep me playing and I brought back $300 out of my $700 gambling budget that is a plus on any trip. They do have flat screen tv's in every room. Bed Bugs have plaqued many hotels both high end and mid range so I took the precaution of checking my bed and keeping my bags off the floor on the luggage stand in closet was best using drawers for my dirty clothes and putting them in a bag on my return home. Bed bugs are a serious problem all over the country and as a smart traveler you need to take responsibility not just blame the hotel and you need to report it to staff immediately. My own brother had an experience in another hotel and never reported it I was so mad at him. I enjoyed my stay and recieved an nice offer to return in March which I'm planning on doing.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ladybug8282
Reviews.Content: For $34/night you get what you pay for. The rooms are nothing to write home to mama about. The room we stayed in had what looked like blood streaks on the wall. The sinks do not drain at all, and the knob on the faucet eaisly came on and off. I brushed my teeth and when I looked back in the sink the water was almost to the top of the sink. After my shower I stepped onto a soaking wet floor. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

Reviews.Title: “Love Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: tagalong48
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and casino!!! Fun everywhere you look and walk!! Rooms are clean and comfortable. Not going to be the best rooms in the city...but very comfortable to sleep and shower in which is all you need when in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NightLion
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens has been my top choice for a Las Vegas hotel for several years. I'm a mid-rolling video poker player and I always get excellent mailed offers for free room & food. This trip I stayed in a suite, which is somewhat larger than the regular room and includes a refrigerator. The casino is excellent, with good games, perhaps the best cashback in town, and good comps. Magnolia's restaurant is good, and the Chicago Brewing Company is excellent. The room service menu has all of Magnolia's menu at only a slight markup. Employees are all friendly. Only drawback is that the Fremont Street Experience light show is pretty loud, and runs hourly until midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: AngelBMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs...thats's what my body went through after staying here. I thought it was reasonably priced. The room was not very clean, but for the price, I accepted that and simply complained to the front desk. After my stay, my body was covered with small red sores...it's not worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BikerKaye
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the comments on TripAdvisor, I was afraid the 4 Queens was little better than a flop house. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. Yes, it's older. Yes, the bathroom is small. Yes, I found a tiny corner of the wallpaper peeling. It is NOT The Bellagio, nor are you CHARGED like The Bellagio. I liked that we could valet at the front door, with check in only a few steps away. Elevators to the rooms were right across from check in. No half-mile hike to the room like the Hard Rock or Bellagio. Our room was comparable to a Holiday Inn. Nothing fancy, but clean and everything worked. The staff from the valet to front desk to housekeeping were great. We had New Year's Eve dinner in Hugo's Cellar. Very romantic, awesome menu with 5 star food and impeccable service. Magnolia's is open 24 hours serving a variety. (Love having a decent place to go at 3:00 a.m.!) Pizza was great at Chicago Brewing Company and you MUST order the root beer. It was the best ever! Some of the reviewers here should never leave the certainty of their own homes! Nit-picking whiners!

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: gk1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 4 Queens from 12/16 to 12/19/2010. I really wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprized. Staff was friendly and helpful (especially the Players Club staff) and comps were decent (like 2 for 1 at Magolia's). Food was good, not great, at Magnolia's. Really enjoyed the prime rib ($7.95) and breakfast was very good. Went to the Chicago Brewery. Not a big fan of the microbrews but the pizza was excellent. Casino was nice but just played slots there (went to Fitzgeralds and Binions for roulette and craps as they had lower limits). The location was excellent. You're not going to find a better location on downtown Fremont as you are definitely in the middle of everything. Overall I was very pleased and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Horrible Room”
Reviews.Author: ninjakitty12
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on previous reviews here, location, parking and value. I only paid $36 a night, so I knew it wasn't going to be anything like the Bellagio. Location: Old Vegas. On Fremont Street. The location is fantastic. We rented a car. The Four Queens is one of the only hotels in Las Vegas that charge a parking fee. That's good if you are staying at the hotel, because then there is always a parking spot. As a guest at the hotel, you get a VIP pass, so parking is free. The hotel is situated under the VivaVision Canopy of Fremont Street, and it is so wonderful to take an elevator down to the lobby, walk out through the casino and onto Fremont Street. Staff: Fantastic. Always smiling, very professional. If you even looked over at the Bell Desk, the staff would smile and ask if you needed anything. And if you had any questions or needed anything, you were helped right away. Check-in was a breeze. Rooms: Horrible. When we checked in, we asked the lady for a room with the best view. She was super nice but said that we could have a King Suite overlooking Fremont Street, but we would not be able to control the temperature and it's FREEZING. Also, Fremont side: you hear music 24 hours a day. Or we could have a room that overlooks the strip, but it's 2 double beds and we could control the temperature and it's very quiet. She was very apologetic. We chose the 2 double bed room with Strip view. We asked for the highest non-smoking room. The 12th floor is the highest non-smoking room and we got it. All floors above the 12th floor are smoking. Before we set out bags down, we checked for bedbugs. There weren't any. We had a great view of The Stratosphere and the Strip. The toiletries you get are 2 single packs of coffee (there's a coffee maker), shampoo, lotion and 1 small bar of soap. But....it smelled like smoke. Remember, we were sitting right under a smoking floor. Although the main area of the room was clean, the bathroom had mildew on the walls, the bathroom needed to be swept, and the bathroom itself was extremely small. The shower backs up, so after a minute of being in the shower, you're standing in ankle-deep water. The best way to describe the room was that it was worth the $36. We were able to accept it until we ate at the Wynn Buffet and saw how unbelievably beautiful that hotel was. After seeing that, it was hard to go back to our $36 room. If you are a smoker, and you don't mind dirt (we're very clean and somewhat germaphobic), then I recommend this place. But we are going to try the Golden Nugget next time, we really like staying on Fremont. (Golden Nugget is right across from Four Queens).

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoJoeJerome
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on Fremont St. in Vegas, stay at the Golden Nugget. It's the only decent hotel on the street. The Four Queens rooms are okay but on the entire north side of the hotel, guests have no control over their room heating or air conditioning. My wife was chilled all night and even though we called the front desk twice, nothing could be done about it. Pay a few bucks more and enjoy pretty good luxury and modern, nice rooms at the Golden Nugget. I've stayed at both and it's a world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied customer. Thanks again.”
Reviews.Author: gmagap
Reviews.Content: We hve stayed here a couple of times a year for the past 10-15 years. Good place to gamble with seemly reasonable payouts. Rooms are basic and bathrooms fairly small but all we needed and very quiet.. No Freemont street noise if you get the south tower. North tower is okay also because the last street show is 12:30 AM . Excellent cleaning staff, front desk and host employees.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Logger1
Reviews.Content: For the price to stay here there is no better deal to be had. Fronting the Fredmont Experence and easy access to many casinos, you can not go wrong here if you want away from strip. The Buffet is top notch as well as staff. Room a little small but clean and comfortable. Now if they would loosen up the slots abit, it would be the perfect getaway. I have no problem returning here.

Reviews.Title: “very much fun at a great price”
Reviews.Author: WesternTravelers66
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay after reading some reviews. As always, seeing is believing and the Four Queens did not disappoint. The hotel check in was smooth and no upgrades were available. The room was basic and a bit old school. The bathroom could have used an update (old caulking repairs and peeling wall paper). However, the very low price paid made the room a great value. Yes, the room smelled smokey but we were in Vegas; yes, the Fremont Street Experience was loud and could be heard from the room but we were in Vegas. The room service was excellent with great prices compared to other hotels. The service personnel from the drink servers to the restaurant staff were great. No complaints whatsoever about this stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Time but not the last.”
Reviews.Author: karlsglass
Reviews.Content: I like Downtown Vegas, but this is the first time to stay at the Four Queens. Great Place just wish they had a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “never dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: brandi0825
Reviews.Content: 2nd time staying here. same service, same rooms same gambling. We really like this place and would totally recommend it to anyone. I was dissapointed that we didnt go to Hugo's for dinner, but well be back in may and will go then. i like the smell of the casino too. kind of a fruity smell one other thing that i just have to mention is try and ask for a room with some sort of a view. the 2 times we stayed here our view is of the top of the fremont canopy thing!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value - wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dbguichard
Reviews.Content: Rooms were comfortable. They have a daily charge for parking in their garage. Meals in restaurants were good. Would never play there again - slots very tight, table play was brutal, forget comps. - none available after many hours of table play and pretty significant losses (it was as if they didn't track player's cards at all). Noise from Fremont Street in our room was obnoxious, but it was fun to be right at the Fremont Street Experience. Pleasant change from the Strip but will stay and play elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “30 yrs”
Reviews.Author: KimH6
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for first time and after looking for weeks i decided to stay in Old Vegas soooooooooooo glad we did had a great time! So much to see and do all night long. Loved the light show,lots of wonderful street shows (free) just a wonderful time. 4 queens was very nice didn't have to walk a mile to get to the room or anything else will go back very soon. you can't go wrong staying at the Four Queens

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional front desk...eating and talking stories.”
Reviews.Author: paradise1975
Reviews.Content: We are trying to check in and standing in line and those 3 agents, 2 females and 1 male standing. They are talking stories and one is eating something. The male was staring at me while he was talking to the girl. And then the girl asked me if I need help, and I said I'm here to check in and the guy said "I thought you are just standing there" dah! What a stupid reaction? At check out I asked if there is a avail late check check out so they honored 1pm. I was advise to get a new key. I went there and this lady asked me if who honored my late check out. And she checked the computer oh ok its confirmed by Charles. So she asked him why you honored late check out we are completely sold out tonite. What a liar because when I asked if how much a rate for additional on the phone and this lady told me around $100+. First impression from front desk is makes our worst stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, cheap rates, clean but SMOKEY!”
Reviews.Author: PDXtraveler281
Reviews.Content: Rented several rooms here for a family wedding. The suite for the wedding couple was beautiful. The other rooms were small and somewhat worn, but clean and very reasonably priced. We had a large family breakfast in their restaurant one day, and the staff was extremely efficient and accommodating. We are not into gambling, but the casino seemed bright and well kept--biggest drawback was the smoke. Even tho we had non smoking rooms, the smell was so pervasive that almost a month later I can still smell it in the suitcases even tho I washed all the contents. Location is not on the strip, but "downtown" in the older, Fremont area. Free parking made that a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: CAridgerunner
Reviews.Content: My friends arrived around 6:00 pm. I had arrived at 2:00, but was not permitted to go to our room because the reservation was in friend's name only. Then when we were there, they informed us that they had no more 2 queen bed rooms available, and we were put into two king size bed rooms. We were all females, so we dealt with it. But when you make a reservation, asking for two rooms with two queen size beds, why aren't they available when you arrive? Alarm clock did not work. Room service dishes left in hall for two days. Room was ok and beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Deerfield040
Reviews.Content: I selected it for the location at the north end of Vegas. My bathroom had mold on the walls, the faucet was loose from the sink and hung at an angle but it worked, there were hairs in the bathroom that weren't mine, the toilet didn't quite flush all the way, the air conditioner had a choice between freezing and off. My dad's room didn't have mold on the walls, but his air conditioner would only blow medium, and he ran out of kleenex, but the maid didn't put a new box in. The power went off after I took my shower in the early morning. I called the front desk, and they didn't seem to care. They acted as if it happened all of the time. I put my makeup on using my booklight and the closet mirror. They have a half price ticket booth in the casino with very helpful and knowledgeable employees which was useful. I wanted an inexpensive room, and I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management! She shouldn't be greeting guests!”
Reviews.Author: retleus
Reviews.Content: The manager checked us in and had an attitude... She's in the wrong line of work to be greeting there guests! If you have a bad day, don't let it show or take it out on customers that dump money into your establishment....... Other then her the rest of the staff are very friendly and helpful! Didn't have much luck, but we did have a good time! :) The downtown has changed alot since our last trip down there, We felt safer down on the strip then we did downtown, There are too many bums and homeless people hanging around Freemont St. I would recomend spending the extra few bucks and stay on the main strip!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OCbusdriver9
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in June here and once again, it was more than we expected. Prompt service at check in, asked and received a room at end of hall. Everything was clean and room was always made up when we returned. Everyone here is very friendly and go out of their way to acknowledge you. Have another 5 nights scheduled in Dec. for our anniversary. Can't wait to get back. No place like downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Very few faults for the price”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, and really enjoyed it. Yes, it's not the most modern of hotels, and the rooms probably have seen better days - but for the price paid, it would be hard to beat! Staff were very friendly, and the cocktail waitresses in the casino were frequently around delivering drinks. The location on Fremont St is prime and cannot be beat - plenty of places to eat both in house and in the neighbouring casinos. Lots of things to do also. Don't expect to sleep early though, due to the Fremont Street shows, but who goes to Vegas to be in bed before 1am? Getting to the Strip was easy with both the Gold Line and the Deuce buses stopping within stone throwing distance from the hotel. For shopping, the Gold Line will bring you to the Premium Outlets which is just minutes away, and well worth a visit. Other transit routes are also accessible due to it's location near the Downtown Transportation terminal. If you want a cheaper, more friendly and more authentic Vegas experience then stay here rather than on the Strip. I certainly would return to the Four Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Freemont Street Experience from 4 Queens”
Reviews.Author: atgnwt
Reviews.Content: It was fun to be right on the Old Strip/Freemont Street. The casino was clean and we received free drinks while on the floor. Staff were friendly. Our room was simple but clean and the price was low. We were high enough that the Freemont St noise didn't keep us awake. We had free parking with indoor access to the hotel. The food at the casino restaurants we tried was mediocre and a waitstaff person dumped au jus all over my lap and shoes our first night.... first meal! The manager comped my meal but it was still annoying and embarassing. All in all, the hotel was a good base for us as we explored downtown and for tours whose buses picked us up right outside the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: We've gambled at the Four Queens but never stayed there until this trip (Thursday til Sunday, Oct. 3). Previously we've stayed either on the strip or at the Golden Nugget. The Four Queens sent us a very good room offer so we took them up on it and were very pleasantly surprised. The room (two queens) had very comfortable mattresses, a flat-screen TV, coffee maker, and excellent water pressure in the shower. When we reported that the toilet was filling very slowly maintenance came and fixed it within an hour. They gave us a coupon book at check in that included a number of two-for-one offers on meals and drinks. Magnolias is a decent coffee shop/restaurant that was fine for our breakfasts and dinner one night. Likes - very friendly and accommodating staff, good gambling odds at the tables and video poker (3/2 blackjack and full-pay video poker machines can be found), the best cocktail service I've ever encountered on a casino floor (the servers are friendly and frequent, drinks are free if you're gambling), reasonable prices at Magnolias, rooms are a great value (I'd liken ours to something like a Hampton Inn in terms of size, content and layout). Dislikes - no pool on site, but you get to use the one on the rooftop at Binion's. That actually ended up being pretty cool. Great 360 degree views, very nice pool-side furniture, and for awhile we had it all to ourselves . It's small but serviceable and has a deep end (you don't find those in newer pools). Overall we were very happy with our stay and experience at the Four Queens. Closing thoughts - downtown is not for the night-club, people-watching, trend-setting sort. It's relaxed, things are close together, and the patrons are typically regular folks tending toward middle-aged or more. Since that's what we are, we're very happy there. After years of fighting the strip crowds, dodging the porno card handouts, and seeing the gaming odds deteriorate we decided to try downtown a couple of years ago. We see little reason to go back to the strip. Downtown is cleaner, friendlier, cheaper and thanks to the Fremont Street Experience has a constant schedule of events and stage bands. If you want the strip, it's only a half-hour bus ride away. The buses run 24/7, are clean and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BEDS”
Reviews.Author: HAILEYGRAM
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 23-25. I found the front desk clerk to be very polite and compitent. Took less than 5 minutes to get checked in. We found our room in the north tower to be very clean and updated. We had requested a smoking room when I reserved, when checking in I forgot to double check as we got in at 12am. We decided not to complain and deal with the fact that we could not smoke in the room. I found the bed to be very comfortable. So much so that I was trying to find a way to fit it into my suitcase. The only complaint I did have was the water pressure in the shower. Usually you get a shower that has hardly any pressure. Not here. It was more like a pressure washer. I was litterally thrown against the back wall when I turned it on. Other than that I will gladly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “best one on fremont”
Reviews.Author: redbone1104
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at all the hotels on fremont over the years, and the 4 queens is the best hands down!! yes.....even better than the golden nugget. resturaunts are very good and resonable [magnolias]. very fast service and nice staff. don't have to walk a mile no matter which tower you are staying in. has the half price show tickets kiosk rite downstairs. getting ready to book again for dec. 2010

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: sunvia
Reviews.Content: we found a $29.25 rate on priceline....stayed there 2 nites, sept 20,21 2010 we asked for quiet room, and after the fremont experience was finished, it was very quiet.... our next trip to vega will be 4 queens.. tile in bathroom has a few small chips, but was clean otherwise...beds slept very well

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: olderbrit
Reviews.Content: Like last time we split our LV stay into half on Fremont St and half on the Strip. This time we picked the Four Queens - based largely on TripAdvisor reviews. (Last time it was the Golden Nugget which we liked a lot.) The cost of the taxi from the airport made our eyes water so from then on we travelled on the Deuce bus! The hotel was excellent value for the price - about one third of the room rate for the MGM, where we went next. We wanted twin beds but got a king, however we were too tired to mind and in any case it was very comfortable. The room amenties were fine but the bathroom looked a bit tired. I suspect there is no money to refurbish and again, for this cost you really couldn't complain. Breakfasts in Magnolia were fine but the dinner we had there was quite poor and we should have popped over to Binions to eat. Minor gripe however. Absolutely no sign of bed-bugs by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Cormackie
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at four queens - food in restautrants was great - service during our stay was super - all hotel personnel were so friendly and helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place To Stay & Play-Never Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: midnitesun2004
Reviews.Content: Husband and I had 4 nights comped mid August. Checked in approximately 9pm on a Tuesday night to find the hotel was sold out and we were complimentary upgraded to a suite! A win before setting foot in the casino! We always stay at this property, but this was our first time staying in the South Tower-this tower is closest to the check-in desk. 2nd Floor end of the hall. Granted the room is a bit dated; it was very spacious and impeccably clean! Large couch, oversized chairs, breakfast table/chairs, king bed, wet bar, flat panel tv, lighted armoir, large dresser, large bathroom with double sinks, and 2 safes. View was of a cement wall, but it kept out the sunlight early in the morning. Service was as usual, wonderful! From the front desk to housekeeping, to the amazing bartenders! Room service for late breakfast FAST and food was HOT. The front bar is great for watching people right on Fremont Street. The gracious bartenders work their tails off-don't forget to tip! Had some luck playing Keno at the bar as well. Thank You, Four Queens, for another amazing experience! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “So Much fun”
Reviews.Author: micanthony76
Reviews.Content: We will never stay on "The Strip" again after staying here. We had so much fun in the casino and all the restaurants in the Freemont. The room was spacious and the bathroom was a nice size too. The view was a lot of fun to look at too, we saw all the people walking around downtown. The McDonalds downstairs and across the hotel is open 24 hours and worked out great when we went back to our room in the early A.M. The waitstaff was wonderful along with the people who checked us in. We could see so much from our room and it stayed at nice when the temp was 108 outside. They have room service and other amenities that we did not use but were available. Parking was free which made me very happy. We has a fabulous rate on this room through the military. They give special discounts to the military.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in freemont street.”
Reviews.Author: StevePal
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap hotel for a one night stopover before an early flight out, so £20 seemed OK, with no resort fee. The hotel is right on Freemont Street, and is an impressive building indeed, especially for this price! They add a few charges of course. £3 for parking, £12 for internet (no chance, log on to a free one if you can pick up a signal!), but other than that it was fine. Nice rooms, friendly staff, big casino if you need it (we didnt - Vegas is done for us now, hopefully!!).

Reviews.Title: “FUN, FUN, FUN”
Reviews.Author: EricaD3
Reviews.Content: Had a blast loved everything and I am going back in oct 2010

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Daisygirl05
Reviews.Content: We always stay on the strip when we go to Vegas. So, we were a little weary of staying on Freemont street and especially at this hotel because it was a great deal. We were thinking that there was going to be a catch because the rooms were sooo cheap, but to our surprise there were none. Our room was clean and the beds were actually comfortable, yes they are a little outdated but not horribly. The hotel is in a great location on Freemont Street and is easy to get in and out of,(thats one of my complaints about being on the strip, everything is a hassle). The resturant Magnolias had good food for a great price and the staff was very friendly, we will definitely be back. Overall, we were very pleased with our experience our only complaint was that the water in the bathtub drained very very slowly, thats it, no other complaints. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone its a nice hotel for a great price. If your looking for good food on Freemont Street we recommend Hennesey's Tavern (the giant pint of bass resturant). We had cheese fries, Rueben and Pastrami burger and everything was absolutly delicious. They also have a live Irish band that plays there and they were really good.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend, great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: njsteve43
Reviews.Content: My first stay on Fremont at the Four Queens was very good. Check in was friendly, quick but not rushed and all my questions were answered. The room needs to be updated with furniture, drapes and such but the bottom line is that it is clean. Upon entering my room i noticed that it felt like the heat was on, I changed the setting but it only got hotter. I called for maintenance and they came within 15 minutes and soon I had cool air...but it didn't last. I called back again about an hour later and they came again within 15 minutes and after a little work had it working perfectly. Great service! The staff was very friendly throughout the hotel, a bit different from some of the Strip hotels I've stayed at in the past where the staff can be a tad more rude. My one complaint about the food options is that there no easy coffee options, although there are coffee makers in the room. They should consider adding a place like Starbucks, Seattle Coffee or Dunkin Donuts to complete what is a great place to eat. Magnolia's & Chicago Brewing Co. were both very good places to eat...but the combination of Subway, Roman's Pizza and Ice Cream comes of a bit sloppy and cheap. Great location, just a short walk and you are at many other hotels. Very good experience overall and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: mandy626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at the Four Queens Hotel for a quick weekend getaway. My husband suggested we try the Four Queens since it always seems we end up there and only gamble there at the end of the night. I thought i would read some reviews on this hotel. Reading through all the reviews although there were more good then bad I was a little worried about the "negative" reviews I had read. My husband said we would try it and if we didn't like then we know not to book again. OMG I was so happy we booked here. First off we got to check into our room 1hr 1/2 before the usual check in time. Clean room and yes, the a/c worked. Bed was comfy and the pillows were really comfy. Good min bets for gambling and their cafe here is really good. We one day had breakfast and dinner there and was surprisingly good. The room is a basic room with a bed, table and chairs, flat screen tv, the bathroom a bit small but was ok for us. Our room didnt have a great view but we don't really care for that we are not in Vegas to just be staring at our room.Now if your looking for something luxurious then go to the strip! Who wants to be stuck in the room when your in Vegas? We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be staying here again. Reviews that complained about the noise from outside because of Fremont I have no idea what they are talking about was not even bad. Now if your looking for something luxurious then go to the strip! Who wants to be stuck in the room when your in Vegas? Even though its Downtown Vegas a lot of people our age were there(we are in our 20's) and not all old people like some may assume.We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: SandyArgyle_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 4-Queens as part of a package trip. We enjoyed everything about the hotel. Very clean, excellent service, and the staff were there to help us with everything and anything. They even gave us a room close to the elevators to accomadate my elderly mother. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good clean reasonable priced room. Being on Freemont street was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “it is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry4444
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay there, great location.i would reccomend it, stafff nice and professional. truly good location. i was happy staying there.

Reviews.Title: “always back at the Queens”
Reviews.Author: star8527
Reviews.Content: Go to Vegas all the time! I have only stayed in one other hotel besides the queens never again. You can't beat the cheap rates and being on Freemont st is awsome!!!! I have never had a problem with anything there and the staff re always really nice. Going back in Aug I can't wait!!!!!!!!!!!!! There is nothing like Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: s.g.LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: When I made this reservation, I honestly wasn't expecting much of anything, considering what a cheap price I was getting. I was very pleasantly surprised!! The room itself was clean with plenty of space, the casino was bigger than I expected, and the desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. I was on the 11th floor, on the side of the hotel that literally overlooks the top of the Fremont Street Experience awning, and it honestly wasn't very loud at all! (I only stayed one night, and didn't get back to my room until 1am, so maybe that's part of it ,but still!) Bottom line, I will be recommending this to my friends, and I look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Invest in a better quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: evening_lilac
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel as we walked in was the musty, smoky smell and that continued into our room. We were in the North Tower which was reasonably quiet. There were no towels in the room and the toiletries had been used. I have to say after phoning, replacements were with us within minutes. The sheets were grey and I had a horrible feeling they hadn't been washed as they were soft, not crisp and fresh like you'd expect. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast at their Magnolias wasn't too bad but our one evening meal we had there was awful with instant mash and reconstituted chicken, ugh. We defininitely would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No rest in this nest.”
Reviews.Author: leemoran
Reviews.Content: A lot less than I expected, Desk clerks acted like we came from squalor. Hall ways, and elevator were in need of deep cleaning. Very noisy. We will not do the four queens again, and will not use the trip advisor again. We booked for two nights, but only stayed one. We were not given a check out statement. No refund on the unused night. If I had known that, I would have let a homeless person have it for the one night. But not sure if even be accepted by a vagrant. leemoran@cox.net

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value, can't complain.”
Reviews.Author: bakert80
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel in May of 2010, I read alot of reviews regarding this hotel and others. I will address some of the other comments that I read and give my opinion. Hotel: Check in was quick, very easy, very courteous workers at the front desk. Rooms were pretty old fashioned but did not other me at all. It was clean, had a bathroom, tv, safe, dresser, basically all I was looking for for a business trip. I had no problem with hot water, water pressure, toilet not working or housekeeping cleaning the room as I had read in previous reviews. Casino: It is what it is, an older looking casino in old Vegas. Nothing spectacular but for me the social gambler it was just fine. I would have like to see them offer a $2 Blackjack table as I had to go next door to Fitzgeralds for that. Other than that, like I said, it is what it is. Food: The Chicago Brewing Company had great food, good cigars, great beer. I spent most of my nights in there as I enjoy watching sports. Service was sometime very slow. I got looked at a few times with an empty glass in front of me and the bartender turned and walked away. Did not eat at the buffet. Noise: Yes if you face the Fremont Street Experience and are a light sleeper you will be kept awake by the music, however, the music was good. I enjoyed falling asleep to it. I was on the 12th floor facing it. My travel companion was on the 8th floor, not facing it, could not hear a thing. So yes, if you want quiet, request a room not faing the Fremont Street. As for Fremont Street, I went out there every night, it was fun, entertaining, relatively inexpensive, and I felt very safe. All in all I would say this hotel was worth the $30 a night I paid for it. I have nothing to really complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: deb1ohn
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, relatively large, very good deal for money paid. Not a 5-star, but usually don't want all the services that come with a five star hotel, just want a clean, comfortable room, which this was. Room did have noise from the fremont experience, but that is to be expected from a hotel that is downtown, and certainly less noise than we experienced on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for...”
Reviews.Author: creekj
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: early 30's couple no kids, frequent Vegas visitors (4 trips a year), avid low-rolling gamblers, and foodies. We use our room as a place to sleep and clean up, and prefer to spend our time out in the casinos. Location: If you stay at any hotel on Fremont street it's a good location. We easily walked from the Plaza at one end to Fitz on the other in 15 min. Everything's in a 4-5 block radius. Expectations: Expect to stay in older accommodations that are comparable to low-end strip hotels. Room: 949, the tower further away from the Fremont experience Pros: Friendly staff, maid service excellent, low table minimums, fast check-in, free in-room safe, in-room coffee maker, acceptable bed and pillows (they weren't great but they didn't prevent your from sleeping). Cons: Slow elevator, tiny room and bathroom (you can't sit on the toilet and close the bathroom door at the same time), extremely smokey casino (I know they all are, but this was particularly bad), horrible plumbing (the shower felt like a midget peeing on you and the you had to hold the toilet handle for 10 seconds to flush it then listen to it run for 5 solid minutes). Side note: Fremont experience could be a con for some people if they go to bed before midnight. No matter where you stay you can hear the nightly shows in your room. Last show was at midnight (I believe). Bottom line: I'm not really particular about where we stay and have stayed at multiple hotels in Vegas, but wouldn't stay at the 4 queens again. It's not horrible and you'll be fine staying here, but for $20 more a night you could stay at the Golden Nugget, or you could stay for cheaper in the remodeled rooms in the Fremont hotel. The 4-Queens isn't expensive by any means but they aren't priced to the quality of their rooms when compared to other options in the same area. From my location they are the 2nd most expensive hotel on Fremont street. If your a person who really likes to enjoy there room or spends a lot of time relaxing in your room do not stay here. If your like us and come in and pass out after spending 15 hours in the casinos and mingling them it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrim1782
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Four Queens in Vegas. The room was clean and the Casino was fun. The Freemont Street Experience was great. The Canopy shows at night were awesome! They pulled the drinks into the street at night and there were live bands. Lots of shopping in the area. It was easy to catch a bus to the Strip when we wanted to go. It was a fun vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in old Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dixiedoug
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two night stay at the Four Queens. The hotel and casino is nice enough for the bargain rates were were charged. The food and service in Magnolia's Restaurant was great! I had a prime rib dinner for $7.95, and it was wonderful! I enjoyed their 24-hour ham and eggs special late one night, and their fried chicken special looked delicious! My friend did OK at the table games at 4Q and Binions, and I did OK at the slots. Only complaint was from my friend who was kept awake one night by a tribute band playing down in the street. I had ear plugs but he liked the music so decided to listen until the wee hours of the morning. I told him he should have gotten dressed and gone down and enjoyed it will all the people. Fremont Street is a hoot and I prefer it to the South Strip. It's easier and shorter to get from one casino to another. Try it some time! I may stay at the Golden Nugget the next time because their hotel has fairly high ratings, but who stays in the hotel in Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: bigcat37
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 4 Queens several times. It is located on Fremont St. at the Experience and you have so much fun at night when the streets lights up. The Vendors during the day are so varied and different. The staff for the hotel and the casino staff are the best. Always glad you are there. Magnolia's has the best food at real good prices.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: dufficail
Reviews.Content: While everything was not perfect, it was close. The casino host was exceptionally cordial and helpful, our sincere thanks to her !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: ACESHIGHLeeds
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dubious about this hotel, even though it is well known and well placed on Fremont Street, we thought it would be down at heel for the price we paid. How wrong we were. The check-in was seamless, the room was large with loads of storage space and the bed was v comfortable. The bathroom was v small however and not my idea of clinically clean but it was adequate and the only negative in an otherwise brilliant stay. We needed to call a maintenance guy to fix the window (wind blowing through it as it didn;t close) but he was there in less than 5 mins and sorted it out. Room was tidied every day with fresh towels and all early on in the day. TV channels are not fantastic but you don't go to Vegas to watch TV! We asked for a quiet room facing away from Fremond Street and got a room on the other side on floor 9, still heard music but it finished around midnight. Take some ear plugs though as the walls don't block out your neighbours, ours didn;t bother us but they did get up early and talked for England! We had a great holiday and would def def def stay here again. Would recommend the poker at Binions over the street and breakfast at the Bay City Diner (now called Du Pars) at the Golden Gate. Sign up for the Royal Players Club card before you go (fill out and print the form on their website and hand it over when you get there for a free gift).

Reviews.Title: “Almost the Best, except...”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoSue
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very pleasant vacation in Las Vegas, We stayed at the Four Queens and were happy with most everything, except the Players Club management. They would not honor coupons that were handed out at the front entrance to the Four Queens Casino by Four Queens employees. We even went to management offices at the Four Queens who stated that they do not have control over what coupons the Players Club accepts or does not accept (???) Not impressed at all with this lack of customer satisfaction or service. We then decided to not gamble even one dollar at this casino and took our gambling money to the other casinos. It's unfortunate as the Four Queens has a great hotel, clean rooms, pleasant employees other than these few, great location to the other casinos for our gambling pleasure, and the best in restaurant food. Oh, well!

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay At The 4 Queens!”
Reviews.Author: midnitesun2004
Reviews.Content: Arrived 4/13 at 9pm; no line at check-in. North tower 15th floor end of the hall. Wow! Room was a bit larger than regular 2 bed rooms, and INCLUDED a fridge! The hotel still provides coffee makers; most other downtown properties have done away with them. Safe was locked when we arrived; security was up within 5 minutes to open so we could reset. Room was very clean. Housekeeping was great-room was spotless each day. Our entire stay was awesome. Magnolia's was great for breakfast; fast and friendly service-great breakfast food! Bartenders at the bar were fantastic as always! Thank you, Ace, and everyone else! We have stayed 4 times at the Queens since August, and will be back again this August for another great time! If you're looking for a great place to stay downtown that is clean, comfortable with a friendly non pretentious atmosphere....this is the place to stay-Highest Recommendations from us!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Karuck
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on price and also its location to the bus depot. Prior to booking this place we had read a number of reviews that indicated that this would not be the best place to stay. We sent a number of email enquires to this hotel and others. The 4 Queens was the only one that answered our emails promptly and assisted us with selecting our room as we were adamant that we would like a non-smoking room due to medical conditions. The person that replied to our email recommended the deluxe room as it was recently renovated This hotel was wonderful and the staff were super friendly and were more then happy to help us with ways of getting to the strip and also where we should catch our tour. The room have been renovated and our room did not smell of smoke. It was very clean and a pleasant experience to see downtown Las Vegas. We had an interconnecting room in which we could hear the couple next door. Fortunately they were not that loud however, we could hear their conversations. This is a great hotel for downtown Las Vegas with plenty of shops around. We could see that a lot of effort has been put in to improve the hotel's image and it certainly has changed from previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead88
Reviews.Content: First off after many years of going to Las Vegas and staying on the strip we were converted into downtown people. The past several years we have stayed on Fremont Street which you can't beat for the fun and excitement. This is our second stay at the Four Queens. The first time we had a mini suite but this time opted to just get a regular king non-smoking. The woman at check in was very pleasant and checked us in quickly and was able to accommodate our request for a room in the south tower. The room was slightly larger than others that we have stayed in downtown. It was clean and nicely stocked. There was a new safe that was in the bottom of the nightstand. It was nice and similar to the ones that I have seen previously at the Belliago. The bed was comfortable and you could hear the Fremont Street Experience but it was not overwhelming or annoying. Limited channels on the TV but who comes to Vegas to watch TV. Would have liked to have seen free wi-fi or a hot spot in the lobby, but it was available for purchase at $8.95 a day. Overall I was happy with the stay and will stay there again. It does not have all the frills of the more expensive strip properties but it is fun and a easy short trip from the casino to the room. Speaking of the casino it was very disappointing to see that they are dealing 6-5 blackjack in the casino now. You can still get a 3-2 blackjack game across the street at the Fremont or at The Golden Nugget. Overall I would recommend for a good no frills time in old downtown Las Vegas .

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to save money by staying downtown.”
Reviews.Author: this2shallpass
Reviews.Content: The casino of this place is old and needs renovating, but the rooms were very nice: brand-new flat screen TV, comfy beds, nice furniture. The location is great if you are staying in downtown Vegas. My only problems were the broken A/C in the room and the fact that they don't have a poker room. Have to go next door to the Golden Nugget to play in a poker room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: girltravelswithhubby
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious or anything but a great value for the money. Downtown is the place to be if you want to get away from the ridiculous expense of the South Strip. The room was nice, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The casino was huge and very pretty, I was very impressed with the whole place. The windows opened which was awesome, though the noise from Fremont was overwhelming with it open. Overall a great place to stay, and in a great area of Vegas. We had four other friends staying in one of the big fancy places on the south end and we ended up Downtown every night we were there. The tables were cheaper, the casinos were bigger, the food was cheaper, the drink girls more plentiful and frequent and the environment was much cooler and less overwhelming than the big guys on the South Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bartenders/Bar Backs anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaSkeeta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip to Vegas staying at the Four Queens. While the rooms at 4Q are adequate - nothing to rave about, the guys who work at the bars are the best! Friendly, efficient, courteous and obviously enjoy working with each other and for the 4Q. Have to make special mention of Dante, Mike (2), Arturo, James, Ngia, and David. There are others there who deserve mention also but we didn't see as much of them this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Used to love it... has gone down hill....”
Reviews.Author: Bluedigi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the 4 Queens a few times before in the past but I will not stay there again. I had a Jacuzzi Suite on one of the top floors for a week. I called down to the desk a few times because my neighbors were clearly smoking weed in the next room and my room reeked almost every night. There was always fighting and yelling going on in the hallway. Then to top off my trip, on the last night there I was woken up to gun fire outside of my room and come to find out there was a shoot out directly in front of my door. When I called down to the front desk about it... the girl who answered the phone did not even seem phased by my news. About 30 min later LVPD were all over the place and they had a few, from what I could tell, hookers in hand cuffs outside of my door in the hallway sitting down. When I went to check out I brought this up to the front desk and only got dirty looks from them. I am sad that all of this happened because I have had decent experiences here in the past considering the price. Freemont is starting to turn into a ghetto and 4 Queens is taking the brunt of it and not coping well at all. Spend a few extra bucks and stay on the strip and take a taxi or bus down to Freemont during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend, don't miss out.”
Reviews.Author: TexasTeeeee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Queens Casino and had a blast. We had been to Vegas a few times before and stayed on the strip, not the same. Fell in love with Freemont Street. Our room was awesome, stayed in a Mini sweet, great choice. Clean rooms, friendly staff and awesome water pressure in the shower. We ate ate in the casino restaurant several times because the food was affordable and very good. It was very nostalgic and vintage as were all of the other casinos. We plan on staying on Freemont street again next year. Would recommend anyone to stay at the Four Queens Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Redspangle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in the Four Queens, and had a fantastic time. The hotel is not the glitziest on Freemont, nor the cheapest - but it was lovely. Having stayed on the Strip previously I was mildly apprehensive about "going downtown".......but after a week in the Queens I will not stay on the main strip again. The hotel was clean, comfortable, food was good and the waitress service in the casino was better than any other casino we visited (and that was nearly all of them!). Guests have use of the pool in Binions - if you can find the time, and the location on Freemont was perfect. We did not hear any of the noise from the light shows from inside the hotel....even on St. Patrick's night - which was a great experience we would not have got on the strip. The soul of Las Vegas is downtown!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but good value and location.”
Reviews.Content: Reserved a non-smoking room, but when we checked in we discovered it faced out on to Fremont St, and there was no way we'd be able to sleep with all that noise. We asked for a quieter room, but had to take a smoking room. It smelled a bit of smoke, but not that bad really. Once I turned the thermostat down, the ventilation really blasted fresh air into the room. A bit of smoke came under the door, but we covered the gap with a towel. Room was clean, kingsize bed was comfy, but the pillows are typical hotel pancakes. Didn't use the wireless Internet, they wanted $8.99 per day. There were two computers in the lobby where we could get 4 mins on the Internet for $1 and printed our airline boarding passes for $0.50 per page. There is no pool, but apparently guests can use the pool in the sister property Binion Hotel/Casino across the street. Unfortunately, it was closed for renovations, while we were there. We booked well in advance and paid $31 for the Thu night and $54 for the Fri. So overall no complaints for the price. Much prefer staying in this area than on "The Strip". More reasonable and much more pedestrian friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us.”
Reviews.Author: shadow700
Reviews.Content: Called in one week prior to arrival requesting south tower connecting rooms, knowing it was only a request and not guaranteed. We did get rooms next to each other in the north tower, 506 & 508. We were under the canopy and were able to watch the light show from the room. I have stayed at this hotel before so knew what to expect for rooms. We were told we could move the following day if we wanted, but some in our group preferred this view so we stayed where we were.
