The rooms were quite warm, but once we figured out our thermostat was backwards, we were able to get the heat to shut off. The air does not work in the winter. The light show ends at midnight, but the music continues through the night. This kept me awake some the first night, but I was fine after that. Bathrooms are small, but functioned well. The rooms were clean and the coffee pot and safe were appreciated. Elevators dropped you off in the casino. Everything was convenient, and we got a great deal. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brett_Travis09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before moving to Fremont Hotel for three. Able to check in early, fast and friendly check in. Got a smoking room and it was noticable but that was our fault. One you got off the elevator there was a strange smell all down the hallway, smelled like cat pee, maybe because its an older hotel. Beds were hard. All in all not a bad hotel great location and price. Just not sure I would want to stay there again. If you like older hotels and fremont area this would be perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: azraine
Reviews.Content: In town for Nascar Races & decided to stay downtown - great choice with the Four Queens - clean room, great atmosphere with the Fremont Experience right outside the door and very friendly staff. We had a blast & can't wait till next year to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “We did not choose to stay at the Four Queens but overall it turned out for the best.”
Reviews.Author: bucky7680
Reviews.Content: We did not choose to stay at the Four Queens but overall it turned out for the best. We had reservations at Binion’s Horseshoe Hotel but they abruptly closed their doors in Dec leaving us with out a hotel for the Las Vegas NASCAR races. When we called we were told our reservations would be transferred to the Four Queens which I believe is affiliated with Binion’s. The Four Queens staff did a great job transferring our reservations and changing the credit card deposit and assuring me that I did in fact have a room for 4 days. This turned out to be a good thing because the Four Queens is a much nicer hotel. The rooms have been updated. We stayed in the North Tower in a No Smoking double. Previous posters mentioned the noise from the Fremont Street Experience but we were on the other side of the tower and never heard a thing. The beds are firm which wasn’t a problem for me but my 24yr old son said he had trouble sleeping. The room has an iron, ironing board and coffee maker. We had trouble finding the safe because it is in the bottom of the night stand. The previous guest left it locked so we called and they sent up someone right away to open it. I did not have my Lap Top but the safe appears large enough to fit my 17”. The TV is a good quality 32” flat screen. The channel selection is on par with most Vegas hotels. There is no HBO or other movie channels. We ate at their Chicago Brew Restaurant. We had pizza and hot wings which everyone liked. We have eaten at their steak house Hugo’s Cellar before but I only recommend it for a romantic meal for two. Now for the bad, The Parking. Previous posters have mentioned having to pay $13+ for parking. This is only if you are not a guest. Make sure you get a VIP Parking pass when you register. I was not happy with the Valet service. The drop off and pickup are on opposite ends of the lobby. We stayed for 4 nights and we always had to wait a long time for an attendant to show up to take ours keys, at least 10 mins once. Valet pickup was not a problem except for our last day. I went to the Valet pickup area and there was a sign telling me to go back across the lobby to the drop off area to find an attendant. I did and again there was no one to be found. I had to go to the registration desk and they were able to help me. I valet park for the convenience but valet parking at the Four Queens is anything but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaMooney
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, nice and close to everything, would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, no hidden fees... has a bit of an odd smell...”
Reviews.Author: missitty
Reviews.Content: So this is where we ended up staying after we found we were dissatisfied with the price vs the quality of the golden nugget. It is a lot less expensive than most hotels in the area and the building seems a bit warn but this is a perfect place to stay if you are visiting Vegas with friends and are on a budget. The location off of Freemont street is excellent. This is a good place to stay if you want to be away from the new strip and all of the children/families that tend to flock to vegas. There is a bit of an odd smell in the lobby... something like a mix of cotton candy and cleaning agents. The only complaint i have is that they should just stick with febreeze or something similar to get rid of the smoke smell in the lobby. The restaurants down on the casino level of the hotel have excellent food at great prices. overall great place to stay if you are a college student or young adult looking for an exciting trip. If you are a business traveler or couple seeking a super classy romantic getaway... this probably isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “hotel rating”
Reviews.Author: ToniL3
Reviews.Content: Excellent absolutely I would recommend. nice clean well staffed

Reviews.Title: “Good for Downtown - FREE COFFEE!”
Reviews.Author: KerrMudgeon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Queens for the first time last month, via a 2-days-free promotion. I had a good time. I liked the casino's layout; much easier to navigate than the Golden Nugget. My room was small, but that's OK. However, I wish they could squeeze in an upholstered lounge chair, in addition to the table & 2 straight chairs in the corner. Some things I really appreciated in the (free) room: - Free coffee maker & free coffee packets; just ask the room maid if you need more. - Large flat-screen TV, about 32", I think - with more channels than some other Downtown hotels. - The thermostat showed the actual room temperature, and I could adjust it easily. - The room did not have a refrigerator when I checked in, but I called downstairs and they delivered one quickly. - There was a free in-room safe, built into the base of one of the bedside stands. Complaints: - I wanted to order a meal "to go", so I went to Magnolia's Veranda. I waited outside for five minutes, and no host appeared, so I left; they need a "no hostess counter" or some way to avoid the rigmarole of waiting for a "seating hostess" so you can order a meal to go. BTW, I went across the street to the Binion's Snack Bar, and got a quick tasty meal to go at a good price. - If you cash in your comps points daily, be aware that the cash you receive is deducted from your card's points total. It might be better to let the points "ride", and accumulate for better comps in future. Tip: If you value quiet, request the South Tower at check-in, and confirm your choice of smoking/non-smoking room - and also confirm the (medically necessary) refrigerator in your room. Oh, yeah: Smile! -

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Apuck23
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is not on the strip it is a great way to save money when traveling to Vegas. Downtown is a little bit cheaper to stay and there are plenty of ways to get around like the bus system and taxi's. I had a great visit and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Alkaline Trio”
Reviews.Author: Electrickid13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two of my friends for the weekend of the Alkaline Trio show a couple of years back. When we were there they were in the middle of remodeling and adding a new poker tournament area. The room was large and accommodating and housed the three of nicely. Right off of the Fremont Street Experience it was adequately priced for all of us to chip in and share the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old but comfortable and very easy access to Fremont Street!”
Reviews.Author: dallee
Reviews.Content: Our stay was over Halloween weekend. The staff was pleasant - room and decor of motel was tired. The overall decor could use some updating, but the best part was the bed. I am always leary of older motels and the bed. This one was more comfortable than my bed at home. We actually stripped the bed to find the manufacturers name. The other perk was the proximatey to Fremont Street. If we were bored or wanted a distraction from gambling we only had to walk a few feet. Of course Halloween on Fremont Street was awesome! You can't beat people watching on Fremont Street during Halloween. We did grab the Duece and visit other casinos on the strip, but were glad we stayed close to the Fremont Street action.

Reviews.Title: “My downtown home away from home”
Reviews.Author: qfingerfl
Reviews.Content: While I will be there in March, I have been visiting the Queens for longer than most people reading this have been alive. Since they remodeled the rooms, they have gone from a good place to stay, to a GREAT place to stay. The rooms are excellent and if they would just stop charging for high speed internet access (though not exorbitant) I would say they had everything you need and always at a good rate! If you like to turn in before midnight make sure to request the South Tower as the North Tower is right above the Fremont Street Experience. The gourmet restaurant is excellent, the regular restaurant is more then adequate and usually has some very good deals and the brewery is fun and has very good junk food! I eat there the majority of the time. If you want a buffet, the Fremont directly across the street is as good as any and not expensive. All in all, considering the price, a great choice

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Coop64
Reviews.Content: This will be our last stay at this hotel at any price. We have stayed here before because we enjoy Fremont St. and Downtown Vegas in general. Last time we were here, they told us we could request the South tower for a quieter room. We did request this, but were told by a rather rude desk clerk named (I believe) Kathy that there were no non-smoking rooms available in the south tower. Really? Fremont St. was emptier than I've ever seen, but somehow ( in January, in the middle of the week, no less) the 4Queens sold out all of the non-smoking rooms in a whole tower? So we toted our luggage through the casino to the elevator, and not only are we close to Fremont St., We are on it! The window to our room was literally on the edge of the Viva Vision screen! Having stayed on Fremont St. several times before, we knew that the last show was at midnight. We thought no big deal, we rarely get to bed before midnight anyway. We also thought it might be cool to see the light show from a different perspective. Wrong on both counts! First of all, the shows end at midnight but the music plays 24 hours a day and the speaker was right underneath our window. Second, you really can't see very much of the light show being that close to it. Next, we are in a non-smoking room but the people in the room beside us must have smoked like chimneys. The door in the corner that would open for adjoining rooms was pouring smoke into our room. It was bad enough that it woke me up thinking the room was on fire. I took a damp towel and shoved it in the crack at the bottom of the door to impede the flow somewhat. The one good thing about the room was the shower. Great water pressure, and plenty of hot water to rinse off the grime collected from the rest of the Hotel. Cocktail service in the Casino was also lacking, So we went across the street to the Golden Nugget and gambled there. The saving grace to our trip was we had 2 nights comped at the Orleans hotel. We moved there for the rest our trip, and had a wonderful experience. A review for that will be coming shortly. P.S. This has nothing to do with the 4Queens directly, but the "panhandlers" on Fremont St. are getting out of control. They used to keep this in check pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: duane2
Reviews.Content: Just got back and enjoyed the whole time at the Four Queens. Great for seniors that can't walk so well. My dad could join all the fun on the streets. He also could walk from casino to another. Prices where also great. Offers and coupons where welcomed. Visited other hotels on the strip and they didn't offer as many extras as the Four Queens. Will visit there again and will tell friends that fremont is the area to stay. Rooms where clean and staff where extra friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Freemont Street”
Reviews.Author: fallingmoon
Reviews.Content: The service we recieved was excellent but the first two days our room was terrible. We complained several times about it and they moved us first to a much smaller room with no smoking and no fridge he air conditioning and nothing was done. The third day we went to the front desk and conplained to the lady there and she said we could move rooms. We were in a smoking room with a refridgerator, the first room they moved us to was no smoking, the bath tub had not been cleaned and there was a used bar of soap in the tub, plus much smaller and no refridgerator. So called downstairs and complained the Bell Boy came and got our bags and we moved to a smoking room and no fridgerator but they did bring us one. Then we had an issue with the Magnolia resturant, The waiter was very rude and acted like he was high on some kind of drugs. I ordered chicken fried steak which was cold and smelled like wet cat I asked for the manager and she came to the table and took it off of our bill but never offered me anything else to eat. We also complained about this at the front desk and they gave us $50.00 off of a meal we really didnt want to eat there again but since it was free we figured why not. So we did get breakfast the next day and we had a great waiter and the food was very good. All in All for my first time in Vegas it was alot of fun but I would never stay at the Four Queens again. They do not treat everyone the same

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens is FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: MichelleK09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Queens for the first time from 1/3 - 1/7/10 and from start to finish this was a fantastic vacation!! When I arrived to check in around 7:30 pm, I was checed in within 3 minutes - great service. I was assigned room 1640 in the South Tower as I requested a higher room away from the Freemont experience and that is exactly what I got. The room had 2 double beds, a dresser with a very nice flat screen tv, plenty of hangers in the closet, a coffee maker and a safe in the nightstand - everything was extremely clean. Yes the bathroom is small but it serves it's purpose and was clean. All of the staff at the hotel are friendly, helpful and pleasant. Magnolia's cafe has a great menu at very reasonable prices, quick and friendly wait staff and the food is wonderful. I highly recommend their 7.95 prime rib dinner - to die for!! The casino is well laid out and ventilated, brightly lite and enjoyable to game in. This was my first time experiencing the Fremont Street light show and that was amazing. I took the double-duece all the way down to the Belt (Las Vegas) Outlet mall the day before I left and the discounts there are amazing! I did stop to see the "cats" and the MGM they were beautiful but don't plan on gambling there becaue the machines were TIGHT. Gambling on Fremont is a lot cheaper and easier to do with just a short walk to all the casinos. I am hoping to go back to Vegas soon and will ALWAYS stay at the Four Queens!! Employees were fantastic, the hotel, casino, cafe and rooms were all clean and housekeeping was amazing! Trust me for the price you can usually book this hotel for it is a steal and the quality is amazing! You wont be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place or worst”
Reviews.Author: bmboop
Reviews.Content: This was our third and final time to stay at four queens. We turned down two free nights at sam's town to stay here (my mistake). Will still like the location but this last trip the hotel seemed like they nickeled and dimed you for everything. resort fee, pay to park even though you are a guest etc.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGreg
Reviews.Content: Just ok, I would stay at the Golden Nugget next time in Vegas. Rooms -bottom end Food - Fair Casino - nice and roomy Location - great for being in the center of downtown Chicago's - outstanding!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Actively fumigating for bedbugs...”
Reviews.Author: tomjonesrocks
Reviews.Content: I made some last-minute plans to attend CES and as all the strip hotels were in full-bore-gouging mode for the conference, we booked a cheap room at this hotel which somewhat surprisingly was offering very cheap rates and also had availability. The main purpose of my review is to let other potential travelers know that the hotel in some rooms is actively fumigating for bedbugs. They actually have notes on some of the doors there where they're not allowing guests to stay currently. Our room was just a couple doors down from two closed rooms, so even though I tore my bed to shreds and inspected closely the matteress, between the box, etc., I did not sleep well. I opted to wear long pants and shirt and did not put my bag on the bed out of paranoia. It did not make for a pleasant stay. This aside, the room/hotel was pretty much a spartan value in line for the ask price of the rooms. They surprised me with a flat screen TV in the room but the TV did not have HD. It looked reasonably clean but I have to laugh at some of the reviews here "i.e., 'I'm done with you, MGM--Four Queens is better' etc." This was an unusual situation for me and I won't be back. If it weren't for the fumigation notices I might have said the place was sufficient for college students looking for cheap digs--but bedbugs are a nasty problem that you can bring home with you so I can't recommend to anyone right now. I do like the cheap gambling in the casino downstairs here though.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a cheap crash pad - toilet blew up”
Reviews.Author: jma52
Reviews.Content: These rooms are very basic but for the price they're ok especially if you're alone or VERY cozy with a traveling companion. The bathroom is so small I could barely change my mind in it. Most exciting highlight was the exploding overflowing toilet that flooded the room and ALL the area in front even out to the hallway at 3 a.m.. Maintenance did arrive with blazing speed but they soaked it up as well as possible then threw a bunch of towels on the wet areas. I had to walk over this area to get into the bathroom. Ew. If you're a light sleeper you can hear the Fremont Street music so make note if that's an issue. I was on Floor 8 and it wasn't very loud. The Chicago Brew Pub had some decent beers. Magnolia's had seriously low standard breakfast fare. The hash browns tasted like they fried them in the same grease as some kind of fish. I didn't gamble here instead I went to some nearby places. All in all not the nighmare hotel from hades but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “My Mom & I had a wonderful stay at The Four Queens!”
Reviews.Author: Mypizan
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I were both pleasantly surprised with our stay at The Four Queens Hotel. My mom recently had a knee operation so we opted to stay on Freemont Street ("old las vegas") as opposed to the Strip. This was the perfect option since we could quickly bounce from place to place without having to walk a mile(s). After thorough review of hotels on Freemont, we opted for the Four Queens based primarily on other reviewers indicating the staff was exceptional. The cost of the hotel was an extreme bargain so we were a little leary of what we may find upon our arrival. We found the reviews were right, the staff is amazing. Everyone from the front desk to the cage, to the cleaning crew to the restaurant staff was incredibly friendly and sincerely interested in making sure we were pleased and happy with our stay. I can not say enough decent things about them. We received a room on the top floor that had a beautiful view of the mountains surrounding the city and Freemont Street below. Now, keep in mind you are not staying at a brand new gazillion dollar hotel on the Strip. We did however, believe that the room met all of our needs. It was very clean, roomy and the beds were very cozy. The doors and bathroom were kind of outdated, but again, clean and plenty of hot, strong flowing water. We found their internal promotions to be very nice. We received a large coupon book when we checked in and used (and saved $) with a lot of them and obtained a lot of free slot play (I think there were coupons for the tables too, but we are more into the slots). Within three months of returning for our trip, Four Queens sent us both a promotion to stay there again.... FOR FREE! If our vacation time would have allowed, we would have done it in a heart beat. If you are a "princess" with Ritz standards, this hotel may not suit you. For us however, it was the perfect place in a perfect location and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!”
Reviews.Author: SiliconTek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our trip to Vegas and we were both pleased with the service and the location. My last few visits to Vegas I spent top dollar to stay on the main strip, so this time I decided to stay in the Fremont area and take advantage of some of the better values in the area. Our room was clean and livable, they have low limits on the games, and they also have some really nice restaurants. If you go, make sure you eat at the Chicago Brewing company, they have some awesome pizza and beer! The location is awesome, the night life was fantastic, and the other casino's in the area have some really nice meal deals and entertainment. If you are at all into sushi, make sure to hit up the Red Sushi Restaurant at the Golden Nugget, it was a very nice place and the sushi was amazing, namely the smoked salmon!

Reviews.Title: “6:5 Blackjack Invades Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: spursone
Reviews.Content: Have been gambling at the Four Queens for 10 years. Have always enjoyed playing Blackjack and have always had good luck. This was our first time to stay at this hotel. Upgraded to a suite but unfortunately it was in the older tower and overlooked Fremont Street. This created quite a bit of noise at night but did not ruin the trip. Overall, the hotel is nice and the staff are very friendly. However, the reason for the trip report. The Four Queens was once a great place to play blackjack. Not anymore! They have allowed 6:5 bllackjack into their casino. For those that don't know, this is a variation that greatly increases the house profit and hurts the player. Stay away from the Four Queens if you love blackjack!

Reviews.Title: “impressed with rooms and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pmpknking
Reviews.Content: I booked this room with the hopes to be steps from the fremont street exp. and thats just what i got. The rooms were clean and up to date. the bathrooms were a bit dated but overall the stay was worth the money and the location was perfect. The check in was quick and painless. No unexpected extra fees. We only stayed one night but would consider returning to this hotel. We had a nice view of the stratsophere from our room. oh yeah. No ac. that was the only bummer.. but would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “different”
Reviews.Author: barbm12thtee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but it is very clean. There's an enclave of hotels and casinos within walking distance and under a huge dome and so not much traffic. On the downside, there were a lot of homeless people asking for handouts. Also I don't think the people at the Player's Club were very respectful of their customers. A woman employee called a young man a loser two times when he walked away from her desk. I wonder what she said about me?

Reviews.Title: “Just ok-”
Reviews.Author: CM36154
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usally visit Vegas twice a year, but this will change due to the very tight slots at the Four Queens and the rest of them located on Freemont Street; very suspicious and wierd, I almost thought I was in a library. We have never lost so much money on stingey and quiet slot machines. A/C in room was not working "this time of year' and window only opened about 6" wide. It was very warm in the room. Parking was promised to be free since The Four Queens was going to honor the free parking policy from Binions. Parking was not free and the front desk clerk would not comp even though it was a verbal contractal agreement between me and the casino. I will not be visting the Four Queens or Vegas for a long, long time. Its no wonder why visitor rates are plummeting. We will be trying the casinos in Laughlin, Arizona next time. We can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Restaurant-Yes, Hotel-No”
Reviews.Author: Redhead267
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebrate my sister's birthday. My reservations were for Binions and it wasn't until the shuttle driver told us that we found out that the hotel at Binions was closed. He dropped us there and they sent us to the Four Queens (both owned by the same). I usually stay at the California or Main St. Station but, these rooms were very economical. Bad move. The room was o.k. but, the staff is not very friendly or helpful. However, we had a great meal at Magnolia's (I would recommend this anytime) and next time we'll go to The California or Main St. Station even if the rooms are free at the Four Queens and just go to the Magnolia to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small”
Reviews.Author: VillageGreenGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens for 4 nights in December 2009. We liked it's downtown location, the inexpensive price, our quiet room in the South Tower, and the friendly and helpful staff. However, our room was small and it's bathroom was tiny. Hotel and casino both felt old and worn out. Travel Tip: Across the street, at Fremont Hotel, there is free shuttle to Sam's Town.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: TimeOffWorking
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Fremont Street stay in Las Vegas Four Queens Hotel. The stay was the worse experience of over 30 years of visiting Las Vegas. Got a room on the ninth floor. My first night sleeping was irritable; trouble sleeping, had white tee shirt and long pants. Got up around noon and discovered bedbug bites hurting on right and left arm. Got worse as day and evening went on. By night end found that I was bitten 16 times, two arm and the face. Complained to front desk, signed a report and was given a new room with upgrade to the sixth floor. The lady at the front desk said the new room would be clean. I said that I would not sleep on the ninth floor again. Second night sleep, slept with a long sleeve shirt and long pants. Woke up and found that I was bitten 4 more times. Just could not believe this, so I just let it go. Third night sleeping and got bitten another 2 more bites and they were very bad bites. Now I know why both Binion's and Four Queens Hotel Casino; owned by TLC Casino Enterprises Inc., needs to be closed down and both building demolished. Got home with some lose of vision. Will have to go to the emergency clinic in the morning and see if I do not have any permanent damage to the hands, arms, face and neck with 20 severe bites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: retiretotravelusa
Reviews.Content: It is so easy to feel at home in this hotel. This was the tenth trip to vegas, fifth at the Queen.

Reviews.Title: “Has one of the BEST dealers in town!!!”
Reviews.Author: Colorado777
Reviews.Content: We enjoy gambling at the Four Queens! We are from Colorado and we have a great time at the tables in the Four Queens. We come every year for the NRF. We enjoy playing cards at the tables together. This year we met June one of the best dealers in town! We had fun visiting and teasing her. Of course, she gave it all back to us, too! I think she enjoyed our company, also! She asked us to come back the next day because she was going to bring us her "homemade peanut brittle!" We came back and she gave us a whole sack of peanut brittle, that was the best we have ever eaten! I wish that the Four Queens would make her Employee of the Month! Thank you so much June! Love from the Colordo Group of Women

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ATVDAD1
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at 4 Queens in the past 3 years. It was good, as expected. We were allowed very early check-in on December 3rd at 9:30 A.M. I was happy we were able to check in so early since it was the begining of the National Rodeo Finals. They were friendly, but direct and to the point at check-in. We were given a South tower room, 6th floor. We were right under the fremont street experience canopy. If we would have been put on the 7th floor or higher we would have been looking at the outside top of the canopy. We were able to lay on the bed at night, leave the curtains open and watch the fremont shows. It was kind of cool! The elevathor is just a couple of steps inside the casino, as you walk in off of fremont street. Very convenient. The room was average and dated, but clean and everything worked. There was a small 4 cup coffee pot, hair dryer and the usual soaps, shampoo, etc. Water pressure was awesome! As a matter of fact it was almost to strong. The safe was in the bottom of the night stand. A little hard to get to, but hey...it's a safe! I was happy we even had one. We did not eat there this time, but we did visit the bar and found the drinks and service to be fine. Free cocktail service while gambling was no problem. Plenty of staff and opportunities for drinks. The drinks were weak, but I wasn't going to complain. We only played Video Poker here and the machines treated us well! Played 9/6 JOB and I believe 8/5 Bonus Poker. 25 cent denomination at the East end of the table games. Security was everywhere! Although, I do believe that the extra staff and security was probably due to the rodeo and all of the cowboys in the place. Everyone was well behaved, having a good time! I would recommend this place to anyone who is fine with clean, comfortable but not fancy. Best I remember the North tower might haave been a little newer, but not 100% sure. I would rate this place a 7 or 8 out of 10 over-all.

Reviews.Title: “It suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: mrsripple
Reviews.Content: Just as most of the reviews state, room is small and dated but clean, staff very friendly, drink service in casino very good, excellent location. For a few more dollars would probably stay at GN again next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Valory
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6-night stay at the Four Queens. The room was a little dated, but it was clean and comfortable. There's an ironing board and iron in the room, and I really appreciated having a coffee maker in the room. There was also a safe that was more than big enough to fit my laptop, which was good. Some people I talked to said that the water pressure in their shower was way too high, making it uncomfortable, but that wasn't a problem for me. The bathroom was very small, though. The hotel is in a great location, with the Fremont Street Experience right outside the door, so I was able to go down and see whichever shows I wanted to see throughout the week without making a special trip. Also, the Deuce bus to the Strip and the outlet stores is nearby, so that's really convenient. I stayed on the Strip once before, and you have to take a bus to get up and down it anyway, so staying downtown seemed better to me. I got to see whatever I wanted to on the Strip, but I saw more of Fremont Street than I would have otherwise. Plus, the Four Queens Casino was one of the few places I found that had 9/6 jacks or better video poker. I managed to get a royal flush, so the trip more than payed for itself!

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens= Silver Strike”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelbug1981
Reviews.Content: I arrived to hotel and registered easily and quickly, the front staff were friendly and effeien, no long lines. The garage has a few spaces for self park so you can park and unload your luggage. I would suggest parking on the top floor next to the elevator, its not crowded up there. (I think they charge $3 for parking per day to your room)We got a nice room on a high floor #1821, I uploaded pictures, see for yourself. The room was clean, quiet with a killer view. The cleaning people were nice and very polite. Sign up for the member card they give you free slot machine credits and discounts for the restaurants. I would not recommend the restaurant, food tasted old, freezer made the waitress was aloof and the cashier was ok. Room service did not answer, but eventually called back room :C My husband loved the silver strike slots, only the red were silver. Any who, overall its great for the price, so live a little and book some fun on a budget at this hotel :D cheers

Reviews.Title: “Downtown exprerient”
Reviews.Author: Rei38
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Las Vegas.. We stayed at the Four Queens, I was a little scared after reading the reviews from some other travelers.. Stating how the room was so small and the staff was rude..etc.. We actually had a great time.. The room was clean and bed comfortable..we stay 3 nights and paid only $27.00 a night & 2 night free. Plus $50.00 com. for slots machine. we don't have to pay parking like another traveler said. The staff all were nice and friendly.. The rooms were cleaned daily and we would definitley stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: RosaElliott
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the four queens November 3 and 4, arrived after 11:30 p.m. the first room we were given was still dirty and had candy wrappers, pop bottles, etc. went back downstairs, there was no mention of sorry, no mention of an upgrade, just gave us another room, so up we go again, checked under the mattress for bed bugs, no bed bugs but someone forgot their sex toy. I guess housekeepers never check under the mattress. Soap is of the worst quality, why would a hotel get their soap and shampoo from India? Cannot they not find a supplier in the USA. All of the rooms are ajoining so you can hear everything from the room next to you, I would not stay there again, even getting the room comped, the drink service while gambling was very slow and non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: doodlebugOhio
Reviews.Content: Good Time was had by all. Rooms were clean and tidy, but dated. Need some remodeling

Reviews.Title: “Great place - cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: TimW619
Reviews.Content: It's only $50 on weekdays but when the weekend comes it goes up to $100-$150 per night. Nice small rooms with 2 beds and a T.V. Good shower/bathroom. Right in the middle of Freemont Street, close to local bars in old las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Okay For The Price”
Reviews.Author: finnie2
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel with basic rooms that have been spruced up a bit. Our view of a cement wall was not great and the walls between rooms are thin - we could clearly hear the folks next door. It was not stated during booking but there is a $3.00 daily parking fee. It isn't a place we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “its all good”
Reviews.Author: timeonmyhand
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, no odours like other older hotels I have stayed in. I had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the Fremont experience, it was a little noisey at the top of each hour (untill 11pm), but I enjoyed it. The room was 25 dollars a night.....you can't beat that. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great fun”
Reviews.Author: Katharine10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights. On check in, I requested a quiet room and certainly received it - we were not bothered by any noise at any time. The room was clean, with a fridge, which was useful for snacks and drinks. The hotel is old and a little worn but is very clean, staff is friendly, the location is great and prices very reasonable. We went to the comedy show and it was hilarious. Won at slots and had a great dinner at the hotel coffee shop, Magnolia. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Piko_boy
Reviews.Content: The main reason that I booked a room at this hotel was because most of the activities that were being held for our class reunion were in the adjacent hotels and bars - really convenient. Staying here allowed us to walk next door without having to deal with traffic and parking. The room is really quite dated and is in need of an update. The bathroom is quite small. Our room was on the fifth floor with a nice view of the huge roof top equipment - oh well, it's not as if we kept the curtains open anyway. My biggest complaint was with the plumbing - the sink and tub have really slow drain issues. I called the front desk to connect me to housekeeping but the woman responded in a sassy tone that I should call building engineering. I said I don't care who I should be calling, just get someone to fix it. Also, the shower head was super strong. I think that's why the tub drain was so slow. I will probably not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: trola60
Reviews.Content: We were in room 608 in the North Tower which overlooked the Fremont Street Experience and it was great UNTIL we tried to go to sleep. The 'Experience' continues with loud music and bright lights until midnight but the announcements, revelers etc continue well into the night/all night.. We were told that there were no earplugs available at the hotel. The front desk manager told us we should have been warned at check in that the room faced this revelery but alas we were not. The A/C system was quite loud in the room with it thunking on and off all night. We also were able to hear the neighbors shower as if it were our own in the am. That said the room was quite adequate, clean and large enough. The personnel was fun and helpful (except for the earplugs) and Dante makes a mighty fine margarita - ask for the real kind not the special. Staying on Fremont Street was great since it is all there with drinks to go with your 'bag of chips' PS room 600 in the same tower is directly across from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennrife66
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Las Vegas.. We stayed at the Four Queens, I was a little scared after reading the reviews from some other travelers.. Stating how the room was so small and the staff was rude..etc.. We actually had a great time.. The room was clean and bed comfortable..The staff all were nice and friendly.. The rooms were cleaned daily and we would definitley stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherMStoner
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say how much fun we had downtown at the Four Queens! Our Vegas experience was much more enjoyable because of all the friendly staff members at the hotel/casino. We did not stay here, but have in the past and loved it. The dealers and pit bosses were absolutely outstanding. Thank you, and see you in March!!!

Reviews.Title: “good pick”
Reviews.Author: blackalls
Reviews.Content: after having arrived after 14 hour flight we booked into 4 queens, looking forward to having a early night were given a lovely room, with everything in it but the bed.,,,after contacting front desk was given another room...even with entertainment going on in the street we had good comfprtable bed...had no trouble sleeping. would not hesitate staying again...much prefer fremont street to the strip...costwise we only paid $50 for the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value, good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: pharmdeity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our way out to California. We had no reservations until we checked online prices early the same evening and got a great price @ less than 30/nt. I've stayed at the Golden Nugget which is nicer but much more expensive. We just needed a place to rest that night. We didn't eat at any restaurants so I can't evaluate them. The room was nice, nothing fancy, but was very clean which for us is the main thing. Played a little poker at the nugget's room and did well so made it an even better stay. Check in was quick, staff were friendly and courteous. I asked for a quiet room and got just that. There was no charge for self parking which other reviewers apparently did not experience. We will certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLadyOct
Reviews.Content: Room was more like a closet - got clean towels and nothing else - hair dryer did not work - most of outlets in room did not work-no business suite except for a very expensive pc/printer-no free ISP available - service in Magnolias was mediocre at best, our group of 3 couples caused major confusions on every check. You really have to watch the dealers - caught a couple of them pulling tricks for what they thought was someone who was not watching. There is no control in the casino area - too many very loud people who were out of control with noise and language - staff did nothing. Was on the 16th floor and could not wait to get home due to noise from street ALL NIGHT long. Gift shop or player club was not open when I left at 700 so no gifts, and could not take advantage of my player card. Cheap yes - inside from top to bottom. The only nice about this visit was the young lady named Rachel who checked us into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fremont n Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: oziinn
Reviews.Content: Vegas is absolutely fantastic and if you haven't been before, stay on The Strip just to get a feel of it, after that stay on Fremont and the Four Queens and get a taste of downtown. This was our 4th year running at Four Queens and only a few mishaps were promptly resolved. We arrived in vegas, got our car and checked in, we booked a standard room, good value for the price £21 per night, we went out had a few drinks had a bite to eat and retired for an earlyish night. We were woken up 3 times in the night by our noisy neighbours demonstarting their sexual prowess. The next day we went out for breakfast (Paradise buffet - excellent) feeling tired and violated, on returning to the hotel we went to the front desk, where we explained the situation. They repeatedly appologised and promptly upgraded us to to a suite which was gorgeous. We love the Four Queens, the staff are attentive, the location is brilliant and the $7.99 prime rib dinner is great value.

Reviews.Title: “It was a comfortable, fun experience from check-in to check out.”
Reviews.Author: TempeAZtraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not the fanciest I've stayed in, but our room was clean and comfortable, with windows that actually opened to allow fresh air into the room (a rarity these days, and much appreciated!), and a sizeable flat-screen television with a good selection of channels. The hotel has reasonably priced internet service (about half the price of the hotel we stayed in on "the Strip." From the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out, the hotel staff members were invariably friendly and accommodating. The hotel's restaurant serves delicious chicken fried steak, among many other delicious offerings. It is one of the better restaurants in the casinos in downtown Las Vegas. (I also recommend the buffet at the Main Street Station hotel / casino). The Fremont Street light show was fun, and the "Summer of '69 Woodstock TributePalooza" free musical entertainment was also a good show. The Four Queens Casino has affordable ($3 and $5) tables for those of us who don't like to "bet the house," and a huge variety of fun slots. Additionally, unlike some of the "high end" casinos on the strip, the coctail waitresses actually serve the penny slot machines and bring your drinks back fairly quickly. And, we won money! What could be better, really? We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always!”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Bubba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed our bi-annual trip to Vegas and stayed at the 4 Queens for the 6th time. Check in took 5 minutes at 9:00 pm and we asked for a north tower room away from Fremont and were taken care of quickly. The rooms are small but very functional. We never waited more that 5 minutes, usually less than 1, for an elevator. We parked in the garage and never had any problems except with the construction in the downtown area which has got a lot of streets messed up. Check out was also quick, everyone we dealt with was friendly and accomodating and I would highly recommend the Queens for anyone looking for cheap, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: recentguestoct2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 4queens 25 years ago so and expected an old run down hotel but to my surprise it was a Beautiful and very clean room, Everyone at the hotel was nice and helpful and the location cant be beat. I will never stay on the strip again, Downtown is WAAAAAY more fun. I highly recommend the 4queens!!!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown GREAT - Four Queens Less than Great”
Reviews.Author: kmac62
Reviews.Content: Downtown is a different experience compared to the strip. Street Party atmosphere, with everyone having a great time. Stayed in a petite suite on the 16th floor, opposite side of the Freemont Street Experience. Room was comfortable with normal amenities, to include a sitting area. Tile counters in baths, tub/shower combo. Room was clean and hotel service staff was fantastic to all my needs. The casino is small, and for the most part very friendly and accomodating. Except 2 pit supervisors who are very rude to everyone, even the dealers. One was yelling and screaming at them, which should have been done behind closed doors. The other was just laughing at the yelling, even at the point when he yelled, "they should all be fired!!". Found out shortly when I requested to speak to a casino supervisor regarding the very unprofessionalism of the pit supervisors, that the casino supervisor was on duty, at the other pit, saw the entire thing and was laughing with them. Very unprofessional for a service business to air their dirty laundry in front of clients. The next day, saw one of the idiot pit supervisors and asked what time a certain table game was going to open, he said, "don't know, don't care what you want". A couple of bad apples can ruin the entire barrel, and they have ruined the fun times at the casino. Plain and pure "stupidity", and casino management does not seem to care. There are much better places to gamble where everyone can have fun and relax. Hotel has NO spa, NO pool (can use sister property's pool). Does not compare to Golden Nugget next door.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly any rooms are non-smoking.”
Reviews.Author: TorranceSenior
Reviews.Content: Even if they say it is non smoking you have to go into the room and check it out. I talked to the front desk (very nice and wanting to be helpful) when I quadruple checked that the room was a non-smoking one. I was told that 4 times. But we got into the room all the windows were open and it stank to high heaven. We talked to the house cleaning help and they classified it as a smoking room but she said that even if a room is non-smoking they have no way to stop the next person from smoking in it. So we ran to all the rooms to find one we could sit in and not gasp for breath. We were even offered a suite but the other bed was a couch pull out and very uncomfortable. We finally found a person in our group that had two beds that didn't stink to high heaven and we traded with them and then went to the front desk to get things changed and new keys for us. The next thing was equally a mess and that is there were no electrical outlets near the head of the beds. First I tried to plug in my computer and then my cpap. The front desk said they did not have any extension cords for me to use. By this time I was tired and did not want to get dressed and go argue with someone to get one. I was exhausted and we went to sleep with out it. My roommate had to find a new room the next morning. I had forgotten how the cpap was needed to stop my snoring. I loved the casino and ambience of the old style and the easy accesss to the fremont light shows at night. It was excellent. The first show was Bad to the Bone, next was American Pie, then Queen, We will Rock you and it ended with Kiss I left since I was not that familiar with Kiss to stay. I know This ages me but I earned my age and the first three satified my entertainment for that night. I was not able to do very well in the casino and I thought it was too crowded but I won on the slots at the Wynn. Everyone seems to give you a free $10.00 to start with for signing up and the Deuces Wild was fun for almost 3 hours. I even won $60.00. From the strip the bus is $3.00 one way and when I come back I am going to get a bus pass (good for 24 hours) and get on the bus the very first day. On my way back everybody was going to the Fremont light show which is across the mall walkway from the Four Queens. Good luck and have a good trip with an extension cord and talking to the front desk until you find a room that smells good. Oh I almost forgot they do offer to send someone to spray the room but that only is topical since the cigarette smoke is embedded into the room. You would probably have to have it sprayed at least every day. Oh and I didn't know that you had to pay for the wi-fi internet. I had made sure that it was available but no one mentioned the cost. Also the pool is not on the premises you have access to one across the street. But all of this won't keep me from visiting again. I'll just be more prepared next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: rudyjane
Reviews.Content: My brother and I travel to LV once a year. We usually stay on the strip, but this year decided to stay DT. Got a great deal at the 4 Queens, and with TA reviews backing it up, I booked our 3 nights there. The whole DT experience was great for us. The hotel, while older, was clean, the beds very comfortable, the casino was fun, Magnolia's had great food, and the central location could not be beat. Our room was on the 6th floor, so I was a bit concerned about noise, but it was very quiet, down to not even hearing our neighbors come and go. Going forward, we will make DT, and the 4 Queens, our base for future trips. We sleep and shower in our rooms, so having a clean room, with great hot water pressure, worked for us. Add to that the great rate we got, we couldn't have been happier. Both of us agreed this was the most relaxing trip to Vegas we have had in all our years of going.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bargain”
Reviews.Author: fortworthgambler
Reviews.Content: Spent the Labor Day weekend at the Four Queens and was completely satisfied. Starting with Ruby and the front desk personnel, all employees were friendly and helpful. The room overlooked the Fremont Street Experience and was one of my favorites in nineteen years of visiting Las Vegas. It was clean with a very good bed, and had obviously been recently renovated. The casino was busy and a lot of fun, and the food at Chicago Brewing and the Deli was excellent, as was the service. The sports book was one of the friendliest and most professional I have experienced in Las Vegas, so thanks very much to Stephanie and her crew. Security, housekeeping, and the parking garage checkout guy were all positive and friendly. The Four Queens is a super bargain for the money and I will make it my hotel of choice when visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay in downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mommy3k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (early 40's) stayed for one Saturday night over Labor Day weekend as an extension to staying the next three days comped in a 5-star hotel on the strip. We had never been to Las vegas before, and wanted to see what downtown was like, in addition to having a decent room rate for the extra night. We chose the 4 Queens based on the room rates and the reviews we'd read on Trip Advisor. The hotel was just as advertised. We really had no major complaints. It is obviously an old building, but everything was in good repair. We had a 17th floor view in the north tower. We did not hear much noise from the canopy below from up there. The shows and free conncerts were great. The casino was of a reasonable size and had a good variety of slots and table games. Drink service was slow at first, but picked up once I kept tipping and made a point of searching out my cocktail waitress and telling her she was a bit hard to track down. She said they had been so slow all summer and then all of a sudden there was so much business they couldn't keep up. I believed her. They really didn't have enough servers for the number of folks playing in the casino. The front desk was friendly and efficient. we checked in at 1:00, so our room was not ready yet. We ate at Magnolias for breakfast which was good, reasonably priced and fast. The room had a coffee maker and an updated TV set. The bathroom is very small, but the hot water was VERY hot! We were pleasantly surprised by that. The bed was comfy. Like I said, no real complaints. This is not a 5 star place, nor does it advertise to be. You get what you pay for, we got our $48 worth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay after rough start”
Reviews.Author: like2travellots
Reviews.Content: We visitied the Four Queens Casino from Aug 16-21 on a great deal found on Expedia - $18 per night. Our stay got off to a bit of a rough start as I had never been to this hotel / casino before and had difficulty finding the valet parking due to all the construction. The Valet parking is actually on a side street (2nd street I think) which ends behind the bandshell which is between the four queens and the fitz. I entered through the wrong street and ended up going into the wrong way into valet exit through the parking garage entrance - poorly marked but eventually I got things straigthened out with the slightly annoyed valet staff. (The valet here was difficult at the best of time - seemed to be understaffed or not anyone around with the separate valet drop off and pickup areas) Parking at the 4 Queens is $3 per night - but if you have a players card (which I had and anyone can get for free - the remove it from your bill). Once I had the in / out procedure down few problems (other then lack of staff with parking my rental car). The check in was a breeze - less then 2 minutes, polite efficient check in staff. We came in late and the casino was busy - again we had not stayed here before so found trip to eleveator the first time (across the casino) a little confusing. We had a nice room on the17th floor with a view towards stratosphere and strip. Our friends had a room overlooking Fremont street on 4th floor which was a nicer view but much nosier at night. Our room was clean and an excellent value for $18 per night. It included a flat screen TV with some channels, nice king size bed and adequate (if small) clean washroom. We enjoyed the casino and M restaurant - with an excellent Prime Rib special for only $9.99 (less with our players card and 2 for 1). Unfortunately no pool, but access to a surprisingly nice, quet pool on the roof of Binions (both hotels now owned by same group) I liked the hotel - we stayed a few nights on the strip as well and am starting to prefer the downtown atmosphere. We walked to many places easily (Fremont, Golden Nuggett, California, Main Street Station, El Cortez and others) and never felt the heat of the walks on the strip or the length. When on strip we are always driving and can never have more then a few drinks. Downtown, easily walked and less pressure if drinking a little too much. I highly recommend this hotel - we stayed at Fremont last year and would not hesitate to stay at either one again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: ERipley
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying on Freemont Street. The hotel was renovated about 2 years ago. We requested a room not facing Freemont Street since we heard it could be noisy. The room was small but beautifully furnished and the bathroom was very modern. I loved the shower head and took a picture to show my husband so he could replace our old one. Even though we were not facing Freemont street, we could still hear The Freemont Street Experience echoing but we were so tired, we feel asleep anyway. If you want something different than staying on the Strip, go to the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Security Issues !”
Reviews.Author: firemanfromeverett
Reviews.Content: Left wife in hotel room alone, was not a good idea. Ex-tenant was trying togain access to my room and my wife didnt open the door but asked what they wanted. They said they left something behind in the bathroom tissue box. My wife was frieghtened and notified security and the intuders left before security got there. When I returned I was curious to see what was left in the tissue box and found a crack pipe inside. I would have thought security would of check it out but they did nothing. I brought the aritcles to the front desk and my wife was frightened to stay and sleep there. There is no security staff watching the elevators so be prepared to see strangers lurking about in the hoel corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the 4Queens”
Reviews.Author: Katnjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a very good experience. Arrived at noon and we got checked into our room right away. We were on the top floor of the south tower. The room was very clean, the beds were soo comfy. The food at Magnolias was good (we used 2-4-1's the 3 times we ate there) Had late breakfast twice (the french toast was yummy) and the prime rib special ($9.95) which came with salad, baked potato, vegies, and roll. Won $116.00 on the $10 free slot play for joining the slot club. The only "big " win for me. Great location, lots of slots to play, fun time and good cocktail service One complaint - yes, the bathrooms are small, not much they can do about that, but the shower head was really small and old. Replacing them would help the "old" bathroom setup. We would definitely stay there again and recommend for anyone looking to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: brandi0825
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to the las vegas area, sharing our time between the strip and the fremont street experience. Being this was our 3rd time just this year I had come across a really great deal through southwest airlines for airfare and travel for about $450 TOTAL and could not pass it up. We usually stay at Fitzgeralds, the plaza and the vegas club, and we are always saying that we need to venture out and stay somewhere else....we were SO IMPRESSED with the 4 queens!!! we stayed on the 19th floor and our room yet very small, was very clean and tidy with a nice 42 inch TV. the front desk staff was very friendly as well as the bell desk. had just a few complaints, and i dont even know if this counts, but the elevator didnt work in the parking garage so when we got there we had to lug our suitcase on the street to get to the hotel, i did mention this when we checked in and they were aware and had someone working on ut. the tub had a really really slow drain. oh and you had to pay a $6 fee for parking in the garage, i told her that i thought it was stupid and she didnt really seem to care....but that was it! other than that i would highly recommend this place....the sign up for the players club was a good one, you got free play and a 2 4 1 in there cafe there called magnolias. great for 4th meal aka drunk feast!

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid...Be Very Afraid”
Reviews.Author: temphier
Reviews.Content: It's not so much the Four Queens itself - although, there are service issues and a casino that is less than desirable. The main issue is the location that is situated in a seedy area where my husband was accosted by "sex workers" and vagrants. An overall sub-par environment.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: tgbobbi
Reviews.Content: The room cost only $115 for four weekdays. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The location is very convenient to the Greyhound bus depot, the Downtown Transportation Center, and the Walgreens. I took the Deuce bus to the Las Vegas Outlet and to Planet Hollywood ffrom Las Vegas Blvd and Fremont. Thc Mirandas coffee shop overlooks the Casino floor. It has economical daily specials. I didn't win, but I didn't lose much either.

Reviews.Title: “Great value~Stayed many times and will come back”
Reviews.Author: VegasOneMoreTime
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and are more than satisfied with the rooms. They are not as big and fancy as some but are clean and comfortable and have a coffee pot which seems to be a luxury in it's self anymore! Everyone in the whole place is friendly and helpful. Location is great within walking distance to many places. The comps are great. However, we were very disappointed in the gambling this trip. I had expected the slots to be tight because of the economy, but they were much worse than I thought they would be so I wasn't able to spend as much time gambling as I love to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlackjackPlayer1
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever trip to Las Vegas and I have to say I am very pleased that we stayed at the Four Queens and on Freemont Street as opposed to being on "The Strip"! The staff we encountered were all very helpful and seemed happy to serve us. When we arrived at the hotel, we gave the desk clerk $20 and asked if there was any possibility of receiving a complimentary upgrade and she gave us a petite suite!! We spent 6 wonderful nights on the 14th floor of the South tower in a room with a king size bed, two sofas and a 32" LCD television for less than $190 including the $20 tip! The room was very clean, spacious, and even had a refrigerator and an in room safe large enough to hold a laptop computer and any other belongings. The bathroom was also spacious and had a long vanity with two sinks. The view from the room overlooked the canopy of Freemont Street, and although we could hear the performances in the evenings, we were able to drown them out watching television. We were only in the room one evening before the performances were over, so the noise really was not an issue. We were in Vegas after all and therefore slept late and stayed out late! Freemont Street is great! It was very nice to be able to walk out onto the street and go from casino to casino without having to worry about traffic or walking in the hot sun during the middle of the day. It was remarkably clean for a large city with so many tourists, we were pleasantly surprised. We found Freemont Street to be much cleaner than "The Strip" from our experience. The food at the hotel was fantastic, as was the service. We also found several buffets in the surrounding casinos that were fantastic, and enjoyed all our meals in the Freemont Street area. The Paradise Buffet was probably our favorite place to eat. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner there during our trip. Most of the restaurants and buffets have really good deals on food. We are blackjack players so we did not play slots except for goofing around a few times. If you are a blackjack player, be sure to ask the pit bosses for complimentary food before leaving the tables because you do not earn comps for food on your cards. Most of the casinos in the Freemont area make you ask for comps and do not offer them on the cards, but a couple do. Also, if you look around the area, you can find casinos that offer 3 to 2 payouts on blackjacks as opposed to the 6 to 5 you find in most of them. There is easy access to "The Strip" via The Deuce (double decker bus) by walking about a block down Freemont to the bus stop. It is only $7 per 24 hour period to ride as much as you like. It took approximately 15 to 20 minutes to get to the strip from the hotel. We spent a day at the strip, went back to the hotel, then returned to the strip that evening to see a show at The Mirage. Freemont Street was more our speed because we did not enjoy the wall to wall people and walking long distances to go between casinos on the strip in 105 degree weather under full sun. The temperature was not that bad, but it dehydrates you quickly so be prepared to take along water. Overall we highly recommend the Four Queens and Freemont Street! We will definitely go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE PEOPLE AND A SCAM TO SEE SHOW”
Reviews.Author: dilllon1974
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to have a nice dinner and the server and hostest were VERY rude.I was VERY embarassed for my family.Then we had (free) tickets to a comdy show that turned out NOT to be free.They SCAM you on the drinks,and they were Rude to my family and myself.Over half the audiance walked out in the middle of the show.It was a horrible show and experiance.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: mothertravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Queens after doing research on Tripadvisor. My husand and I took a long weekend trip to celebrate our 10th anniversary, wished it was longer. I have absolutely no complaints about the Four Queens. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. We had free breakfast every morning at Magnolia's, basic but good (liked the sourdough toast). I received a buy one get one free dinner, since it was my birthday through the player's club. We both ordered the NY strip dinners at Magnolia's and thought they were pretty good. I had a $20 voucher for slot playing, so I did a little gambling (not a big gambler), won a few bucks. Within a few minutes of sitting at a slot machine a cocktail waitress was there offering drinks each time. The room is small but very comfortable, great air conditioning and shower, and clean. I went back to my room while it was being cleaned to change into tennis shoes after walking a bit (I think we walked ten miles that morning just checking the sites on the strip) and the cleaning lady was very nice, but requested I use my key to get into my room, very good to know your belongings are secure. I gave her a two dollar tip and asked for more coffee, and she was extremely appreciative. We came back later that night and had a surplus of coffee, shampoo, soap, and towels. I have stayed at Bally's, Harrah's, and MGM in the past. I paid significantly more for the room, they are all fine, but I enjoyed my time at the Four Queens more. More bang for significantly less buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: albuquemama
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect for one person. It was very clean, comfortable and quiet. More than one person would have been a little crowded. The bathroom was small. The people at the front desk and throughout the Casino were very friendly. My only negative experience was in Magnolia's Restaurant. The service was fast, but the servers and hostess were unfriendly and seemed angry. There were two servers arguing with each other while I was eating breakfast. The food was average but reasonably priced. I would stay there again, just eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time on Fremont!”
Reviews.Author: lazkity
Reviews.Content: We felt comfortable staying here, after reading all the positive reviews & they were all right! I noticed nothing negative during our stay. We stayed on the strip for a week last November at a much pricier place and had much more fun on this stay...we certainly didn't miss having to drive or take cabs anywhere, nor being packed like a sardine on The Deuce in stifling heat! We liked the smaller scope of the 4 Queens and appreciated not walking for miles & getting lost in the casino. The rooms were just fine, comfy bed, clean, good maid service, no noise issues. Upon check-in (which took all of 3 or 4 minutes, same with checkout) we were given coupons for free breakfasts in the hotel restaurant for all the mornings we were there. An older demographic seems to be the norm at the Fremont hotels, leading to a much more relaxed pace than on the strip, which we found very pleasant....and you know what? I thought of one negative, there aren't ice machines on every floor...but, that was something we could live with.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for value and comfort? Look no further”
Reviews.Author: Mikey555
Reviews.Content: If you are after a place to stay that is clean comfortable and has friendly staff then the 4 Queens is the place for you. Ok its downtown in "Old Style Vegas" but there is still a lot to do in the area. And if you want to commute to the strip the bus ($3) is only a block away or a cab costs just $10 (make sure the cabbie goes straight down Vegas Blvd not out on the highway or its gonna come to $18 - $20). The value is outstanding having stayed there for 17 nights for a total of $540 in June/July, room service came every single day, the rooms are very clean and the air conditioning is excellent. Put it this way, who spends that much time in their room whilst in Vegas anyway? The service is fantastic, just pick up the phone and they are there with whatever you need in just a few minutes. The store downstairs is great for convenience and there is a walgreens (supermarket) just one block away. One of the highlights downtown is the Fremont Street Experience. Live music every night, festivals on the weekend and the unbelievable light show makes it truly one of a kind. The restaurants in the area are very good and great value. Magnolias and the Chicago Brewing Co at the 4 Queens are both great. Binions has the best cheeseburgers in the area and hennesys does really good homestyle meals at great prices. The best buffet by far is at the Golden Nugget with a great variety including asian and seafood. As for the casino's themselves they cant match the huge buildings on the strip but they are fun and functional and the limits are low with games such as 50c roulette, $2 blackjack and $3 craps. I stayed in the north tower which seems to be a bit newer than the other one. Checking in is easy and quick and there is no problem checking in early or out late provided the rooms aren't required immediately. Overall i would say if you need a place to stay that is comfortable and great value for money you cannot go past the 4 Queens. Most people go to Vegas to gamble or to do tours of the landmarks, so save your money for these things.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby but never again”
Reviews.Author: yankeesgirl09
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel and parked in the garage but had to take the elevator down to street level, then round the corner and walk outside toward the front valet area to get inside the hotel. (not convenient) Yes we met with a woman who did not want to be there, lousy attitude and some other lady just stood there with a look that could kill on her face. Bell hops were kind. Got to the room 2 beds, one lamp that hangs on the wall did not work. The lamp in the corner did not work. The cable outlet was hanging out of the wall with a brown extension cord dangling around it. No water pressure in the shower. I read a note on the back of the bathroom door that said "room rates are between $49 and $459..I dont know who would pay that much for that lousy room. We were on the fourth floor and heard the music from the Fremont show until midnight. We ate at the hotel restaurant where the service was fantastic!!! They made up for the front desk! But the whole smell of the hotel was just too much for me. I understand there is the smell or smoke but when we walked into the Golden Nugget, Lady Luck...they did not have that stench. I got home and washed both clean and dirty clothes at least twice to remove the stench. Oh...the workers at the Players Club also look like they dont wanna be there either..which is unfortunate cause I'm sure someone who lost their job due to the bad economy would love to do their duties and will do with a smile on their face!!! Just poor customer service...but I figured they all felt ill cause of the smell. One last comment..please be careful!! I was in the hotels restroom and as I was washing my hands, saw a lady walk in and use the 2nd sink next to me and began to wash her lower private areas. Literally lifter her dress and cleansed herself!!!! I was appalled!!! Come to find out she was a prostitute...we saw her later in the week with different men. So sad and disturbing. So if I weigh pros and cons...I would not recommend this hotel at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Turtle3103
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I stayed here for 2 nights from Jun 17 - 19. It locates 5 mins walk from the deuce bus stop and most of the hotels at downtown. The room itself is okay, but very small washroom, services are pretty good. However, when booking, try to request an upper level room because we stayed on 9th floor and we had no view (blocked by the neon light screen) and we heard the sound of the neon show from 7p-midnight and it sometimes gets annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kar344
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Four Queens--it will not be my last. Outstanding customer service. (One snippy person the whole week all over the city, and it happened to be the players' club redemption lady who waited on me!) Clean, comfortable hotel. I like the fact that Four Queens has coffeemakers in the rooms. I had not tried Binion's pool before this trip, and I liked it. Four Queens doesn't have a pool, so they have made arrangements to use Binion's. It is a small pool, but not at all crowded, and it really wasn't too much of a hassle to walk across the street--it's still less walking than one would have to do at any Strip hotel. As always, Magnolia's food was excellent. Slots were good. Drink service was good. The service everywhere in Las Vegas was excellent this trip--I think the economy has changed some attitudes. Anyway, book the Four Queens with confidence that you will have a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best comedians in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JeannieLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Having seen 4 other comedy acts in Las Vegas, the one at Four Queens was way better--they related to the audience, were incredibly funny, and if you don't think so, there's free drinks. Plus had a great spaghetti dinner for only $6.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sportsfanandteacher
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the 4 Queens in one of the North Tower rooms. Check-in was fast and friendly. They allowed us to check-in much earlier than the 3:00 check in time. The room had clean, soft linens, soft pillows, and a wonderful bed. The bathroom was small, but clean. All of the staff was really nice throughout our stay. They brought extra towels to the room when needed. We ate at Magnolia with the 2 for 1 offer quite a few times. The food was always great and the service in the restaurant was great. The hotel was easily accessible to the Deuce Bus and the bus routes to and from the airport. For the price, you just can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Accessible, few frills”
Reviews.Author: WStaso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never stayed in the Fremont area and the Four Queens was offering low prices compared to other name hotels....so we made reservations for 3 nights. We rented a car, a necessity actually to get downtown. When I heard in the elevator that someone had paid $40 for a taxi ride from the airport I felt much better about the car rental. It was easy to get into the hotel parking structure but getting from there into the hotel was a little annoying. The room, on the fourth floor, was plain but clean. The smoke alarm went off after showering, something we had to notify the front desk about. The hotel restaurant was average. No pool, though we had access to the rooftop pool at the Binions. That pool, however, was small and surrounded by concrete. No exercise room either to balance all the eating. We did enjoy watching the light show and seeing the artisans, and there were bands playing from time to time right outside. We walked around the area for a couple of hours. After that we found ourselves driving to the casinos on the strip and fighting the traffic. Next time we will return to a big name casino with a big pool and probably avoid the car rental and traffic. Once at the Four Queens was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs the Strip when everything is close by when staying Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: flowpop
Reviews.Content: My 5 night stay at the 4 Queens was GREAT. The room wasn't huge but it was more than adequate for my Wife and I. Room was very quiet, we had people beside us but we never heard any noise from them. Now if you are an early sleeper, I would suggest somewhere else because the Freemont experience is plenty loud 'til around 12:30 A. M. I wouldn't recommend the 4 Queens restaurants, the waitress was friendly but the other staff weren't friendly at all. Food was so so, price was fair with the 2 for 1 specials. Hotel was easy to commute to from airport and to Strip, but honestly who needs the Strip when you have it all right outside your door on Freemont St. Great stay for the price 4-1/2 stars for the overall package.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great price - and our favorite dealer!”
Reviews.Author: ChiefGreg
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that I forgot to review the Four Queens after our stay there last September. The wife and I traveled to LV for our wedding anniversary, and we knew we wanted to stay downtown. After searching TripAdvisor, we had decided on the Golden Nugget, but they didn't have a room available for the full length of our stay. We then opted to book at the Four Queens, and am I ever glad we did. We arrived after getting our rental acr at the airport, and the valet took care of our bags and parked our car. Check in was a breeze, but we got a bit lost finding our room. We booked a room in the tower closest to Fremont Street, so you have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators for that tower. The path wasn't marked very well, but we managed to run into someone who pointed the way. After you find the elevators the first time, they're very easy to find. We got up to our room, and I placed the night lock in the opening to hold the door open for the valet. A knock at the door a few minutes later was from Security, who was wlking the hallway and saw the open door so he checked to make sure everything was OK in the room. The valet arrived a few minutes later, and also knocked and waited until I opned the door to come in. As others have said, the rooms are not huge, but there's plenty to do that you don't need to spend a lot of time in the room. I would have liked a bigger chair to sit in, but I understand why there isn't one, and I could live without it. The bathroom could have been bigger for me, but once again, they have to work with the footprint of an old hotel building, so they have to make do with the size of the bathroom. We called and asked for extra towels and pillows, and they arrived within ten minutes without any issues at all.
