Rooms were taken care of every day, sometimes within an hour of us leaving the room in the morning. We enjoyed playing at many of the downtown hotels, but the El Cortez and the Four Queens were our two favorites. The El Cortez is just down from the Fremont Street Experience, which is where we found the lowest table game limits. But I had a blast playing at the Four Queens. The look of the casino is classic, a Victorian-like decor. A dealer taught me how to play Pai Gow Poker, which I had never understood before, and I became addicted to it. I also enjoy playing Blackjack and Roulette, and played those as well. A dealer named Junie was a pleasure to be with. I lost $100 at her table one night and walked away laughing and happy. She seems to want you to enjoy your game, and was just a great personality. We will definitely look for her specifically when we return. We used the rental car several days, decided to get away from the downtown casino scene for a while. We visited the Red Rock Canyon historic area, a beautiful 13 mile scenic drive through beatuiful scenery. The next day we went to Valley of Fire State Park, and found we didn't have enough time to see all of the park. This place was absolutely amazing, being an arm's length away from 4000 year-old indian petroglyphs. I will return to Valley of Fire Park again, it was just stunning. Of course, you can't forget the Fremont Street Experience, a free light show on the canopy that covers six blocks of Fremont Street. I found myself watching my watch and leaving the gaming tables to go see the light shows. I highly recommend the Four Queens. If you go to play, look for Junie ... you'll have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: yagi12
Reviews.Content: Most of the employees were grouchy and looked like they had somewhere better to be than working. I'm sure nobody likes to work but I think that friendliness is part of the job. Security looked like the President of the United States was somewhere near, and most of the employees never looked you in the eye. Maybe I was there during the wrong week, I'm not sure. I stayed at the Wynn Hotel in October of 08 and most of the employees treated me royally. Even the Security guards posted next to the elevator was cordial with me after a few days of seeing me. I will never stay at the Four Queens Hotel again. There are just too many hotels in Vegas to choose from, I guess you get what you paid for. Q

Reviews.Title: “4 queens was a very poor choice”
Reviews.Author: staceyburke
Reviews.Content: We did get a good rate but the room was very small. There was not enough room for a regular chair it only had a writing table and wood chair. The room was in the north tower and the bathroom was so small that you had to sit on the toilet to shut the door. The carpet was worn and it had come unraveled at the bathroom and about 1/2 to 1 inch there was nothing except subfloor. The room was so bad that my wife would not stay in it. I know that none of us go to here for the rooms - we are out playing most of the day but you can't stay in some place this bad.... We asked to upgrade and we could only go to a suite with about 4x as much as we paid of the original room plus we had to pay for parking that was not mentioned when booking. I will never book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “everyone talking about charge for parking”
Reviews.Author: racerboy6996
Reviews.Content: When you check into the 4 Queens, if you tell the front desk you will be using their parking garage, there will be no charge for parking. They give you a "sign" to put on your dash & when you go to leave the garage the parking attendant will see the "sign" and have you fill out a small piece of paper. The use this for records & there is no charge to your room for parking. We stayed for almost 1 week. Without exaggerating we probably left the parking garage 20-30 times over our stay & never had a charge for it. If you are not staying at the hotel or do not tell them when you check in that you will be parking a car, there is a $3 charge for the garage.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: berna339
Reviews.Content: WHEN WE GOT TO THE FOUR QUENNS evry body was nice the romms was nice and cosy and comftoble they had lots of restaurants soy yo u play and star there you do not ned leve the hotel or casino for nothing

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Amtrell
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Queens the last few times we went to Las Vegas and we love it there! The rooms are comfortable and clean and we love the soft pillows, views from the room, and flat screen TV's. The hotel is in the perfect location downtown with convenience to all the other downtown casinos, shopping, and dining. We enjoy that the canopy keeps the heat off of us during the day. I have had good luck at the 4Q every time we go there! I really like trying to win the keepsake coins on the "Silver Strike" slot machines. The Four Queens is perfect for anyone who enjoys the convenience of downtown and is a great value for the money. I recommend the Four Queens to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great time - great value”
Reviews.Author: chroy
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time in vegas; 1st time staying downtown. I regret not staying downtown earlier. The convenience is nice..down the elevator and 10 strides you're outside on freemont street! There are 5 casinos within a few feet. We stayed for $20/ night including taxes - booked at vegas.com. The parking was $3/ day with unlimited vallet. The environment is really relaxed and down to earth. The cleaning lady was wonderful - she took great care of us. All employees helpful/ courteous. You can use the pool at Binions with the Four Queens room key. The elevator is near the Poker room and is on the 25th floor and open til 7:30PM. Great place to relax! Watch out for the scary people wandering around freemont street after 1AM, and the check-in people are a bit cranky. The wait staff are slow to bring drinks - even if tipping well. The wifi is about $10/ 24 hours and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rowebab
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Las Vegas now for a couple times a year since 1997 and have been staying at the Four Queens in old Vegas. The rooms are clean, the casino is clean & fun, the staff are very attentive and remember us from visit to visit. Everyone is helpful if you have questions or need anything. House keeping had our room made up so quickly each day we could hardly get to breakfast and back. That was great. The food in all of the restaurants, was really good & plentiful, reasonably priced and the staff you could just not ask for better service. The whole Freemont Street Experience is something we look forward to each time we go. Nostalgia at it's best. You can just feel the greats from the past, so much history. We have recommended to all our friends and family who have most all either been or are going and will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Front Check-in Service”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_ONJulie
Reviews.Content: Customers first impression is front desk usually, besides valet perhaps. I must say this hotel did a poor job! I was quite surprised since their overall rating was a 4.2! The first thing the elder lady with glasses said was ,'Last Name'? No smile..no welcoming feeling at all. I'm not sure if these people are trained in customer service at all, but front desk should be providing the best possibly at all times since they are the first ones to interact with customers. Secondly, on the website, parking is written everywhere that it is free. Think again, if you are driving/rented a car, parking is $3/night. I wanted a receipt indicating that I paid $3/night for parking, and she could not give me one. She merely told me that you can't get out of the parking lot without this yellow pass permit or I could pay the max rate. Next time, I would advise that this hotel should inform everyone the accuracy of what they should expect before catching customers off-guard in having to pay and not have it written everywhere it's 'complimentary'.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: LV_Traveler_88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price, I stay there for 3 nights, the room on my first night has a bad thermostat (I think), I have a cold night, then I change to a different room, which is a smoking room but did not have any odor. It is very easy to access casino, food, snake, fremont experience, etc. A little far (especially in long weekend the traffic is terrible) from strip. And kind of surprise there is no swimming pool in this hotel, I have to goto Binion top floor to use their small swimming pool, a little disappoint for kids. The wind blowing at the roof make the swimming pool extra cold and walking on the street with swimming gear & trunk make me embarrassing. Food is cheap & good in downtown, and no need to take 10min to find a parking & walk 15min from parking to casino like the big hotel in the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 4 night stay at the Four Queens Hotel And Casino. This was the first time I have stayed downtown in Las Vegas. The hotel is older and it shows in a lot of ways, yet it was clean, housekeeping was very good, I always had hot water for showers, the bed was comfortable, and there was a coffeemaker in the room. My room was on the tenth floor on the Fremont street side of the building so it was very noisy in the evenings until the last Fremont Street Experience show at midnight, but, it still wasn't that bad. The room wasn't huge, but was very adequate for me as a solo traveler. Downtown was a lot different than the strip (for one thing, as others have noted, there are none of the "porn-slappers" downtown). It was very nice to be able to walk short distances between places, instead of girding for the hike to get anywhere downtown. As a person alone, with no set itinerary, I had no problem getting from downtown to the strip using the Sam's Town shuttle. It has two stops downtown, then goes directly to Sam's Town. From Sam's Town it goes to Harrah's and then Riviera so you have the option of mid strip or north strip. The shuttle was never more than half full and it was all just tourists like myself. It is very prompt and the drivers were always friendly. I would recommend downtown Las Vegas and the Four Queens to anyone looking for a less hectic (and less expensive) alternative to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bbarnes450
Reviews.Content: On my trip I traveled alone, and my stay at the Four Queens I felt very safe. The staff was very helpful and friendly. If you are looking for a fun trip to Las Vegas, I would recommend downtown! SO MUCH FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place, Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: canuckie_8
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday through Expedia. As a result, we received a Fun Book (had to ask for it) at the hotel. This book had great 2 for 1 deals in it. We used the deals to eat at Magnolia's and found the portions huge and the food excellent. Everyone we encountered from the front desk to the restaurant to the casino staff were friendly, helpful and always polite. The room we clean and had plenty of room for us and our belongings. Our room was facing Fremont Street and we tend to go to bed early. The only time the noise was loud was Friday night. Even Saturday night wasn't as loud as Friday. We loved being able to go out of the hotel and have free entertainment every night on Fremont Street. We have stayed in downtown Las Vegas before at several different hotels and, for the money, this is the best. For more money, the Golden Nugget is great but we didn't nee the extra luxury of the rooms there since we used the room mostly for sleeping. There is no pool but you can use the one at Binions by just showing your room key. We were told that anyone can use the pool at the Golden Nugget but we did not try it so I don't know if that is accurate. If you don't rent a car and want to go to the Strip the Deuce (bus) is only $5.00 a day, unlimited trips. We rented a car this time and went to Red Rock Canyon, the Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam, Laughlin and Primm. Parking was $3.00 per day at the hotel. Fabulous vacation! Want to go back again and will stay at Four Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you wish to stay away from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: WxProphet
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens is a very nice hotel. I was with a group that wanted to minimize the walking a bit so Freemont St was a great location as many casinos are a short walk from the hotel. The strip is a short drive from Freemont St if you use I15 at the right time of day. We used the bus one day. That was a mistake as it takes a long time to get to where you are going due to the many stops. The room was a decent size and clean. Parking was $3 a night for hotel guests. The staff was very nice and helpful. The only problem I was with the toilet and it was fixed quickly. My only complaint was with the internet. They charge for wireless at $9.95 per day. It should be free. I got it for two nights, the first day it worked perfectly, but the second day it hardly worked. Just long enough to do airline check in. The casino was small compared to the strip, but it was of sufficient size for me. We ate at the Magnolias several times. Got some 2 for 1s for signing up for the Pro Players card. The food was always good and the service was a little off and on. The worst was at 4:30 in the morning when we had to get to the bowling tournament early. Not sure if it is always a problem that early or we just hit it at a bad time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: tuckmics
Reviews.Content: We like to stay downtown. Small hotels/casinos. Less crowds. Better service. Better slots. In any case, typically stay at the Golden Nugget but no rooms available. Decided on the Four Queens based on the reviews here. Happy with our choice. Nice room, nothing fancy, but comfortable. We had a room facing the strip, on the 11th floor. Reasonable view, thought that wasn't particularly important. As others have mentioned, a small bathroom, but not an issue. Just two of us and we could take turns. Service at the front desk and in the restaurant, Magnolias, was very good. We have been big fans of the "loose" slots at the Four Queens for years, and weren't disappointed. Overall, a great stay. Would most likely stay there again. Close to the bus stop (The Deuce) that runs the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gyw820
Reviews.Content: Have not stayed at this property for many many years. Pleasantly surprised with the room condition. Staff was always great and this time was no exception. Front desk checkin was quick and really really helpful as we had somehow double booked. No issues or fuss was made and credit given for second booking. Small property means faster everything, from checkin/out, to dining wait times, valet service and even getting onto gaming tables of your choice. Definitely will be at the top of our list for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms, best seats, best people, wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: madduck
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Vegas since 1990, Or honeymoon. This is our 19th Aniversary and boy was I suprised. With all the changes, the people at 4queens and the fremont st. experience was great just like the good old days. Hotel rooms were very nice and well supplied with large flat screen TV, safe and the best bed.(Slept like a rock).hotel staff were quick to assist all our requests. No disappointments here. Food was very tasty, with large portions at a very low price, (Cheeper than home). The game tables were busy and we found all our favorite slots. We played for hours on very little money. We recomend 4 Queens to all travelers to Las Vegas. We will come back very soon. There was just no down side to this Hotel! Thanks 4 Qeens. Jeff. of Kansas

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: icicle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay at the Four Queens and were very pleased with the experience. Excellant value. We have been to Vegas many times and prefer to stay downtown. Will definately return to the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: guppymanwist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay downtown instead of on the strip, It was our first time to Vegas together and we thought that all we needed was a base for our stay. What a great choice. The staff at the 4-Queens were very friendly and helpful. Our room was not overly large but it was clean and the king bed was very comfy, the flat screen t.v. was a bonus. We are not high maintenance people so this hotel was perfect for us. Make sure you get the coupon book when you check in, as it has many 2 for 1 deals in it. Also sign up for the players club card as it will also give you some deals on your meals at Magnolias . We ate breakfast,dinner and supper at magnolias on more than one occasion and found the food plentiful and very delicious. It is not a fancy place but worthwhile. The Freemont street experience is worth seeing. There were live bands and street vendors and buskers plying their trade on the street, it was a great experience. We would stay there again. This hotel is not for kids or young couples looking to party all night.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise when you opened the door.”
Reviews.Author: sherimx
Reviews.Content: The room looked like it had just been refurbished. Very comfortable and cozy. Pleasant hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended -”
Reviews.Author: Jullian035
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 4 Queen's Casino from April 12th - 17th, and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. It is a smaller hotel/casino compared to those on the Strip, so it has a more personal, friendly feel and is in a prime location on Fremont Street. The first room we had overlooked the Fremont Street Experience, but we had problems getting into our rooms with the key cards, so we were upgraded to a larger room on the opposite side of the hotel. The room was spotlessly clean and extremely quiet - we could not have asked for a better location. We had breakfast in Magnolia's restuarant every morning - very inexpensive and good value, and had some evening meals there as well. We got a very good price through Expedia, and if we go back to Vegas, we will definitely stay there again. Fremont Street has a good feel to it; we felt very safe while we were there, and it's just a short ride on the Duece to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaMary
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Four Queens from April 10th to April 12th, 2009. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, the location & the price through Expedia, we deceided to give the 4 Queens a chance. We were NOT dissappointed. We got a regular room next to the Fremont Street Experience. Since we were out until after midnight every night, having room next to FSE did not bother us at all. Our experience at the Check-in counter was fast & friendly. We did find out that there is a $3.00 per night charge for the parking garage, but that was fine with us. Not having to find a place to park each night was worth the $3.00 charge. We were given a parking pass to show the garage attendant & remember to keep your little white ticket. You need to give it to the attendant each time you leave the parking garage. Our room was cozy, but very clean. Hotels we have stayed at on the strip were not as clean as our room at Four Queens was. We were pleasantly surpirsed by this. Our bed was comfortable but our door always seemed to slam shut, even when were trying to close it quietly. Once we got into our room, we could not hear people through paper thin walls. We just heard the occassional door slam shut. It was no big deal to us. Something people may want to know about is that in the tower we stayed in, there is not an ice machince on each floor. There was one on ours, but we just found that a little unusual. Our room had a coffee maker, hair dryer & a televison with a decent selection of channels. Who spends much time inside a hotel room in Las Vegas anyway! We really enjoyed our stay at the Four Queens & will stay here again. We did not have a good dining expereince at Magnolia's. Our food was bland & the service was "okay" at best. The slots were fun & payed out pretty well. Our favorite part was the Roulette table. We stopped by there 3 times & each time the person running the table was both helpful & knowledgeable. We enjoyed having everything we could want within walking distance. Walgreens is less than a 5 minute walk away. Four Queens does not have a swimming pool, but we were told at check-in that Binion's lets the guests of Four Queens use their swimming pool. I would not bring my children to this hotel, but it was fine for just the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mad-and-Irish
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor's recommendation, I stayed for a week in this hotel, and I wasn't disappointed. If you're doing Las Vegas on a budget, this is a great choice. It's not on the strip, but it's is only an easy bus trip away, and the hotel is right in the middle of the Fremont Street experience. I found that the staff were always helpful, and my room was clean and comfortable and quiet (as it was at the back of the hotel, not facing Fremont Street).

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens Treated Me Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: FemmeNoir
Reviews.Content: My seventh trip to Vegas was complete with a stay at the Four Queens. I've stayed at the Rio, MGM and the like, and knowing that most hotel rooms differ mostly monetarily as opposed to aesthetically, I chose this hotel simply looking for clean accomodations, and a break from the overcrowded strip. And, I found exactly what I was looking for. After a shuttle drop-off, I arrived for a late check-in (9 pm) and the gentleman at the counter couldn't have been more considerate. When I received my room keys for a suite (an upgrade), I found a clean room with a flat screen tv, large bathroom, and despite it's closeness to the Fremont Experience, I experienced a nice, serene quiet in the midst of the show's performances. The housekeeping staff was very attentive and hospitable, leaving plenty of towels, and even a new bath rug in the room each night. Now, smoking might be an issue for some. If so, you might seek other arrangements. I'm a non-smoker, and the smoke was apparent when I approached the elevators, but fortunately, the smells were limited to the casino area. I didn't get a chance to eat at Hugo's or Magnolia's but heard good things about them both. In the end, Downtown Vegas was all that I needed and more than I expected. I cleaned up on the cash there too (Fitzgerald and Fremont slots, no less), so I am certain to return to FQ. It's a certainty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Price”
Reviews.Author: SD701
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights. Knowing the atmosphere on Freemont Street I anticipated the noise at night but it didn’t bother me. The windows are thick enough to drown out most of the noise. If you want real quiet, ask for a room that is not facing Freemont Street. For the most part the staff was great. One exception was the restaurant staff. I believe the name was Mongolias. The wait was not the best but the delay also had to do with an irate guest who complained about his discount. I offered to pay the difference of his bill just to get him out of line. The manager and staff handled it well. At times going beyond what is expected when dealing with someone like him. Others in line also offered to “pitch in” just to get him moving. The only criticism I have is there wasn’t enough staff on hand for seating people. But once seated, order and delivery was fast. The hotel is located in the middle of everything if you are like me and don’t like the hassle of the main strip. The staff was great all around. Very friendly from check in to check out. The room was nice. Water pressure in the shower was not up to par but other than that no major issues. The hotel does not have a swimming pool so don’t pack your trunks. Parking is the easiest around town. I’ve stayed at TI, MB, MGM and NY before where parking was/is such a headache. 4Q’s has a great valet system and not much waiting if none at all. The best of all is you can walk to everything on Freemont Street and get a better bang for your buck than on the strip or the other BIG hotels.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens the complete affordable package”
Reviews.Author: Texankaty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and nights at the Queens. It is so centrally located to everything. If you have handicapped parking it is really great. Don' t make the mistake like we did and try to drag your bags to like a main marked elevator. There are elevators into the casino on both sides in the parking garage, one is just not marked well. Staff was great, if you eat in their restaurant (make sure you have your players card), it will save you $2.00 off the prime rib. They offer it at a certain price but fail to tell you this is with the discount you will get with your players club card, plus you will receive a coupon for a buy 1 get 1. Little sneaky on the food to get the price, but do it, it is worth it. Great hotel, we will stay there again and again. Book your rooms through cheaphotels.com. Our rate was only $29.00 a night (overall) and more than worth that, clean rooms, cleaned every day, and nice attractive rooms. After all who needs to spend all their money on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in Las Vegas awesome place”
Reviews.Author: ferretladyupstateNY
Reviews.Content: Just got back after our annual trip to Vegas, the 4 Queens has the best staff in Vegas, helpful, courteous, pleasant. Do have to say our two favorite people at the 4 Queens are Mike Cook and Dante, bartenders, these two are great and a very valuable asset to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dollars & Sense Great Location Seen often on CSI”
Reviews.Author: elliott78212
Reviews.Content: Well have to tell you I have stayed at the Four Queens Since 1998 my first Vegas trip the staff is among the best in any hotel I have ever stayed in, the rooms were remodeled little over a year ago and have flat screen tv's, comfy beds and if you want more pillows they will send the up. The rooms are not huge but not small and very well decorated not garish or cheap. I love the coffemakers, irons & blowdryers in the rooms not many Downtown Las Vegas hotels have them. The Location is right there on Fremont street if your a fan of the show CSI you have seen the Four Queens and Golden Nugget many times at the end of the Strip is the Plaza hotel which was featured in Back to the Future II. The Fremont experience is fun and a nice evening distraction from Gambling and free. The Casino Floor is smaller than most and some areas feel cramped with machines to close together it can get smokey but they do have great ventilation. The Magnolia Restraunt has good food and great specials its all kept very clean and you never feel unsafe, if you get bored there are lots of Casinos in walking distance as in across the street literally if staying Downtown I reccomend the Four Queens for friends and family as well as the Golden Nugget next door if your not bringing kids you can get a better deal but not as nice a location at the El Cortez its about two three blocks away away from the Fremont Experience these are also my three faves to gamble in one other fave is the Golden Gate a few blocks down from the Four Queens if you go on a holiday weekend be ready it gets crowded and the crowd gets younger the average age for this area is 30-senior and that keeps the rowdy level down but it does get rockin on holidays and there are often free concerts.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: rablab
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at Four Queens in March. Booked primarily for price. Average stay, sort of a Best Western with a casino. Plain room, clean. Noisy on Fremont Street side but they shut down the Fremont Street experience fairly early. Like the convenience of being able to walk easily to adjacent casinos. Did not play in casino but rather at Golden Nugget across street. Only ate at subway downstairs in casino. Tried to get a beer at the brew pub in mezzanine above casino, not at all crowded, but walked out after the bartender walked by several times without acknowledging me while she acknowledged the locals at the bar, and then got on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: jules714
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! The rooms were clean and the hotel is in a prime location. We casino-hopped up and down Fremont Street during March Madness and we had such a great time. I don't think we will ever stay on the strip again. Everything is cheaper and less crowded in this area. The 4 Queens has a somewhat small casino compared to some of the others in the area but they still have the basics. We had a room in the North Tower facing Fremont Street and we were under the canopy so we could see the light show at night from our room (if we were ever in our room). I thought this was pretty cool but the noise would definitely keep you up if you were trying to sleep. Luckily we stayed out most of the night - otherwise you might want to request a room facing the other side. Drink service was ok if you were at the tables or playing Keno - I don't know about the slots. Magnolias Restaurant inside the 4 Queens had decent sandwiches at ok prices for lunch. The pizza place had so-so pizza and so-so beers. I liked the Amber best. I think they had 9 of their own local drafts that they served - you could get a 5 flavor sampler for $6 or a 9 flavor sampler for $8 or $9 if you want to try them all. The hotel doesn't have a pool but you can show your room key at Binion's right across the street and use theirs. Overall, I think we received great value for what we paid - we got a deal on Hotels.com that came out to about $30/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at bargain rates!”
Reviews.Author: graham072442
Reviews.Content: The 4 Queens Hotel and Casino is located on Fremont Street, next to the Golden Nugget. It's midway along the Freemont Street Experience area. I stayed there March 8 - 13, 2009. The hotel was recently renovated, so that now there are icemakers and vending machines on almost every floor. The rooms are moderately sized but not cramped, with adequate counter space in the bathrooms - which have 4' bathtubs with shower over; and there is plenty of closet space. They are clean and tastefully decorated. I had a plumbing problem in that the shower/tub faucet leaked loudly and with arthritic hands it was impossible to open the faucet valve when it had been forced closed to stop the leak. Hotel maintenance removed the hardware and replaced it within 24 hours of my report. Excellent housekeeping services as well. Where other hotels I've stayed at in Vegas have a card you're requested to leave on the bed if you want the linens changed before you leave (otherwise they are not changed), there were no such cards here and my beds were changed after 3 nights - even though I was only staying 5 nights. Lower floors will include rooms that look out onto the "hardware" of the Fremont Experience jumbotron, but the upper floors offer unobstructed views. If you get a room on the Fremont Street side of the hotel, expect to hear the sound and light show until sometime after midnight nightly. The rooms come with a flat-screen TV, coffeemaker, iron and ironing board. The in-room safe is larger than most; it comprises the area that would otherwise be the bottom drawer of the bedside table - which is bolted to the floor - and allows the room occupant to set his/her own combination. There are several restaurants located on the casino level, including Hugo's Cellar and Magnolia Cafe. Players club members are offered daily menu specials at Magnolia's. The slot machines include some of the latest released games and are placed such that the casino does not have a "cramped" atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cobyslady
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a trip to Las Vegas at the last minute and found a great deal through Expedia which included a standard room at the Four Queens. We arrived at the hotel at around 10 am, and were able to check in right then. The standard room we were given was on the 7th floor, facing Fremont street, but unfortunately our view was right into the light grid. The room itself was somewhat small, and older looking, and we decided to see if we could upgrade. The lady at the front desk informed us that upgrading would be an additional $40/ day, but we got such a good deal to begin with that we took it. They had it ready for us right then, and it was very nice. Not brand new, and not a room on the strip, but good for us. There was a sitting area with a pair of chairs, and coffee table in front of the flat screen tv, as well as a leather couch, and a table and two chairs in front of the windows. The bed was a very comfortable king. There was also a bar area which had a small sink, small fridge, and a coffee maker. The bathroom was clean enough, but the black tile in the tub/shower, made it seem a little dark. We met the maid, Sharon, on our way out the second day, and she was very nice. Our room was made up wonderfully every day, and she was always greeted us with a friendly "Good Morning", when she saw us on our way out for the day. I was happy with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “great stay,great time”
Reviews.Author: eliza111
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for our 3 nights in Las Vegas. The rooms were clean and comfortable and even had a great view. We got to town way before check-in and the front desk let us into our room right away. Any staff member we had contact with during the whole stay was so helpful and friendly. I would come back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Terrio61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Queens 02/23-02/27 and only paid 32.00 per night. We are not high maintenance people and therfore did not expect a lot for the price. We arrived right at checkin time and therefore expected a long line. That was not the case, we were through check in with no problems in minutes. Our room was on the second floor and although the first night it seemed very noisy, the remainder of the week was fine. The room itself needed some maintenance. One of the closet doors did not open. The heater made a constant noise. Also, the water in the tub did not drain. And the lights next to the bed were very hard to turn on. (the switch stuck) We should have asked for another room, however, we are not complainers and did not spend much time in the room. The cleaning staff was very friendly and when we asked for extra coffee there was no problem. We did not eat in the hotel as the line at Magnolias was extremely long during normal dinner hours. Overall we had a good trip. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. My three previous trips to Vegas I stayed on the strip, but I think in the future, I will always be downtown. It is much more reasonable and very easy and cheap to take the Deuce up to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the frugal gambler!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslander007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 02/16-02/19. We booked through Expedia and got the third night free. Check in was fast. We were suprised how nice the hotel looked. We asked for the coupon book and got it. First thing we did was check into the Player's club and received free gifts. Our room was neat and clean - think Comfort inn or Best Western. We ate at Magnolias with the 2 for 1 coupon and it was okay. Our last night we ate at Hugo's which was very expensive and fancy but worth every penny. Fremont street was great. This is a great place to go if you want to make your money last. We had a blast and would definately stay again! I played mostly penny slots and was able to parlay $20 into $380 dollars (even though I poured it all back into the machines - it was fun). Came real close to winning the Foose Mustang! Saw Gordie Brown at the Golden Nugget - he was great. Ate at the Mainstreet buffet - best in town. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens......far from royalty!! Checked out as soon as we arrived”
Reviews.Author: catsled
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back from Vegas and we originally were supposed to stay at the 4 Queens, but as soon as we opened the door to our rooom...we checked out!! We ended up booking a hotel on the strip (much wiser choice)! The casino is very old and all you smell is smoke when you walk in the entrance. The rooms are very small and not clean. Our view from the room was horrible, all you could see was the framework for the lighting show beneath. The set up of the Freemont Experience might have been a cool concept many years ago, but they need to clean up and modernize things. Overall, we had an amazing trip but it was because we made a quick decision to get out of the 4 Queens!! Believe it or not...you can stay at a nice place on the strip for $60 during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Alberta travel view
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas a couple of times a year and always stay on the strip. We wanted to experience Fremont Street so booked at the Four Queens. Our check in around 2 P.M. was quick. No coupon books were offered to us. We had a room on the fourth floor and could sit in our room have a cocktail and watch the light show. It was really quite enjoyable. We had no problem with Fremont street keeping us awake. We turned on the TV and fell asleep to it. The room itself was small but clean. As stated in other reviews the towels were big and fluffy. The bed was very comfortable. There is a coffee pot in the room. This doesn't take away from the fact the hotel is old. The rooms have been remodeled and are comfortable but you can hear every sound in the hall. The hallways are very narrow and the ceilings low as well. All that being said the room cost us $25.00 for the night. How can you beat that for comfy clean place to stay. The cocktail waitresses were great and seemed to always have a smile on their faces. The machines were dead cold though. Oh well, you can't have it all. We ate a Magnolia's. We have always enjoyed eating there when we left the strip for a day on Fremont. This time however. The meal wasn't as good as it usually is. We will however try it again the next time we are in Vegas. If we stay downtown again we most likely will try The Golden Nugget. The four Queens was OK but would like to try another hotel on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Friendly at the 4 Queens”
Reviews.Author: katt332
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the 4 Queens Feb 17-20. I have always stayed on the strip, but last year we took a cab to the Downtown area and we had a blast. So this year we wanted to stay Downtown. We picked the 4 Queens because it is right in the middle of everything on Fremont St, it has great reviews, and the price was right. We took the shuttle from the airport to the 4 Queens. The 4 Queens has a small area for cars to drop people off or drop off for the valet, but it seemed to work. Check in was fast and easy. I requested a room in the south tower on an upper floor. Our room was not cleaned yet (it was only 2pm), but they let us store our luggage in the room. The room was perfect the lady at check in put us in a corner room. I dont think that it was any bigger than other rooms, but we had a view in two directions and only people on one side of us. We dropped our luggage off and went downstairs. The first place we went to was the players club to sign up for our cards. We were given a deck of cards in a metal case and a voucher each for Magnolia's Cafe for two for one entres. I was given an extra voucher as it was my birthday. We went over to Magnolia'a Cafe, but got sidetracked at the Craps table. There was a crowd so I watched for a minute. The table was hopping so I tried my luck. 10 minutes later and $40.00 up we went to the Cafe. There was a small line but we did not have to wait long. The hostess was nice and friendly. Our waitress was really nice and very fast. The food was hot and tasted great. We had no problem using the vouchers and off we went. Fremont st is a great place to watch people. We went down to Mermaids and recieved our beads, played some slots and actually won! I came in here last year and played. We had a great waitress last year. She was still there this year. Later we went back to the 4 Queens. My friend played some roulette while I played a little more craps. We both won a little. The dealers at the 4 Queens are great. They are very helpful. We went back up to our room. It was cleaned, everything looked great. When you walk into the room on the right side is a large closet. On the left side is the bathroom. In the bathroom there is a tub/shower combo. There is a single sink with a large amount of counter space. They had an ice bucket, plastic cups, shampoo, lotion, and a small bar of soap on the counter. There was also a hair dryer unit mounted on the wall. The bathroom itself was very clean. Many of the floor tiles were cracked, but that really did not matter. The towels were fine, not big and fluffy, but you have to remember where you are staying. This is not the Ritz, but it is very nice. In the room there is a place to put your suitcase. There is also a stand for the flat screen TV that has 4 drawers under the TV. Next to the stand is the desk and chair. We had two queen beds in the room and between them was a small nightstand with a safe. The bedding was not old or new and looked nice. The blankets are thinner than mine at home, but that was easy to remedy, I called and asked for another and it was brought to me within 10 minutes. Overall the room was very comfortable, the views were great and where we were in the South Tower it was quiet. There was no noise from the Fremont St Experience at all. The next day we spent on the strip. It was busy, but not as busy as when I was in Las Vegas last year. There were specials everywhere on food, drink, shows, nightclubs, rooms, etc. Happy hours specials being run all day. We walked from Mandalay Bay all the way to the Sahara. Took all day as we stopped everywhere. That evening we had dinner at Magnolia's Cafe. We had a different waitress, but she was just as great as our first waitress. My friend had the prime rib special, $7.95 with the players card, and I had the lasagna. We both had the salad, when my friend asked for extra croutons they were brought right away. Both dishes were perfect. My friend loved the prime rib, it came with veggies and a potato. Check out was very easy, we had no problems. I would definatly stay at the 4 Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the”
Reviews.Author: jazzieNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Las Vegas and 99.9% of the time stay at the Freemont area. This was the first time I stayed at the Four Queens. There were six of us staying at the hotel. The hotel is clean, however, the smoke penetrates every pore of your body and clothes. The main issue I had with the hotel/management was their confusing manner of keeps tabs on comps. Not a friendly system to access your comps...Usually I am able to access info from pit boss, resturant, etc but here you can only get from "host" at players office. Even upon check out the staff could not tell me what my comps were and said they would relay info to the "host" and let me know what I qualified for>>>(yeah right!!!)

Reviews.Title: “best hotel rate for a good room”
Reviews.Author: richardSlc_ut
Reviews.Content: Hotels.com messed up our reservation,but the staff did everything possible to make our stay pleasant By far the best customer service from the front desk and managers Alba and Rod that I have ever received from any hotel. We will definitely stay at the 4queens again. A little word of advice....If you book through Hotels.com be sure to call the hotel and confirm your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasyJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Downtown Vegas before in 2002 and found that it represented better value than The Strip...and after all a casino, is a casino, is a casino. Being thus thrifty I caught the bus to the hotel from the airport, the journey took about 45 minutes. The check in at The Four Queens was quick and I found the room spotless with a very comfortable bed. The dealers were very helpful when I was playing BlackJack as I am a novice and there a variety of betting limits on the table games. I didn't eat at the casino as I like buffets and there isn't one there. Fremont Street has plenty of action going on and can be a little noisy if you wanted to get an early night but one doesn't go to Vegas for a early night surely??!! I look forward to staying at The Four Queens again

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: canadaharley
Reviews.Content: The rates are inexpensive but there is nothing cheap about this hotel. Very clean rooms, friendly staff where everyone said good morning to us. We stayed in the South Tower which was quiet. You can walk out the front door right into the pedestrian mall which is very fun to watch every night under the canopy. Everything is very convenient and parking is free if you are staying there. We grabbed The Deuce 1 block down and went down the Strip. I highly recommend this hotel in Vegas. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rmyaeger
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Four Queens (10 people). I love the downtown area and the Four Queens is the perfect place to stay. Vegas downtown is more relaxed, casinos are closer and the deals are better. I have stayed at other hotels downtown and by far for the price the Four Queens is tops. The only problem we had was slow service at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, Not bad”
Reviews.Author: scotcol
Reviews.Content: This is a OK hotel, as far as the rooms go. If you aren't high maintainence, you will be fine. My wife and I are very easy going so we had no problem, but I would understand if someone did. They say that there is a coffee maker in every room. Ours did, but no coffee provided. We asked housekeeping to give us some and were told to call housekeeping to get some. That so confused us we just gave up. The bathtub faucet had a steady drip...drip...drip. I don't hold that against them though, they would have probably moved us if I had complained, but I didn't since we were settled in before we noticed and we couldn't hear it while sleeping. The staff is another issue. For the most part they are excellent. I wish I could remember all of their names. (Damn that free alcohol) I do remember Winston in The Magnolia Cafe. Actually , all the wait staff there was great, the hostess staff and cashiers could be a little nicer though. Plus the head guy at The Chicago Brew Company was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Old style charm”
Reviews.Author: TANYA66
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a good size and we managed to get adjoining rooms which was nice. Our room hadn't been cleaned when we checked in but a maid was sent really quickly and she was really pleasant and did a great job so it didn't cause us any problems. We often choose to stay Downtown when visiting Vegas because everything is on your doorstep. My Dad uses a wheelchair and so everything being close together in a pedestrian area is really useful. The rents are generally lower and the tables have lower limits for those of us who just want to play and not do too much serious gambling. The buses take you down the strip if you want to see the sights and to the shopping outlets for $5 for a 24 hour pass. You can use the rooftop pool at Binions (which is owned by the same people) across Fremont Street which is lovely. We were told they are soon to renovate it although I think it's ok as it is - with being on the rooftop even though we vacationed in november you don't get overshadowed so you have the best sun available with great views.

Reviews.Title: “4Q Great Hotel but small”
Reviews.Author: orangectyny
Reviews.Content: i was in Vegas for 5 nights 12/12-12/17)and once again decided to stay DT. Many of my friends were also staying at 4Q, so that made my decision of where to stay easier. Check in at 11 pm on a Friday night was a breeze and I was able to obtain a room direclty across the hall from my friends who had checked in a few days earlier. They also gave me a parking pass that enabled me to use the valet for free for the entire stay. (You must get this pass or you will be charged for parking) I was in room 1929 in the South Tower. My room faced the Golden Nugget and to the side could see past the GN and all the way down Fremont to Plaza. The room had two queen size beds, a desk with 2 straight back desk chairs, a dresser and a flat screen TV. The safe was located in the night table. The coffee pot was on the desk. Coffee left in the room was regualr, and I had to request decaf but received it the next morning. The room was clean and fresh. Housekeeping did a very good job everyday and were very friendly. The room itself was ok in size. However, the bathroom was tiny, and I mean tiny. The hallway was quiet, I very seldom heard doors closing or people in the hallway. The 4 elevators to the tower were quick and I never had a long wait for one. Soda machines are on the odd numbered floors and the ice machines are on the even numbered floors. Needless to say I did not venture to the other floor for ice. I would have liked to have an easy chair in the room as I do like to relax and sit and read . I also had some friends in and out of my room several times and easy chairs would have been better to sit and catch up. Instead we sat on the beds. I ate at Magnolia's my last morning and with the player's card it, received a discount on breadfast. I also had luck in the casino. I was able to print out my boarding pass. on a computer right opposite the check in desk. Valet was prompt in retriving my car and is located near the Canyon Club. One upset ing fact. On Sunday afternoon, as I was getting out of the shower, I heard some knocking on the door, then the door opened and in walked a male housekeeping manager and secuirty. I was standing there in a towel!!! They quickly apologized and left. There was a mixup and they thought I had checked out. This was confirmed with a call to the front desk with the manager's name. The front desk could not apologize enough. Be sure to put the chain and or top lock on the door!!!! If I make another solo trip I will stay once again at 4Q.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: CuteNsingle
Reviews.Content: Upon check in - the lady who assisted me was on a personal call the entire time. I asked for a room with a view - " all our rooms have the same view ". She was not polite and like I said - was on a personal call the entire time. The room was okay - nothing fabulous. Didnt do well on the slots - the subway / pizza place was way overpriced. The great thing about the hotel - you are on Fremont street so many choices are right out the door.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Ready.Teddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the last few days of my trip. It was nice to have a clean comfortable room to relax in. The TV and cable package were great. Best part was looking out the window to see the Freemont street experience every hour. Costs a little more than other downtown locations but I felt it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Shawn R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 08. We read lots on this site before deciding that for our first trip to Vegas, we had to do the downtown experience for at least part of our stay. That was the best decision ever. We spent our first 3 nights of a 7-night stay at this Hotel. When we first arrived, we were already more than tipsy as we had met some people who were Vegas vets at the airport before we even headed out of Cedar Rapids, IA (they kept buying drink after drink and giving us all kinds of tips for places to check out and what to do), so I really cannot comment on the check-in service as it was a little fuzzy. :) However, the staff was great - very friendly - throughout the hotel for everything else we needed during our stay, although I have to say that the wait at Magnolias was quite long the time we went. The food there, however, was excellent and their was way more than we could eat. there for a very good price, especially when you add in the buy-one-get-one-free coupon that you can pick up. We did not really eat much else here as we were too busy exploring downtown. The room itself was a clean. The bed was comfy. It was a very basic room with a decent view at an affordable price in a fun area. That is everything I was looking for. I forgot to take pics of the room until we were getting ready to leave and it was messed up, but I included the shots just to give an idea of what the basic rooms look like. The view was pretty good from our room too. Again, I took a shot of the view night but it was not that good of a shot. There are also some excellent bargins at the gift shop at the hotel and the staff here were super friendly. You can use the pool at the top of Binions as long as you are staying here too, so although this hotel does not have a pool, you always have this option. We never had time to check it out, but I would definitely think that it would be worth a peek as it is on the 28th floor so it would probably be a nice relaxing time with a great view of downtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. Shawn BTW: The downtown area itself is a blast and you should really experience it at least once. I will write a separate review of the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: teachrsue
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal through expedia for 5 nights and the average was 26.00 a night. Arrived at Valet which is off 3rd street DT at noon. Valet handed me receipt and told me to tell the desk clerk I was using valet and I would receive a VIP parking pass so parking was free. I was able to check in at noon, room not ready, I could store luggage at bell desk or in closet in room as room was vacant. I chose to go on up to the room and check it out even though it had not been cleaned. Not too bad, stowed luggage in closet and off I went. Upon returning to room around 4 I found it was clean. King size bed, safe beside bed by nightstand, flat screen, plenty of towels. Ice and soft drink machine were at the end of the hall. I was on the 10th floor. Cons-room would never get cool enough, it was facing west and the afternoon sun even with the curtains pulled seem to heat the room. Water took a long time to get hot in shower. Bed even though it was a pillow top,was very soft. Housekeeping missed room on 2nd day even though I had left a tip on the first day. I called down for some towels only and both the housekeeping person and the person that brought the towels up offered no apology, they both stated I must have had my Do not distrub sign up and I did not, I was gone all day. Pros, North tower is closest to Fremont. Magnolias and the Chicago Brewery have good food and reasonable. Hallways are short. Quiet room facing away from Fremont. Not bad for a solo traveler, room would have been very small for two people especially if staying longer than a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens...a few very minor glitches but okay”
Reviews.Author: chachachio
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect in a downtown Vegas hotel since my husband and I always stayed on the strip. This time, I agreed to go along with most others in our Old School Vegas group and book downtown. I found this deal in a travelocity flight + hotel package. The price was right when I booked in October. When I checked in I was given a room at the end of the hall on the 19th floor. I should have called the hotel right after making the reservations and requested my room preference. This room was very quiet and clean although the TV was not connected properly to the wall. A technician came quickly to fix the problem. A light bulb was burned out and the phone jack was partially pulled out which I was able to fix easily. A customer should not have to bother with any mechanical glitches. Other than those minor issues, the hotel was nice. Do not expect a five star establishment by any means but the decor was pretty basic and pleasing at the same time. Eventhough the elevator was at the other end of the hall, it was quick and not crowded. All hotel staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana-al
Reviews.Content: we are here now during probably the worse weather vegas has ever had-it snowed twice so far this week-even with that we are having a great time at this very nice hotel-workers are very friendly-prices super reasonable-our room in the north tower has a safe, coffee pot, iron, large flat screen tv, internet access for $9 a day-the north tower is wonderful right off the fremont experience so you don't have to walk too far-ask for a room not facing fremont so you don't get all the noise-parking is free for 3 hours with validation-$3 for a 24 hour stay-this hotel is not as large & plush as the nugget, but there is not as much walking- the rooms are about the same size as the nugget-you can get a great $8 prime rib dinner at magnolia's & they have nightly food specials-we have enjoyed all of the meals here-we love the downtown area to stay-we always rent a car to enjoy all of vegas- this trip we got a pt cruiser for 4 nights for only $48 total with fox- we will try & stay at this hotel for our next visit here-can't be beat for the price-

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Ydnar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love downtown Vegas and usually book the majority of our nights there, not on the Strip. When we decided on a weekend trip and couldn't convince the relatives to look after the kids, the Four Queens looked like it would probably suit our needs, especially given the favourable reviews I'd seen. Though not necessarily 'kid friendly', the price is right and the location is perfect. We arrived around 2 on a Friday afternoon, and though the room had not yet been cleaned we were able to get keys and store our luggage there. Check-in was very quick and staff were friendly. We booked a package and chose the 'low end' price, so the room we ended up with was not newly renovated. Though it did have the flat screen TV, the rest was pretty old and we actually had a handicapped bathroom. No big deal but it did make for an awfully high toilet for the kids. Nice to have a coffee maker, ironing board and a large safe, otherwise pretty standard. The room was clean, just tired looking. The big draw here is the location. Really, virtually all the downtown properties are central, but this one is dead center on Fremont Street. Not only that, the access is a breeze since you can go through the doors near the valet and bypass the entire casino. With no waits for the elevator we were able to leave our room and be on Fremont street in about 3 minutes! We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel/casino, but there is a decent selection. Of course, staying downtown means a quick walk is all it takes to get pretty much any food you want. I have to admit, we love the Gold Spike, and now it is being renovated into a 'boutique' property so we'll see how that pans out. Our philosophy is to sleep cheap and spend the savings on food or entertainment. So...I'd have to say that The Four Queens fit the bill very nicely for us on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “great price and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel via hrs.com for a realy great price. the room was excelent and was better then expected. Any time again

Reviews.Title: “First Time Staying Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: Had been to Vegas many times before and had visited downtown just never stayed there. The 4 Queens was the cheapest option for the days in December I was going, so away I went. I don't spend too much time in my room in Vegas but was impressed with the 4 Queens room. I had a room in the south tower on the 15th floor. Very quiet, very clean, comfy bed (spent about 9hrs total sleeping in 2 nites) , excellent Flat Screen (watched about 10 minutes of the news in 2 nites there) had a safe, only drawback was the size of bathroom but remember this was the cheapest place I could find to stay. A tip is if you are really picky and like to complain stay at really expensive places on the strip. The casino was small but had lots of low limit table games with good pay tables (common downtown I played roulette at Binions and they have $2 min). I signed up for the players card at the 4Q and got a free deck of cards in a collectable tin then had a $8 Prime Rib dinner at Magnolias that was excellent. If you take off the value of the free gift I got, you could say dinner cost me $5! The parking garage costs guest $3 day but remember it's also $15-$20 a nite cheaper here. The garage and hotel are small which I like, makes things less confusing. Clientele was definetly older but I mainly hung out at the Poker rooms in Binions (excellent) and the Golden Nugget. Downtown has lots of cheap food options, beers are $2 all over and t-shirts and such are far cheaper downtown. I still enjoy the strip better but for a couple of nites and if you rent a car downtown can really save you some money.

Reviews.Title: “Classy downtown property”
Reviews.Author: popularmecha
Reviews.Content: Four Queens staff treat you with class all the time. From front desk, restaurant, BJ dealers, craps, security, all a class act. Great for weekend w/ the guys or for married couples. Not exactly the fancy hotel to sweep a new girl off her feet, though I'd recommend The Venetian for that. Rates are cheap and excellent value. Like all downtown casinos, lower bet minimums on craps/roulette until it gets busy. Go to their website, print out a pre-register sheet for their players club and get a free gift...... Mine was a 4Queens set of pajamas, another user on this site got a tote bag. Ask the pit boss for "comps for two" and he'll give you at least a "2 for 1" comp. Highly recommend. Been to Las Vegas 6 time and last two times I stayed at 4Queens and probably will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation, poor room service”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: This place is ok at a price. It is not ok for a romantic getaway or nice resort type vacation. The location on Freemont street is fun for a few days. There is no pool, minimal restaurants and no buffet. The room was adequate but not very clean. It needed a thorough detailing. It had been upgraded slightly. New bathroom tiles that they also used to tile the counter. A tiled counter cannot be properly cleaned because of the grout lines. The tub took 30 minutes to drain. The bath tap drizzled hot water constantly. It must cost them a lot of money to not fix these. The drain was heavily corroded and rusted so it had been leaking for a long time. I guess the room attendant just never bothered to report it. We did when we left. It had a newer flat screen tv and a room safe. The bedding was ultra cheap. The beds were barely comfortable. Our room attendant never restocked our supplies which were about the cheapest crap you can get so we didn't complain. We just got our own. The coffee maker was never cleaned, emptied or restocked. Again no loss. I won some money at the tables but the pit boss made you feel like you were stealing so I gambled next door at the Golden Nugget which was much better. I would recommend it if you can get a room for about $20 a night and aren't too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown rules”
Reviews.Author: canadapilot
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Great room , Great service. Even managed to win some good money in the casino. Say hi to the dealer Joe from the "canadian pilot"

Reviews.Title: “A Downtown experience”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights will attending CES. Cannot really complain to much, as the rate we paid was very cheap. Booked a twin room, but was given a king bed only. A little dissapointed with the ability of the staff to resolve this issue. We were given another room facing Freemont Street. Now be warned that the noise level is quite high. Stay on a higher floor! Overall we did enjoy our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overall good service”
Reviews.Author: klathlean
Reviews.Content: this is a nice old vegas style hotel that for the price is perfect for anyone who just wants a place to hang your hat at night.check in was easy and helpful.room was clean with coffee machine,iron and board,king size bed,plenty of towels,flat screen tv.stayed on the 16th floor, north tower, but if you go to bed early,you may be bothered by the noise for the fremont experence till almost 1 or 2 am.housekeeping staff was excellent.i saw my housekeeper on the first day and tipped her at once.needless to say, my room was vacumed,clean sheet everyday,and plenty of the extras...soap,shampoo,towels,extra coffee,ashtrays,{yes this is a smoking room},etc.we had a small party on our second night in the room before hitting the strip...about 10 people and the room was a mess.got up next mourning and went to binons across the street at about 7:30 am.great breakfast there in the coffee shop...only $1.99. when i came back to the room about 9:30 am. the room was spotless....excellent job!!! i would book this hotel again..ken,melbourne,fl

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: dampa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful experience we could have had. This was our 1st time visiting this town. the hotel employee's were wonderful, food was great and would recomend this hotel. When I booked this vacation I based it on reviews by other people, they were right, couldn't have picked a better place. I would recommend that since you are in the downtown area, to visit the strip, take the bus $5.00 for 24hrs well worth it, even though it took us 20 minutes we got to see alot. I hope anyone who does book here has the same experience as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: carneasadaburrito
Reviews.Content: Once again the Four Queens exceeded my expectations. Having stayed here 4 times in the last year and a half I can not say enough good things. If you are looking for a fancy lobby and fast elevators this is not the hotel for you. However, if you are on a budget and looking for a great deal this is the place for you. I payed $59 for a Saturday night and $29 for Sun/Mon. Try finding that on the strip. Hotel is clean, safe, and staff is excellent. Was able to get checked in at 9:00 AM on Saturday moning. The hotel is located in the heart of the Fremont Street Experience (can be noisy) so if you value some peace and quiet make sure you request a room facing AWAY from the Fremont Street experience. Also for those of you wanting to go to the strip the bus stop is a stone's throw away. The bus is called the deuce and you get get a 24 hour unlimited ride pass for $5. The Fremont Street Experience really takes off aat night so I usually hit the strip in the day and head back to the Four Queens at night. Chicago Brewing Company (one of their restaurants) has great pizza and beer. Their other restaurant (magnolias) leaves a little bit to be desired. For those of you who insist on staying on the strip you may want to try staying downtown sometime. I think you will be surprised at how affordable and fun it could be. Where on the strip can you walk into a casino bar and buy an ice cold Corona or Heineken for $2.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: TexasG1RL
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Four Queens and had a great time. We were allowed to check in early, even though check in was not until 4:00. The room was comfortable and the bathroom sufficient. Don't expect a 4 star hotel, but it was nice. There was some construction around or in the hotel some mornings that tended to be loud, but overall it was bearable. We ate at Magnolia's and it was okay. Be sure to get the coupon sheet from the Freemont office for a 2-for-1. The casino is nice but took all of our money. We really enjoyed being downtown and everything being so close. I don't think we will ever stay on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “super stay!”
Reviews.Author: marvandchar
Reviews.Content: What a great and pleasant surprise with our stay at 4 Queens! While the room wasn't super huge, it was adequate for what we wanted. I do have to say the bathroom was small but for the money -also served our needs! We did have a plugged sink, but I called the front desk and within 15 minutes we have a maintenance fellow up to check out the problem, and within an hour he had us up an running! and all with a great attitude!! ! It was quiet, we overlooked Golden Nugget. Be sure to join the players club to use your card for great food at Magnolia's Generous portions and food was delicious! Gambling was great=had new machines and some old favorites. Staying downtown was definitely a winning idea! also easy to use the bus system. thanks for reading my review-and I hope you enjoy your stay at Four Queens

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: chiefan1
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Four Queens about 4:00 pm on 11/3/08, told the desk clerk that we were there for our 15th anniversary and asked if there were any upgrades available not really expecting much. I was pleasently surprised when she told us that she had moved us up to a suite at no charge. Room was in the south tower away from Fremont Street on the 3rd floor, very clean and spacious and at the end of the hall so we didn't have drunks walking past the room making noise all night. Bathroom large and clean with double vanity, plenty of room for wife's and my stuff both. Large flat screen TV with two chairs and comfortable leather couch. No complaints at all. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, maids always asked if we were ready for the room to be cleaned and never had any complaints if we weren't. On scale with the suite we had at the old Stardust Casino. Parking was easy to reach from the elevators and the attendant at the ticket booth even told us about the VIP parking vouchers available at the front desk for guests instead of just charging us for parking. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Only complaint, and this has nothing to do with the hotel, the streets in the vicinity of the hotel were torn up and only one way in some areas due to construction. Very confusing and difficult to get to the parking garage at night or if you didn't know the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: nurseteresa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Four Queens in October for the third time for three nights. Really enjoy the location, casino, and Magnolias. Very glad to now have a safe in the room. We arrived at 8:30am and room was ready. Just what we asked for. Nice to have a coffee pot in the room. Stayed next 2 nights at Harrahs and no coffeepot. Room was cleaned, no plumbing issues. Casino is fun, drink service some of the best we had all trip. Magnolias is a little slow but no big deal. Looking forward to going back again

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: nc-1traveler
Reviews.Content: i got a great deal on this place. can not beat location and the area has so much to offer. can find some great deals on food. this is the second time i stayed at freemont and we took another couple for they first time and we all loved it. we went to the strip and walked ourself to death. i have stayed on the strip 4 times and i dont think i will ever stay on the strip again. we did use the bus ( the duce) to travel to the strip. the only good thing about it is the price $5. bus makes many stops and very crowed. dont get me wrong it works but a slow ride. we booked a limo for airport transfer . nice . we used bell limos. only $56. used a taxi/van ride back to airport and cost was $40 + tip. kinda of spendy i think.but all in all the four queens was a great hotel. stayed in room 1427 it was nice but our friends had room 1444 and it had a great view. food at the resturants at 4 queens was great and the price was right . i would stay at 4 queens again with out question.

Reviews.Title: “You can do Better”
Reviews.Author: wermi
Reviews.Content: Reserved a non-smoking room, ended up with a smoking room. Everything smelled like smoke...mattress, blankets, pillows. Moved to non-smoking next morning, black hair hanging on bathtub, took a shower & the tub clogged. Took 3 stops at the front desk (about 9pm) b4 finally fixed. Next day housekeeping left us 3 floor mats for shower towels. Will never stay at this pit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ..... what a ride”
Reviews.Author: HappyTexas_8
Reviews.Content: Wow..what a ride...the Best Hotel and Casino on Fremont Street We love it downtown....The check in was very fast... we upgraded to a Petite Suite...soooooo nice..lots of space and seating. We had our two daughters and their husbands along and the Hotel was so nice to put us all on the same floor...The food was wonderful and fast service.... The slots were fun...One of the things we really liked was how the hotel and casino is set up..when you come down on the elevator...you are right at the check in desk and the Casino is right there....no walking forever to get to the Casino.... the Maids were there every day to clean our room and always asked if we needed any items...brought blankets and extra coffee for us.... not one bad experience... We plan to go back over and over again...will only stay at the Four Queens.......When we got ready to check out ..they gave us a really good comp.... What a way to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary. We loved everything about this Hotel and Casino

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: funtrip412
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary, we stayed at the Four Queens hotel and loved it! All of the staff from the front desk to houskeeping were so friendly and helpful. They have some great resturants there. Our room was ready when we arrived in the morning, and very clean and roomy. our bed had a pillow top mattress and was extremly comfortable. We loved the Freemont Experience with the light shows and all of the casinos being close together. We were able to walk from hotel to hotel late at night and felt very safe doing it. We would highly recommend staying at the Four Queens, and will stay there again when we return. I cannot think of anything negative to say about our stay, except we did not win any big jackpots anywhere! The atmosphere was wonderful. We have stayed at other hotels on Freemont Street and they did not even come close to comparing to the Four Queens for cleanliness , comfort or how friendly everyone was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RonC32
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth time to stay at the Four Queens. Fortunately the Hotel is partnered with Allegiant Airlines and the package offered is not only a great value, it is convenient. The rooms are clean and housekeeping does a very good job each day. The public areas are in good repair an clean and no foreign odors are evident. Personnel are friendly and responsive to request. Valet service is very good despite an apparently shortage of people. Only complaint would be the food quality in the Veranda. We have stayed on the strip at such places as Harrah's and Monte Carlo and aside from the differences in the physical plants, Four Queens is equal in service and personnel. We have and will recommend them to anyone interested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino”
Reviews.Author: dmp944
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better stay. Check-in took no more than five minutes. All hotel personnel were extremely friendly and helpful. Had a great time at the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Nickelgaye
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens was great! My husband and I had a wonderful time. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We got in at 9:30 am and was able to check into a room right away. If you love video poker like we do, this is a great place to go. They have a huge selection plus lots of progressives, which by the way we hit one on our last day there. Ya Hoo!!! We will definitely be returning. Room service was good and fast and the pizza at the Chicago Brewery was delicious. We love the Fremont Street Experience and checked out some of the other casinos but did 99% of our play at the Four Queens. Do get a players card when get there. Their comp system is really good. We earned 3 free nights and are already planning our return visit. Thanks Four Queens! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “a good price”
Reviews.Author: rainbwblu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 9th for about $35/night. Checked in at 4pm with no line. Front desk staff were very friendly. We were given a North Tower room. It was a long confusing walk from the front desk to our elevators. We were on the 9th floor and above the Fremont experience. Room was basic and clean. Although it was nice to have the flat screen TV, the room felt outdated. Internet is $8.99/day (paid $13.99 for internet at the Mirage). Parking $3/day. We ate at Mangolia's once since we got a free meal voucher for my husbands birthday from the Players Club. Also got some nice totes from joining the Club as well. Overall it was a cheap room downtown. We love staying downtown and usually stay at the Golden Nugget. Not sure if we will return to this hotel or go back to the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Worth waiting 25 years for......”
Reviews.Author: GunnyHunny
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with a stay at the Four Queens August 25-29. We had never been to Las Vegas before so we spent several weeks trying to decide where to stay. We decided to take a chance and stay at the Four Queens and we are so glad that we did. Every staff member that we spoke to was kind and considerate. Our room was very nice (standard with a king bed) and the veiw out our 14th floor window was spectacular! We ate at Magnolia's Veranda 3 times. We found the food delicious and very reasonable, especailly when we used our player's cards. It was handy having a Subway located in the hotel and we were just a few steps away from a McDonalds. We took the Deuce to the strip twice but we liked the atmosphere on Fremont Street much better! We enjoyed our stay so much that we are planning on celebrating anniversary #26 at the Four Queens next year!

Reviews.Title: “Viva 4 Queens!”
Reviews.Author: EJKorvette
Reviews.Content: Going to Vegas for our wedding, we decided to try the Four Queens, based largely on the reviews here. My new bride and I were definitely not disappointed! Our room in the South tower (12th Floor) was clean and comfortable, and room service very efficient. The hotel was ideally located for our needs.
