The "Deuce" (the bus that runs from downtown to the south end of the Strip) was just two blocks away and plenty of food choices and cheezy souvenir shops awaited right outside the doors. The food at Magnolia's at the 4 Queens was delicious, and if you join the Players' Club (it's free) you can get some nice discounts there, too. And of course you're right in the middle of the Fremont St. Experience. So unless you're trying to earn bragging rights by staying at the very overrated and overpriced big-name properties on the Strip, I'd highly recommend the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rich1516
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at 4 Queens for 5 nights in April. We were on the 10th floor or so. The room we got was at the end of the hallway, but the walk from the elevator wasn't bad at all. The room was very clean and comfortable. Our view was over the Fremont Experience canopy on the Fitzgerald's side. I liked that the window opened a little bit to let some fresh air in. We were never in our room before midnight so I can't speak of the noise level from outside. The room did not have a safe so we used the safe deposit boxes at the front desk. This was convenient but I didn't like it being out the open so people could see how much money we were taking with us. If I stay downtown again, I'll definitely consider the 4 Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Book ahead of time!”
Reviews.Author: elPasonative
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great though due to last minute booking we ended up in a tiny room definately sub standard. The room was very nice though too small. The hotel was very clean and all employees were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Queens -- a great hand dealt”
Reviews.Author: inzombiac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay on the Strip and felt we should give downtown a try this trip. We weren't interested in a pool scene or lap of luxury rooms for this stay -- we just needed a clean room to get a shower and good night sleep in. Four Queens definitely delivered. Situated in the heart of downtown on Fremont Street, you cannot beat this location to everything you may want. We arrived late evening and checked in immediately upon arrival. Room was clean, North Tower, and several floors above the Fremont Street Experience (18th). The room had a king size bed (soft and extremely comfortable), plasma tv, view of the mountains and several casinos, efficient air conditioning, and sufficient bathroom space (lower pressure water but did its job). We went down to the casino once we got situated to get a feel for the tables and slots. I will write a separate review for the casino and places we ate at another time and just mention everything briefly now. We had lunch at Rosemary's on Sahara Ave using their prix fixe coupon, and it was worth every penny. Although it is a bit of a hike by rental car or cab, do not miss out on this dining experience. We ventured to the Strip for only one night to see comedian Jim Gaffigan which was a great show at Mandalay Bay, but I realized why I loved the downtown area more -- simply a better group of people to be around and not the stuffy "look at me - look at me" types that seem to be more common at the Strip hotels. Downtown is also less congested with traffic and people and one can enjoy themselves more and not feel as confined as you would on the Strip. For me, you simply get more bang for your buck Downtown. We checked out several other casinos while staying downtown and were impressed with the friendliness of not only the people but the staff from the cashiers to the floor managers. We found we were more likely to get comped than any other experience we had previously on the Strip. Finally, we ate at Hugo's cellar at the Four Queens which was an amazing meal from beginning to end. I will review the overall experience seperately from this review. Overall, the room at the Four Queens is what it is, a room, as I am sure is the same for most of the hotels near Fremont Street. Check in was a cinch, check out was a breeze, the staff was excellent, there was a variety of food to choose from as well as the Chicago Brew Pub which had excellent hand-crafted beers on tap. My recommendation is this: if you are used to staying in suites and have that level of expectation, do not stay at the 4 Queens. If you want a younger crowd and a pool / club scene, do not stay at the 4 Queens. If you, for some reason, go to bed at 9pm every night, the noise from Fremont Street will keep you up, so don't stay downtown let alone at the Four Queens. However, if you want a relaxed atmosphere, have simple expectations, want to be able to have your money go a little farther, and have access to great restaurants and good people, then Four Queens is for you.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: KimInCali
Reviews.Content: Well I stay downtown in Vegas quite often and decided to give Four Queens a shot. The rate was great. Starting off, the parking garage is odd, you have to exit into an alley to get to the hotel check in. The check in people were friendly and the room was very nice, new furniture, a flat screen TV and clean bathroom. First strike against them was the loud pipes when the shower was being used. I mean LOUD! Gambling is always fun at the Queens. All the table people were friendly and even at the keno room the drinks came fast. Strike two was their comps aren't as easy to use. In other hotels you can use your players card at any restaurant to get free or discounted food. At the Four Queens you needed to wait for a host to give you restaurant comps. Hugos' Cellar is located in the Four Queens and is probably the best Downtown restaurant. The last strike was they charged for parking. I didn't pay for parking at either of the other downtown hotels I've stayed at. So It's back to Fitzgeralds for me. Though I'll continue to enjoy gambling at the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “It was very good”
Reviews.Author: cydcat
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas 8 times, and my husband and I decided to stay downtown for the first time this trip. We completely enjoyed our time at the Four Queens. The staff was friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. We arrived at 10 AM and were told they had a room ready for us immediately. We asked for the quietest room they could give us, and that is what we got. I had called ahead to make the request and the room they gave us was blissfully quiet. We never heard the noise from the Freemont Street Experience. Our room was clean, newly re-furbished, small and quite pleasant. The maid service was good. On check-in we requested a refrigerator for my husband's medication, and it was delivered within minutes to our room. Based on recommendations from here at Trip Adviser, we ate 3 times at the 4 Queen's Magnolia's Cafe. The food was fine, the service slow, and it was lit up like a bowling alley. But, it was easy and accessible and our breakfast at the 4 Queens was a 100% better than the breakfast we had at the tonier Golden Nugget down the street, and quite a bit less costly. At first we thought we might have made a mistake staying downtown. But, after taking the bus back and forth to the strip 2 times and dealing with the hassle and crowds on the strip, we realized that staying downtown was the way to go for a couple of middle-aged people who do not want to be around little children. There is nothing for children to do downtown other than see the laser light show at night. And, that is the only time we saw kids, at night, and not for long. All in all I would recommend the 4 Queens to anyone interested in coming to Las Vegas to gamble and not to those coming for the "spa" experience. The hotel does not have a pool or spa. But, downtown does have $5 blackjack all night, $2 roulette and a lot of loose slot machines. It was the first time in my 8 times in LV that I came back with more money than I took, and I won it all downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler's with disability's”
Reviews.Author: Nancee123
Reviews.Content: I am disabled and requested an accessible room. I was given a room in the south tower which was large enough to easily accomodate my wheelchair. The room was located close to an elevator that went directly to the casino. The bathroom was large but had a tub with a shower chair. Worked fine for me but some wheelchair users may find a roll in type shower easier (not sure if one is available here you'd have to ask). The hotel does not have wheelchairs on loan but the bell desk can direct you to a local vendor who will rent you one (manual or electric) and deliver it within an hour. Hotel was clean, and nicely appointed for an older property. I would definately stay here again. Downtown area is much easier to navigate than the Strip for people with limited mobility.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite spot in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: easytexan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas after 4 nights at the Four Queens. The service is amazing and the staff are real nice. I would never stay anwhere else. They are also sensative to a handicapp persons needs and this always makes it easier when your spouse is handicapp. May you always have excellent service and never change the way you serve the customers.

Reviews.Title: “medicwizz@yahoo.com”
Reviews.Author: medicwizz
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I usually stay at 4 star plus hotels and resorts. This was a last minute decision due to the fact our travel agent booked us at the luxor which we found out 2 weeks before our departure was totally sold out! She then gave us a full refund thank God. So we wanted to try downtown. The four queens with air for seven days was 440.00 pp. on hotwire.The bad thing with hotwire is that you dont know your flights until you buy the trip, our flights were HORRIBLE!!!!! When we got there at 10:00 pm our check in took a total of 10 minutes and the desk clerk was very nice and helpful as to what perks/comps we could aquire and how. I requested a room in the south tower due to reading trip advisor reviews stating that it was newer and more updated. They gave us what I requested with no problem.The room was in comparison to a super 8 or comfort inn. It was very nice and clean.Decor was ugly but new. We stayed on the fourth floor in the south tower. There was absolutely no problem with elevaters and no wait to get one. When we exited the elevater we were right in the casino.The maid service was also very good. We had two queen size beds and they were very comfortable and they looked like new. We slept very well and was quite pleased. 32 inch flat screen tv was very nice. Our remote batteries were dead I called the front desk and had new batteries brought to me in 10 minutes.The air conditioning was perfect. The room was no smaller than any average size hotel room. The bathroom was small but was ok with the door closed, ha ha.The shower had good pressure and never a problem with hot water. One thing I didnt like is ,there was no exhaust fan , bathroom was very steamy until the door was opened. Good thing I was with my sister. (due to lack of privacy from door being opened.) Dealers were nice and friendly,Casino host was attittudy but helpful.Booze girls were terrible, Once at the slot machines I had no change for a tip and gave the girl a 50 cent token and she rolled her eyes and I never seen her again, and this was after tipping her a doller per drink for more than 2 hours! At the tables it was complete opposite they kept my glass full. The waitresses in Magnolias were terrible and all didnt care if you ate there or not. I tried to get a cup of soup to go one nite and they said all they had was styrofoam containers and she wouldnt put soup in it, so then I asked for a steak hogie to go and she said they didnt have hogies. So I showed her on the menu that I just looked at and she said "thats a sub not a hogie"? So I just left cause I was so mad at this point and went to the freemont and got chinese take out. Just to let the ladies know,, A bum attempted to rob me outside on freemont street in front of the fremont hotel and casino, but a bicycle cop seen him in action and arrested him approx. 2 am. This was right in front of four queens also and the casino cop seen this and voluntarily escorted me to my room when I returned to the casino.. For me I will absolutely stay here again , the price was right for what we got and we were very pleased.I do however think next time I visit , I will go with my hubby.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens was great!”
Reviews.Author: sheboygangirl
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying downtown and the 4 Queens was great! I thought it was just beautiful and all of the staff were very friendly. I received the exact room that was requested (non-smoking, 2 beds, higher floor) and was very pleased with my accommodations. The room was very clean, did not show a lot of wear and had a nice flat screen T.V. The bathroom is very small, but was very clean and about the size of the one in my apartment so I was right at home. My only complaint, if I had to give one, would be that the water pressure in the shower was very low. Not a deal breaker for me, but you really had to rinse for a while to get the soap out of your hair. I booked through Expedia (I normally book direct with the hotel but got an unbelievable deal with Expedia, $28 a night plus $50 gas card!) and I just wanted to say that my room was great so I do not believe that you get the worst rooms available or the leftovers when you use travel sites (as I have often read many people state in trip reports or reviews). Housekeeping was very good and our room was always clean upon return. The elevators were quick and never crowded. We were in the north tower which is on the fremont side, we had no noise problems (12th floor) but if you are on a lower level I could see noise being a problem. Just a very nice stay, would book here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice "stay-cation"”
Reviews.Author: mrteachTehachapi_CA
Reviews.Content: My recent 4 night stay at Four Queens was delightful. I thought, given that this is an older property in Vegas, that services might be short. To my pleasent surprise, everything was super. Particularly the friendly service of ALL the hotel employees. I'm now planning to make the hotel my place for stay-cation when going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Laigheann
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Memorial Day Weekend, 2008 and enjoyed my stay. It is the perfect location to discover the Freemont Street Experience. My room was clean and spacious. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: unclephil12
Reviews.Content: The room was fairly small but nicely furnished and clean. The king bed was very comfortable and the large flat panel TV was nice. The bathroom was really tiny and well worn...needs updating. The shower was very annoying as the water temerature wouldn't stay consistent for very long as constant adjustment was needed. The good thing was that it was also clean. We were in a room on the 7th floor facing Freemont St. The music from the street was quite loud, especially during the light shows but died down considerably after mid-night. We would go out each day and return late at night so the noise wasn't an issue. We only needed a place to shower and sleep for a few hours each night and for the bargain rate, clean room, the Four Queens fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My family needed a hotel for the Sunday night before Memorial Day. I only encountered very high prices for other properties and came upon the Four Queens for a $50.00 rate. We have not stayed downtown very often and decided to give it a try. Of course when arriving to the hotel Sunday evening downtown was jammed packed. The valet verified that we were going to be hotel guests and then was very helpful with directing us to the front desk. Check in was quick and easy. The room was very clean with a comfortable king size bed and had a nice 32-inch flat panel TV. I was very satisfied with my stay at the Four Queens and would definitely recommend it or stay there again. We did not experience any of the restaurants at the property. The staff that we encountered was very nice and polite. Not a bad way to start off our vacation. GOOD LUCK.

Reviews.Title: “A major complaint (not just the 4 Queens)”
Reviews.Author: Zack56
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only one night. After a week in Hawthorne for a funeral we thought we would at least get a look at the downtown, and the Fremont street Experience. That was the #1 thing on my list for this short stay. We arrived about 11:30 on Monday night. Went through the hassle of checking in, parking in the garage, and finding our way to our rooms on the 11th floor through some maze of elevators (I am disabled and probably should have used the valet service, next time). We got our stuff together (my brother and his new wife and two kids were there also) and headed down for the show. The last show was at midnight, so we waited with a lot of other folks for the show, no show. Later we heard that the sound was broken so they canceled it. Very disappointing, it should have been announced somehow, and this may be our last chance to see it. After this, things got even worse (on a dumb business decision level). The 4 Queens, and the other casino's downtown have their club card places only open from 8am to midnight. We played some, but not having players cards took quite a bit of the fun out of it. The hotel room was more than we really expected with what we payed for it, clean, spacious, and a great TV system. We then got checked out and went through the hassle of getting our cars, and leaving to catch an early (9:30) flight. All in all, not a great experience, it did not enthuse us to return there anytime soon. We will probably continue to travel to the midwest casinos rather that going to Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service...This place Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy66
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2 night stay (Sunday-Tuesday) and I wish I would have never cheked in at this dump. I booked my stay through Expedia and requested a king bed, non smoking and a view of the Freemont Street Experience. What I ended up receiving was a king bed, smoking room with a beautiful view of their air conditioning experience! I complained, but all they told me was that they didn't have anything else available, even though I was checking in at 1:30P.M.. That was straight [-]! The room was smoky as hell, and we bought some air fresheners, but it didn't cure the problem. The parking is crappy at this place too. They want your tickets and too display their yellow piece of paper....Just problems every time I had to get the car out of the structure. The room was small, but duable. The t.v. was cool, but why have an LCD if you're not going to put the HD signal??The hotel is centrally located right in the middle of Freemont, and that was about the only good thing in this dump.I do have to say that the Magnolia Cafe is excellent. You know, before this experince I thought that the Plaza was the worst hotel I've stayed in, but this 4 Queens with their BAD service is what really got to me. Next time, I won't stay in a room if they tell me it's a smoking room, but at least let a person know ahead of time if their speacial requests will not be made. Because then whats the point of requesting anything if you guys don't pay attention to [-] anyways!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice on Fremont Street!”
Reviews.Author: avsnatvsgal
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a long weekend stay at the Four Queens in a package deal through Allegiant Air. I called the Four Queens to upgrade our room to a Jacuzzi Suite. Telephone customer service was excellent. I was a little concerned about the potential quality of the hotel being that it is much older than the hotels on the Strip where I am used to staying. When we arrived, the front desk personnel were very friendly. I was pleasantly surprised with the Four Queens. We were in room 1002, on the 10th floor. Our windows were over the Fremont Street canopy, but view was not a concern for us. The room was nice and big, very clean and nicely appointed. The Jacuzzi tub was big and awesome! What a relaxing way to chill out before bed after a long day in Vegas. The water pressure in the shower was amazing. The only complaint I had about the room was that the mattress was a little hard. Otherwise, everything else about the room was great. The Four Queens was much cleaner and nicer than I had expected it to be. The food at Marigold's Cafe was excellent as was the food at the little deli in the casino. Be sure to get your club card for nice discounts on select meals at Marigold's. I would like to note that this was my best friend's very first trip to Las Vegas and she loved the Fremont Street experience! I will definitely be staying at the Four Queens again! :)

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens Casino fun location”
Reviews.Author: 7377ml
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 4 queens from May 23-26, 2008. Received an offer for three free nights and a free slot tournament. Rented a car for 4 days for $99.00. I highly recommend renting a car if you don't mind driving in heavy traffic. Really gives you a chance to go and check out other places . I own a Tom Tom travel unit and it really makes it stress free going from one address to another. Arrived at the hotel around 1 pm and even though check in wasn't supposed to be till 3 pm there was no problem getting a room. I had asked for room above the Fremont street light show and was put up on the 15th floor. If you are bothered by loud noises, I highly recommend that you get above the 10 th floor and ask for a room facing away from the Fremont street experience. ( You will sleep much better) The room while not large was fine, two queen beds and a small tub and shower. While I didn't win slot tournament it was fun. The casino was not smoky as I have read from other guests comments. It was busy and yet you could find a 5 dollar black jack table if you wanted. Lots of machines to play and they paid out as good as any. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Karen57Florida
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed at the Four Queens from May 20 to the 27th. Check in was a breeze. I requested a refrigerator and it arrived to the room before we did. We had a corner room on the 17th floor facing Fremont. The view was excellent. The room was nice and clean and maid service was wonderful. Everyday they came in and cleaned and left more and more little shampoos and etc...... Magnolis was great as well. Everyone we met were very friendly and I will definitely stay there again. Great bargain. They do not have safes in the rooms, however, for no charge we used the deposit boxes at the front desk and we had access 24/7

Reviews.Title: “Its a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GrayWolf5
Reviews.Content: Rooms are on the small size compared to the Golden Nugget but are clean and have a 32" lcd tv. Bathrooms are smaller in size. Everything was fine during our two day stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens did not dissapoint!”
Reviews.Author: acsmacan
Reviews.Content: Stayed this year at the Four Queens for the first time. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. We requested a room that overlooked the FSE and under the canopy- This proved to be a mistake on our part as we didnt realize that the music plays 24/7!! Found out that we were lighter sleepers than we knew!! No worries though as the room was small but really nice with newer carpet and a great LCD flat TV. Bath was small too, but looked as though it had been recently updated and was very clean, We really enjoyed the Chicago Brew pub and thought thier micros were fantastic. Magnolias was wonderful as usual too. Overall, we would stay here again if it were in the cooler months where you wouldnt use a pool. I really missed not having a pool to use. I would also get a room FAR from the FSE so I could sleep at night !! I would definitlely reccomend the 4Q's to anyone looking for a nice place to stay downtown if a pool was of no importance.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single complaint....”
Reviews.Author: Birdmombjk
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas a couple times a year and have stayed at all sorts of places. I find it ridiculous to spend a small fortune so I always look for a deal. We decided to stay on Fremont Street for the first time. It was GREAT! The hotel is right smack in the middle and close to lots of fun. Check in was fast and painless. We got a room on the 14th floor facing Fremont St. Although in the night we could sort of hear the music outside it did not prevent us from sleeping. Ask for the south tower if you are bothered by this. The room was nice. Bathroom was small and has yet to be updated but everything was CLEAN! The employees were nice and helpful especially at the roulette table. Rafael was friendly and answered all my questions even though I was not playing. The slots are looser than on the strip and I always finished the night ahead of what I started with. The have a wonderful casual dining place, Magnolia's where you can get a prime rib dinner 24/7 for $6.95 with a player's club card. If you want a buffet though go down the street to Main Street station for a great and inexpensive buffet. All and all this was my favorite trip to Vegas for numerous reasons with The Four Queens being one of them. We will go again and I will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if you sleep like a log”
Reviews.Author: BestValueHunter
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas, I usually stay at or near the Strip. Enjoyed spending time Downtown, because of how close everything is, and decided to give it a try. Reserved a Non-Smoking room for Thursday through Sunday nights (4 nights). The room was fine, clean, newer carpeting, and relatively fresh paint. Bathroom fixtures were old, dated, and showed signs of wear, but clean. Hard foam pillows were all that were available (OK, I'm a little spoiled with hotels having both foam and feather pillows). Saw somewhere on their web site that rooms had in-room safes ... but couldn't fine one. I called down, and they said only smoking rooms had in-room safes. Couldn't believe my ears (perhaps they had to put their cigarettes in the safe?), so I went down to ask, and was told that ony the suites had in room safes, but could talk to Security for some sort of secured locker in another part of the building (I think they said in the basement). Now that seems convenient for someone who travels with a laptop or other valuables (not). I got a room on the 12th floor, facing Fremont Street, which I thought was great ... nice views and all ... until the music kept playing until 4am ... and then VERY LOUD PA announcements began at 8am, and kept repeating every 5 minutes. I considered checking out after the lack of a room safe (and thought I'd give them another chance), then again after a restless night ... but I really wanted to like staying downtown. After the second night, I decided to get out of there, and found another hotel near the strip for about 20% more in cost. Much much nicer, with a room safe too :) I don't know if staying in one of their other towers would have been nicer. If you do stay here, I'd suggest you forgo the views and get a room off Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Luksa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed four nights at the Four Queens. We love staying in downtown Las Vegas and have stayed at several other properties. The room at the Four Queens was comparable to some of the others. However, if you are looking for the upscale quality of the "mega" resorts, this is probably not the place for you. The room was average. I loved the coffee pot in the room. Surprisingly, the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. The fan to the air conditioning was pretty noisy. You would have to turn up the volume on the TV when the A/C came on. One complaint I had was that the selection of television channels was pretty limited. There were no movies channels like HBO. I became ill and had to spend one whole day in the room. I had to watch CNN or sports most of the day. The staff at the Four Queens was great. Everyone we encountered was very friendly. The pit crew and dealers were nice. (Thanks Robb and Mr. IL). The front desk staff were very quick at check in. The valets were very polite and efficient. We had a great breakfast at Magnolia's. You get a great deal on breakfast with your players card. It's $4.95 for a huge breakfast including coffee. The food was good. We also had a sandwich from the deli. It was really good but a bit pricey. For sandwiches, chips and drinks for two people it was almost $20. My husband and I have decided we will be staying at Four Queens again. It is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: jenniyoder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Queens after my plane was delayed. It was a nice hotel with a matching "nice" price, even for the weekend and late notice I got a great deal. The hotel is clean, located right on Freemont Street, they have room service, internet access and in-house restaurants and casino. It is not the best hotel downtown, but is defintely not shabby and is clean. The service staff is helpful and smiling. Had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Price, Thats All.”
Reviews.Author: junkyardz
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was O.K. the hotel not very nice by any means, nice meaning fancy. if you can afford better do it. Just very plain, pretty clean but plain. If this hotel was not around so much entertainment, Motel 6 would be better. We chose 4 Queens for Fremont Street and the price. It seems like alot of the attitude that you get from employees in this area is from not getting paid as much as up on the Strip I can only assume. This was the first time I have stayed downtown and would have to say that if I stayed again it wouldn't be at 4 Queens would have booked the Golden Nugget. The casino was OK small but fun, there is nothing else to do here no entertainment in the hotel, not a problem though since Fremont Street is right outside. The hotel staff was not very friendly at all, needed directions to clerks office to get a marriage license, they sent us in the wrong direction 4 blocks, if you are familiar with downtown you know you don't want to be wandering around at 1:00 AM, very shady characters in that area, don't wander off Fremont Street after dark. After going back to the hotel to let them know their little map and directions they gave were wrong, they didn't even say sorry or offer to get us a taxi to take us or nothing. No compassion for the anxious pre-marriage couple. Paid a Taxi $20 to take us 4 blocks in the opposite direction we was sent, was happy to pay considering the uncertainty of the area the clerks office was in. All in all the vacation was pretty much what I had anticipated for the price. If budget is what you want 4 Queens is fine. If your wanting the excitement you see on TV fancy fancy stay on the Strip in a more upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixtraveller
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 11am and my room was ready. Staff were friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is great for seeing the downtown area. The casino is large and has a good selection of games. The elevators to the rooms are nearby and easy to find. The room was basic and comfortable -nothing special. I ate dinner at Magnolias and it was just okay. If you get a good price and just need a basic room near it all...this hotel will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disppointed”
Reviews.Author: UtahBobzagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short stay at the Four Queens. We normally stay at the Golden Nugget if we're going to be in the downtown area but after reading many positive reviews and comparing prices we decided to try this property. Check in was fast and effecient. Our room was a queen overlooking Fremont Street. The room was one of the smallest I've ever stayed in. It looked like it had been recently painted and refurbished but age was still evident throughout the room. The view was the top of the giant LCD screen from the Fremont Street Experience which is basically blocks of curved metal. The hotel doesn't have a pool or a buffet. We walked across the street for dinner. While playing slots we were never once approached and offered drinks in approximately 6 hours of play. I finally went to one of the bars to order drinks and there was one bartender trying to serve at least 20 customers and after waiting for 15 minutes for him to get to me I finally gave up and walked to another casino to get our drinks. The worst part of the stay was bedtime. We got to our room about 11:00 PM and were exhausted and there was a live band playing on the street below and the crowd was screaming. It was so loud there was no way we could sleep until the band stopped playing. Although the experience wasn't all bad, the size of the room and the noise factor will probably keep me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: ttugurl
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay. I frequent downtown Las Vegas with my family about 4x a year. I have stayed at Fitzgerald and Binions but never Four Queens. This time around the price was reasonable so we books 3 rooms for a week at four queens. We were right next to the elevator. Everyone was nice. The only problems I would say with the hotel would be the long lines at the Royal Players club line. There was a rude employee in the gift shop and the hostess was a bit rude as well. Overall a great stay. Rooms are far better than Binions! Words of advice. Don't book with outside vendors (travelocity, travelworm etc). Book with the casino! Because even though it might be more, when you checkout show them your Royal Club card and you will get a discount rate of about 35$ a day! Instead of 50! You need to play at the casino and use your players card! Theyll comp your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: windsmith
Reviews.Content: Went to the front desk on a Sunday morning around 11am expecting to be turned away until 4pm. The room we booked (standard) was not ready, but after inquiring, was upgraded to a suite in the South tower. Very large room with two couches, table, desk, comfortable bed and adequately sized bathroom. Large flat screen TV, but we never turned it on. Hotel staff provided excellent service (be sure to tip the front desk clerk in appreciation for the work they do on your behalf). If you play table games, be sure to stay on the pit crew about rating your play if you expect to be comped properly. We checked with the casino host after two days of play, and found that we had been significantly under-rated for our level of play. The host spoke with the pit management, and we were properly rated for the remainder of our trip. Overall, a great stay, and will be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: medsec076
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Queens in Vegas and found this to be the best vacation to vegas yet!!! I've always stayed on the strip before and was hesitant to stay downtown but to my surprise it was fabulous! At the Four Queens the rooms were clean, maid service was fantastic, check in counter was fast and friendly, gaming table personal friendly and helpful and food at Magnolias just as good as three times the price on the strip! I will book my next stay at the Four Queens. Even the cashiers in the cage were friendly! I could not tell you a bad thing about the Four Queens. The view was also fantastic of the strip and mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay at the 4-Q”
Reviews.Author: gramsclp
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay downtown for the first time this trip (usually stay on the strip). We checked all the hotels/rates and the Four Queens seemed to be what we were looking for, both in location and price, so I called and booked for 4 nights . The we actually got a postcard in the mail offering us 3 nights free so called and they said we could apply this and then pay $35 for the 4th night, which was great! Our flight got messed up and we ended up taking a flight a day earlier, putting us into Vegas on a Sat. late afternoon and many properties do not allow Sat. checkins. So I called and was told we could definitely get a room for Sat. night at a rate of only $49. We found them extremely accommodating. Loved the location. Magnolias was good food. Also an ice cream place upstairs and you can sit there on stools and look down onto the playing floor. We will definitely stay there again as downtown has become our new favorite spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens gets five stars”
Reviews.Author: ladycubCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip 10 weeks in advance thru Travelocity. Each time I contacted the hotel, they still didn't have the paperwork from Travelocity. 10 days prior to trip, called Travelocity for the 3rd time to tell them paperwork was not received by hotel. Was told AGAIN by Travelocity they were faxing paperwork. Upon check-in on March 27th, hotel still didn't have the paperwork. The front desk clerk at the Four Queens wrangled with Travelocity for over 2 hours to get the necessary paperwork for my stay. The hotel itself has beautiful rooms with extra soft beds and large flat panel tv's. The exemplary customer service I received from the hotel front desk staff will make me a repeat customer, but I'll deal directly with the hotel, and will NEVER use Travelocity again. This experience could have ruined my vacation, but because the Four Queens staff intervened, my stay was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel, but book it directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Pezz4Israel
Reviews.Content: First time at the 4 queens. Best kept secret in Vegas. Loved this hotel. Spacious rooms, nice decor. Have stayed at some of the best and I am going back to 4 Queens. Fun, Fun, Fun. RIght on Freemont, where you really want to be. Fun table games, slots were great. People were super. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Food was great...Service top notch. I was totally surprised. Thanks 4 Queens for making my March getaway-great! See ya soon! Judy Cumming Ga.

Reviews.Title: “Fuor Stars for Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: TheConstantTraveler3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and had a GREAT time. We traveled with 3 small children and used the 4Q based on Price and Location. The Hotel was immaculately clean. It is in the Fremont Street section and everything is litterally outside the doors! Despite it being an older property, it showed NO signs of age. The check-in was a snap, parking a breaze and navigating the place was simple. We had to walk through the Casino to get outside and the air quality inside the Casino was actually cleaner than the air on Fremont Street. Could not beat the Value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Downtown”
Reviews.Author: schoppie
Reviews.Content: We took our father to Vegas in 2007 and stayed at the Stratasphere and the Four Queens by far outdid our stay there. I can't begin to tell you how happy we all were. We had two rooms both on the top floor. The evelvators were very quick (never had to wait). Since it was Super Bowl Weekend we had to wait for everything, but the elevators and I don't mean at the Four Queens. Everyone that worked there was so helpful and always happy and had a smile of their face. Myself I usually have trouble sleeping in hotel beds, but not here they were so comfortable I slept like a baby and since I have had hip surgery on both hips that is saying alot. When the travel agent booked the Four Queens I was a little nervous because I had read some of the reviews and some of the most common complaints I saw were un-comfortable beds and slow elevators, but I am happy to say they were wrong on both accounts. We really enjoyed playing the slots, but I must say they did seem a little looser AFTER the Super Bowl. Again, there were 4 of us and all 4 would HIGHLY reccommend the Four Queens - as we have been doing since our return home. We do plan on coming back to Vegas again and I can assure you we will be staying at the Four Queens every time from now on. Thanks for a great experience!!!! Karen - Vicki - Steve & Ray from Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bootsie1957
Reviews.Content: Anyone planning a trip to Las Vegas and likes the laid back feel of Fremont Street should give the Four Queens a try. We have stayed several times and cannot find a better hotel anywhere. In March 2008 we came for the Nascar race. We had actually booked through a travel agent this time (always used Expedia prior) because he was a friend of a friend. We did not stay at the Four Queens. However, when we were due to leave, a blizzard hit our hometown of Columbus, OH and we knew we would have to stay in Vegas a couple more days. We immediately headed for the Four Queens and was given a room for two nights stay complaints of the Four Queens. We will never stay anywhere else again as my wife and I agree. No one can match the Four Queens for the friendly atmosphere, excellent service, great food and so many other reasons. When we stayed at the Four Queens for the Nascar race in March of 2007, my wife became seriously ill and had to be transported to an emergency room. Security was swift to respond and helped me deal with a bad situation. My wife was ill enough that we were not able to depart as scheduled. The management at the Four Queens said stay in your room as long as necessary which turned out to be five extra days. I cannot believe after that I even considered staying anywhere else in 2008. I know we never will again. Try the Four Queens. YOU WON'T BE SORRY!!!!!! Larry & Vicki Doles, Columbus, OH

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in downtown LV, by the "Freemont Experience"”
Reviews.Author: Lilygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in one month. We needed an inexpensive hotel that was close to our destination. We don't gamble, so all I can say about the casino is that there is one. The elevators are fast. The housekeeping staff consistantly does things that appear to be destructive to the hotel. Both stays, different rooms, different floors: the housekeepers unplugged the bedside lamps. So each night, my husband had to pull the bed away from the wall in order to plug the lamps back in. Not enough electrical outlets. The shower tiles in one room were a lovely pink; but marred by black gunk in the grout towards the ceiling. A water faucet kept dripping. The hotel appears to have spent a lot on renovating. But the hotel needs to take a hard, cold look at its housekeeping staff. The Magnolia restaurant is ok, and you can sit at tables that overlook the casino. The lobby opens into the casino. The casino leads to the Freemont Experience. We enjoyed the free night-time entertainment: the four block long video screen, the band, several artists painting in various kiosks, the shops, and the jewelry vendors. We will definitely stay downtown again next trip, but we may look at the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: mmptysmom
Reviews.Content: Nice stay overall.Quick check in/out.Helpful staff.Housekeeping responded quickly to requests.Nice rooms though bathroom small but who spends much time there anyway.I always have trouble sleeping in hotel beds but not here..very comfortable.We were on the 17th floor and were impressed with the quick elevators..Magnolias restaurant had some excellent deals if you have a players card..good size portions and tastey!!!Casino slot machines were very tight not just here but everywhere..be sure to bring plenty of cash if thats your thing.Utilize the deuce bus for transportation..only $5 for 24 hours.Pickup only a few blocks and the deuce comes quite often and sometimes back to back.Be sure to reserve your airport shuttle the day before departure..Only issue was the a/c seemed to be turned off daily 1200-400 not an issue at this time of year but could be during hot season...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, food, and services!”
Reviews.Author: Readinglady58
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Four Queens since Lady Luck closed. I have yet to be disappointed with the service, friendliness of staff, or room cleanliness. The rates are great and so is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable room in heart of downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan77
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, safe, and centrally located for the Fremont Street scene, the Four Queens is a smart choice for anyone looking for an affordable casino hotel. Housekeeping is conscientious and the newer furnishings include 32" HD televisions. It's funny to think of a 200-room hotel as "small" but the Four Queens felt cozier than the other gargantuan casino properties. It's next door to the Golden Nugget and across the street from Binion's Horseshoe, so there's plenty of action nearby. I used to visit Las Vegas frequently twelve years ago, and back then I would stay at the Stardust because it offered me the same combination of affordability and amenities. Sadly, the Stardust is now gone and the enormous super-casinos are rapidly devouring the Strip. Downtown has changed little, so I appreciate the nostalgia and authenticity of Fremont Street. I'll make a return trip to the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 24 thru 29”
Reviews.Author: Louisiananwoman
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with our stay. People here were so nice from the time we checked out til the time we left. From the time we walked in the hotel til we got to our room was less than 20 minutes. Rooms were on the small side, but nothing I didn't expect. I was very satisfied, no problems with the rooms, extremely good water pressure. We stayed in room 1607 with an outside view, beautiful view at night or in the day. Perfect view of the strat. Can't forget the flat screen TV. We did have a smoking room, but you couldn't tell, no stale smoke smell. No in room safe but they do have safety deposit boxes at the front desk free of charge, which we took advantage of. There was one episode where I forgot my camera in the bathroom, didn't realize it for 30 minutes but lo and behold the bathroom attendant found it and returned it to security, I was so happy. I am so glad I just happened to tip this attendant. I think she would have turned it in anyway. The only complaint I have is that we stayed for 5 nights and gambled there every night. There was 3 of us and we gambled an average of $1000 a night between us and we did not get anything comped on our room. But as far as hotel review, Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IowaPepsi
Reviews.Content: when looking for a hotel in vegas, i searched price, location, and read the reviews from other travelers. i can't say enough about this place. my husband and i went on a getaway, this place is clean, spacious, and priced right. i thought the price was low and what kind of place am i getting into. It was perfect. i will definiately stay here again. the prices of food are also cheaper down here on freemont street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will go back”
Reviews.Author: Numberfive1
Reviews.Content: We booked a Vegas package through Cheaptrips and hit the jackpot! We got a smooth nonstop from Seattle to Vegas, and had a wonderful time at the Four Queens. We were on the 5th floor, North Tower, overlooking the Fremont Experience sign. Odd numbered rooms face the experience, even numbers are farther away from the experience nightly activity. Even being so close, we could barely hear the experience and crowds at night. The room was nicely furnished and clean. Nothing extravagant, but we didn't need that. The bathroom wasn't palatial, but didn't need that either. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate breakfast at Magnolia's every morning (open 24/7), and the food was delicious, and hot! We had a special dinner at Hugo's and the food and service was exceptional. It was costly, but worth every penny. Wonderful salad prepared especially for each person at your table. Gambling: we just hit the slots, which were a bit more loose Fri-Sun. Nice variety of slots. The cashiers were fun if you talk with them. We've been going to Vegas and staying on the strip for years. We like staying downtown. It's a shorter distance to the various casinos, smaller crowds, friendlier casino staff, looser slots. If you're the younger generation, love the glitz and noise of the strip, downtown isn't for you! We just took a taxi ride to the strip to see our booked shows.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but noisy & really only for serious gamblers”
Reviews.Author: AnnelieseVonSieb
Reviews.Content: Although the staff members were all very courteous, our stay at the Four Queens was frustrating in a few ways. For one thing, many of the hotel's rooms face Fremont Street, which features loud bursts of music every half hour between 7 p.m. and midnight, every night. If you are an early to bed type or are bringing young children, either request a room that is as far from Fremont Street as possible, or just don't stay at this hotel. In addition to the noise, downsides included the fact that you have to weave through the incredibly smoky casino to get to the hotel's restaurants; the fact that there is no pool or hot tub or anything at all to do at the hotel if you want to take a break from gambling; and the fact that after we moved to a new room, the tub faucet leaked all night and the room smelled of smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. On the plus side, their Magnolia's restaurant had good food, and the light show at the Fremont Street Experience is fun. A big issue to consider is the general location of the hotel. If you aren't familiar with Vegas, please note that the Four Queens is nowhere near the more famous and fabulous hotel/casinos such as the Bellagio, Venetian, Luxor, and Paris. To get to them, either you need a car or you jam yourself onto a city bus called the Deuce, which can take 40-50 minutes to get to the newer casinos at rush hour and can be standing-room-only crowded. If all you want from your stay is to gamble and smoke cigarettes all day, this hotel will probably be fine for you. If not, you are better off staying at one of the newer casinos on the newer end of the Strip. They are less smoky and have a lot more to see and do than the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay on Freemont”
Reviews.Author: biggunzz
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay on Freemont Street in two months and it was a nice experience. The room was small but very clean with a nice flat screen tv. Yes I sometimes watch sports that I bet on in the room and rest. The Sportsbook is small but very friendly. After it closes you can cash your tickets at the Cashier of the Casino. They do not have a poker room,but just across the street at Golden Nugget there is a nice one. The only complaint was the hot water was not the greatest,but the stay was worth the money. Compared to the Plaza at the same price range,it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cable_Hogue
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were anywhere else, it would be pretty good. Hence my four star rating. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful, the parking is free, and the location is convenient in its way. The nastiest drawback is that rooms that are next to Fremont Street have all the noise of the Fremont Street Experience. Otherwise a well run hotel. However, it's in a bad location for Vegas—unless you want to be downtown. I did, my wife didn't. She thought the hotel was pretty average. Either way, I'm not sure it merits the $95/night average room rate. Bottom line: if you turn in early make sure you are far from Fremont Street or you won't sleep before midnight. Make sure you score a good deal, because it's not that much better than a Day's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay under the canopy”
Reviews.Author: rockys-hun
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after a "great" stay at the 4Queens for 4 nights in room 408-North Tower. It seemed the even number rooms faced Fremont St. We requested 2 queen beds that were under the canopy so we could enjoy the light show and people watch from our room, in the short time that we "expected" to be in it and that's exactly what we got. Early check-in was not an issue and the staff was great. The elevator for the North Tower was 20 steps away (I counted for this review) from Fremont St and our room from the elevator was the same distance. Great!! The room was "very" clean and the beds-pillows were "too" comfortable because when we layed down for a quick nap at 8pm (after a long plane ride in), we slept the night away until 5am. Grrrrr! FSE did not keep us awake nor was the noise from it disturbing. Actually, it was great to just lay in bed and watch it before our, so called.... 9 hr nap. With the window closed (it opens about 6 inches for fresh air), the music etc was not an issue. The room contained a 3 cup coffee maker with all the fixings but we did bring our own coffee, filters etc so we could enjoy coffee the way we like it. According to a wall sign...Ice machines are on floors 4-9-10-12-18-19. Soda($2 for 20oz) machines are on 4-5-8-11-15-17 The bathroom contained the usual shampoo, lotion and hand soap. Not a large bathroom, but suited us just fine. Housekeeping was great and did not bother us while we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. The gift shop closes early but Walgreens is a short block away for anything that you need....meds, snacks, drinks etc. The "only" complaint we had was the casino was too hot to enjoy when the casino got busy at night, even though the outside temps were in the mid 40's, so we ended up playing mostly at the Fremont Casino across the street at night. Great buffet at the Fremont and enjoyed two meals there with 2-4-1 vouchers given for our meager slot play. The Fremont will soon open up a Dunkin Donuts for northeners or us ex-northeners to enjoy...yea!!! Our stay, booked thru their web-site was at a cost of $49-$49-$49-$99-Tues thru Sat but cheaper rates were advertised a week before check-in so watch your rates before you go. I hope I covered all questions and think you'll also enjoy it if you don't expect the costly suites found on the strip. We'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel during Super Bowl Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigBuckaroo
Reviews.Content: Six of us just returned from our fifth Super Bowl Weekend in Las Vegas. This was our first time staying at the Four Queens and we had an absolutely fantastic time. We stayed five nights (arrived Thursday, departed Tuesday) on the 15th floor of the South Tower where our recently remodeled rooms had new carpet, new furniture, new drapes, new bedding, and a new flat screen TV. Although our bathrooms had not been remodeled and were older, they were still maintained and cleaned. The entire staff, including but not limited to, Check-in, Dealers, Pit Bosses, Cashiers, Waitresses, Bartenders, Security, were friendly, courteous, helpful, and accommodating. We did the majority of our gambling at the Four Queens where the drink service while doing so was expeditious. The food/beverage at Hugo’s Cellar, Magnolias Veranda, Chicago Brewing Company, and Queens Coffee/Deli was excellent. We have stayed at other Freemont Street hotels and the Four Queens most definitely gives you the best value for your hard earned dollars. Personally, my trip was topped off on the morning of our departure when I decided to give it one more gamble. I played one of the Elvis Slot machines and was rewarded with $413.50 of which I promptly took a portion and made some future bets at the Sports Book. Viva Las Vegas and Viva the Four Queens!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Stay”
Reviews.Author: barbiejack
Reviews.Content: Dear Customer Service, This past weekend my family and I stayed at your hotel. My daughter-in-law, Jennifer Putman had made the reservations under her credit card. She was not with my husband and I at the time of check in for her flight came in later. I was asked to give my credit card to the check in person upon checking in. My husband was unaware that I had given my card to the lady. I was called away on the phone and he finished with the check in. Later that evening in the room I was going through my purse and noticed my credit card was missing. I immediately went to the front desk and they said they did not have it to check with the lost and found in your hotel. They too, did not have it. I immediately called the credit card company to cancel the card. The next evening I again checked at both places to see if the card had been seen. Again, the answer was no. Upon checking out, the a different lady, handed me my card with out me asking for it. I said, "Where did this come from?" Her reply was in the key envelope in your reservation packet. I also was charged incorrectly for the rooms, one at $99 and the other at $159. The lady said the amount was signed for upon check in. Again, my daughter-in-law made the reservation and my husband was not aware of the charges. I find this totaly unethical for two rooms that are exactly alike and for the head ache of my missing credit card that your hotel held in it's possesion the entire time. Sincerely, Barbara J. Putman [--]

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: gjgoldengirl
Reviews.Content: Everyone person we met was friendly and helpful. The room arranged for my dad (handicapped) was perfect and set up for his needs. The casino was fun - both slots and cards. The food was good. Overall a great experience and we would go back to the Four Queens in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens ='s A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Okiesoap
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas from Jan 20 - Jan 24 2008. Stayed at the Four Queens (after staying at the WAY overpriced MGM last time) and found it to be a very nice, wonderful trip. We saved SO much money this time by enjoying all that downtown Fremont Street has to offer. The 4 Queens restaraunts offer discounts with your FREE players card to the tune of $12 breakfasts (for 2 people) and lunches/dinners not much more than that. It was great food also and we ate there a lot! Our room was on the 11th floor and had the most amazing view of the Fremont Experience and Vegas. We took almost a roll of pictures just from the window! We were worried at first (from reading other reviews) that the noise from the street would keep us awake all night, but it was not bad at all. Also, the drapes they have in the room can be shut to black out any light - our room was so dark at night I would almost trip going to the bathroom. Very clean, very friendly, very fun. Everything was lovely, and we will definitly stay here again...and again....and again!

Reviews.Title: “stay was just OK”
Reviews.Author: yaksmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 4 Queens Jan18-20th 2008. Check in and out were very fast, they stored our luggage as our room wasn't ready until 3.We were approached by "timeshare people" leaving the 4queens and entering Golden Nugget every time.We even went on Saturday. 4hours and we didn't buy a timeshare cost was 32,000 and when we kept saying no cost went way down to 5000.When I opened a towel off the clean towel shelf a sticker from size 14-16 fell out of my towel onto the floor. I'm a hefty size 20 so I'm really sure it wasn't mine. It was the kind that sticks to your jeans and runs down the front with the size printed on it. At that moment I was very surprised that my towel had not been washed! In fact the towels never had that fresh scent.My husband spent all af Sunday at the ESPN zone on the strip watching the championship games and he ttok the Deuce which was very handy 5dollars for 24hrs or 2dollars a one way trip, catch it at Walgreens 1 block away and it stops everywhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here for years! Much the best!”
Reviews.Author: Russ S
Reviews.Content: We've gone to Vegas every year during the Super Bowl weekend for 10+ years running. Initially we stayed on the Strip, but for the last 5 years, always the Four Queens. Their service has been great from the time you get out of your vehicle. Whether you drive or use public transportation, you will find getting to the front desk easy. The hotel staff has been great. The only time we had an issue, the Manager made it right by us immediately. The rooms are average size, but always clean. Never any surprises. The casino is small, but the dealers and pit crews are extremely friendly. Restaurants: I'd rate Magnolias about a 3 out of 5. Their food is good and priced right, but their servers seem over-loaded. Hugo's Cellar is a 5/5 as it is one of the best steakhouses in Vegas. Their service is superb and the salad service is done table-side with excellent choices. No buffet in 4Q, but a very good one is right across the street at Fremont. We found a gem in downtown and it never disappoint us! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Catera
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay downtown. We found the stay very nice. The room was on the small side but, very clean and looked newly redone. The LCD TV was very nice and although there is a charge for wireless it was very fast. Be sure to get your players cards as 2 prime rib dinners only cost us $20, tip and everything. We enjoyed this trip downtown, it was very safe, clean and reasonable. We will be back again. Only complaint i guess was when the tour busses arrived the lines at the elevators was 40 people deep, but it disipated quickly when we came back 20min later.

Reviews.Title: “Headed Back To The 4 Queens”
Reviews.Author: gamblinggranny
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been to Vegas three times.The first time we did not stay at the Four Queens.But we have stayed their twice & will be returning Mar.2008.& will be enjoying our stay at the Four Queens.This is by far the best & most friendly hotel,the staff will go out of their way to meet your needs.The rooms are very clean just a great hotel. My husband & I are not "high rollers" but we were treated like "high rollers" just the same.The restaurant is very good too. My husband & I can't say enough good things about the Four Queens & the staff. Kudos to you. Also a morning walk down Fremont street is very enjoyable because of the music.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: candleyte618
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Four Queens. I love downtown and usually stay at the Fitz. but we wanted to try a different hotel this time. Our stay was excellent. We were treated the same as if we were at a 4 star hotel. The rooms are a little small, but not too small. Plenty of room for everything. Bathroom was very clean. The TV's are new flatscreens. We really enjoyed our stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying there”
Reviews.Author: cathy026
Reviews.Content: Hi, My boyfriend and I decided to stop in Las Vegas on our way to Arizona for Thanksgiving. We mostly booked the Four Queens because it was inexpensive. It turned out to be the best time we had ever had in Las Vegs. The Strip is nice, but it is too big. We went up to the stip one day to see a show, but you really don't have to go any further than Fremont Street to have everything right at your fingertips. There are several great casinos to go to, but we mostly played in the Four Queens because it was so comfortable. But, if we wanted a break all we had to do is go out the door. They have entertainment evrey night which was absolutely "excellent". And the service at the Four Queens matched or exceeded any other place we have stayed in Las Vegas. Can't wait to go back. Cathy Mastracchio

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cptguy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a solo trip this Jan and wanted something econimical and clean. I booked the four queens for 33.95/night week day rate after reading some of the other reviews here and was pleasantly surprised. Checked in early at 1130 am, no problem, king room # 1816 overlooking the top of the fremont canopy. Very clean, new furnishings, carpet, lcd flat panel widescreen tv. The room comes equipped with a coffee maker, iron and board, hair dryer but no mini bar. I had no issues with noise either from the hall or from next door. The staff throughout the casino/hotel were attentive and friendly. I did not try Hugo's Cellar but Magnolia's for breakfast at 6.95 was good. This is a wise choice if you're looking for clean and comfortable accomodations downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Otonita1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night unexpectedly. We had reservations at the Venetian hotel on the strip but I arrived in Vegas one day early, so I got a priceline deal at the Four Queens. Overall I have to say it wasn't too bad. The rooms were much better than I had expected for a 2 star place - they were very clean, comfy beds, good service etc. The hotel was a bit old and rundown. There were many signs of neglect as well - the ice machine in my hallway was overrun with water and sludge which had seeped into the carpet. Aside from that - the main downside was the location of the hotel. If you're into the older buildings and vintage vegas than this might be your dream place. I have to admit that I did not feel safe walking outside the hotel at night (or much less any time of the day). BTW - there isn't much that makes me nervous or feel unsafe, since I grew up in Baltimore and now live in downtown DC. Keep in mind that the Four Queens is a very different vegas experience than one gets while staying on the main strip. Aside from not feeling as safe - I noticed a large number of vagrants, homless people and drunks in the "freemont street" area. The whole area around the Four Queens also had a strange earieness to it - like an old vintage carnival horror movie with run down buildings, blinking ligts that stopped working decades ago and the heavy stench of dank cigars. Overall - it's certainly a memorable experience staying at the Four Queens. From my experience - you'll be treated well by the staff and you won't be disappointed by your room - but it might be worth spending a few extra bucks to stay at a classier, safer place.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: lilgto
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed, the rooms were very nice and comfortable beds. A little noisy, but enjoyed overlooking Fremont Street. We will stay here again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay For The Money”
Reviews.Author: majicgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec. 20 thru Dec. 26th, 2007......My room, in South Tower, 9th floor, was great.....clean and a wonderful bed.....I had a bad experience, passed out from my diebetes low blood sugar and daughter found me on the floor and the maid to the security were fast to get an ambulance there to help me and get me to the hospital Christmas day......they were so caring and helpful.......the restaurant food was very good and the slot machines were loose...........the ice show out on the street was marvelous....I had a great time there and hope to get a good deal so can stay there again in middle of June. Delia JoAn Niedecken

Reviews.Title: “four queens is a great downtown vegas value”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: my wife and i and my parents just returned from a two day trip to vegas and stayed at the four queens in downtown - payed $30 a nite mid week and the room and food was fine and location perfect in the middle of freemont street. No problems

Reviews.Title: “One night only,but would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: pete707
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i only stayed here for one night before flying back home the following day. After driving here from LA me and a friend were pretty tired so we were over the moon that check-in was nice and easy. Because we were going home early the next day we didn't really explore the hotel but what we saw we were impressed. Our rooms were excellent,lovely beds,Flat screen tv,desk and the bathroom was fine. The rates everywhere else in Vegas for one night was a little expensive (must have been a convention in town) but the 4 Queens was very cheap. Can't wait to go back and explore the hotel properly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fishgirl1
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas for me (coming from New Zealand it took us about 20 hours to get there so it isn't something we can do every year!). Husband has been before and he thought Downtown would be great so we spent our first 3 days here from 8 to 11 November. Check-in was fast - no queue at 7pm. Room was fine - not overly huge and a little bit scruffy but nothing the price didn't allow for (our rate was around $60). Casino is really smoky but they have a great choice of machines - not particularly lucky for us. Cocktail waitresses were pretty reliable (not as regular as at La Bayou down the road but they would be without equal!!!). Stupidly dropped my wallet (complete with all my credit cards) on my first night - didn't even know it was missing until Security rang us at 4am to say it had been handed in. A big Thank-you to the porter who handed it in. Were up so early we caught breakfast at 5am and saw Freemont Street without a soul on it - unbelievable! Breakfast at Magnolia was lovely - ate there every morning. Dinner we ate at other casinos - different each night. We moved from Four Queens to Orleans then on to Ballys and Harrahs - Four Queens measured up well against all of them (except the free upgrade to a suite at Bally, needless to say). Our only gripe was the ladies at the Players Card desk should have a bit of an idea about how many points you need to earn before you get any comps - when I asked they told me to go see a host - waited for ages just to be made to feel like a bit of a fool for asking (seems 300-400 points per day are what they are after). I could have been saved the trouble and embarrasment. Still, didn't spoil the stay - would happily go back

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Four Queens Nov 11th thru Nov 14th”
Reviews.Author: ALBIEOFNY
Reviews.Content: When I booked my trip for November I decided to try downtown for once. I read all the reviews on the downtown hotels and the most consistent recommendations kept coming from the reviews on the Four Queens Hotel. After staying there, I must agree with the reviews. The Four Queens is a great hotel. I arrived before 12:00 pm and was able to check in as my room was available. The desk clerk was fast and very friendly. (I usually stay at the Strat and the lines to check in are horrendous). They give you a fun book that has some really good two for one coupons. My room elevators was right off of the lobby area which I found to be very convenient being that you didn't have to walk the entire length of the Casino to get to your room. I give the Four Queens high points for that alone. I was given a room on the 15th floor room 1525. Upon arriving in my room the first thing I noticed was the spaciousness of the room. Two queen beds, flat screen tv and desk.When I entered the bathroom I noticed a handicap chair and bars. They had given me a handicap room. The bathroom was very spacious also. I had asked for a room not facing the Fremont St Exp. but when I looked down I could see the side of the canopy. Although I could hear the music when it started on the hour it was very muted so did not really bother me. My views was mostly of the Golden Nugget and not the mountains in which I am particularly fond of. I found the dining choices at the Four Queens to be a little bit lacking as they have no buffet. Magnolia's is an excellent choice but can get a little crowded around the dinner hour. You have to pick your times to eat there. usually late morning and evening works best. This is a non problem as the Fremont's buffet is directly across the street and on Sundays they have an all day champagne brunch/buffet. There are so many food choices within walking distance of the Four Queens that I never ate at the same place twice. I loved the proximity of the other establishments. I also loved the whole atmosphere of downtown and the entertainment. The Four Queens casino has a good selection of slot machines and they seemed to give you a nice chance of winning. The drink service was quite good also. I overall felt very comfortable gambling in their casino it never felt overcrowded and the people were friendly. I would highly recommend anyone staying downtown and looking for a good budget friendly hotel stay at the Four Queens. I forgot to mention the maid service was also quite good. My room was made up early and plenty of towels were available.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice downtown”
Reviews.Author: mistaktraveler
Reviews.Content: Third time in Vegas- first time staying downtown. I really liked the Fremont Street pedestrian mall and Four Queens is right on it. And the bus down to the strip is clean and cheap and easy so we could go there when we wanted and get just a bit away from the masses when we were ready for that. Room price was very good and my room was upgraded and was clean and neat and comfortable. Definitely on the list for when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: IB-Trippin
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the South Tower, and it was very nice. We cannot vouch for the North Tower, but our room was very clean, and had been recently remodeled. It had new carpeting, curtains, (I think beds), and the bathroom fixtures were all working. My priorities start with "Clean and Secure", and our room rated "excellent!" on both counts. We didn't win much in the casino, actually had better luck at Binion's, but that is not a fair assessment of the hotel because we are not big spenders anyway. Dined at Magnolia's one time, it was good. We noticed there were always long lines for breakfast. It is either real good or real slow. We will be going back to the Four Queens next time because we had a very nice stay for an excellent rate, (I think it was about $60.00 per night.) There are so many places to eat and play on Fremont Street, we only dined at the same place more than once in one restaurant. Try Mickey Finnz. (But that's another review.)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Jigsnwigs
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just returned home to Michigan from our best Vegas trip ever! Stayed at the 4 Queens, Downtown. After countless trips making the rounds (Boyd properties, Fitz, Plaza, Vegas Club, Binion's, even splurging for the Golden Nugget) I feel this is the best deal downtown. We checked in on Monday for a four night stay. Check-in staff were friendly and helpful. My husband asked if a suite upgrade would be possible. Yes, we got one for double the room rate we were being charged. It looked exactly like the mini suite in the pic on the website. The armoire has plenty of room on each side of the tv to hide your dirty clothes. :-P It's hard to see in the picture, but there's a fridge with an ice bucket and wine glasses next to the desk and chair. We were on the second floor, but back from the road. I could barely hear the Fremont Street Experience the rare times I was in the room during the evening. We lucked into seeing the Firemen's Combat Challenge World Competition. They were competing right outside the casino. The casino has a half-price ticket outlet. We recommend seeing Larry G. Jones. We saw him back when he did 1001 voices and he was terrific! Thoroughly entertaining. I think he's up to 1003 voices now. We wanted to see him this trip, but he only works weekends now. Good to see him moving up. The 4 Queen's casino personnel are very friendly. My husband played the single deck blackjack until they very politely told him to stop. I played the black jack switch and a new game called California Draw. I don't imagine it will last if everyone is as lucky as I was when Dezdemona taught me the game. She showed me how much trips, two-pair, and even a straight flush paid. I can't wait to go back and try my luck again. The Casino Cage is being remodeled. They were squeezed into a small spot by the restrooms. I never saw less then three cashiers working and never waited in line. Noel was very friendly when he gave me my big winnings from the CA Draw game. We ate at Magnolia's several times. The staff were very smiley and friendly. Wanted to try Hugo's, but too pricey for me. Hubby wanted the $40 rack of lamb. Maybe next time. Even leaving out the fact that I experienced my luckiest night gambling here, I think the Four Queens is the best deal downtown. The suite was clean and roomy. The staff are friendly and helpful. And, the location can't be beat. We were in the tower farther from Fremont St, but were still only steps away from the casino and the action outside on the street.

Reviews.Title: “first time at the four queens”
Reviews.Author: froggyj247
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the four queens nov 1st thru the 4th and this being my first time downtown I was very surprised how nice it was. We usually stay on the strip and now will be going downtown from now on. We had room 1845 18th floor over looking the fremont street experience.Room was very nice had a flat screen tv and a coffee maker which came in handy after a night on fremont.We never had any real issues with the noise as others had said . Maybe we were far enough up but it did not really bother us .It was cool to look down at night and see the show. Fremont street-- This was the most fun I have had in vegas so far and I've been on the strip 3 times before this trip.Loved all the things there are to see and do here and you did not have to walk 1 mile to get 1 block like on the strip you know what I meen if you've been on the strip before .everything is within about a five minute walk up or down fremont.There are a few other hotels off of fremont like the main street station and gold spike. which are not that far to walk to food--- We ate at the mainstreet station buffet for lunch. with the 2for1 coupon we had only cost us 4 bucks each and it was very good. Also ate at aloha specialties in the upstairs of the hotel across from mainstreet station and that was fantastic and super cheap.Dont let the location or its appearance fool you its very good.Try the fish,chicken,steak combo yummy. entertainment--- We usually watched the free shows out on the fremont street. they had concerts and a U.S championship firemans competition when we were there.Also saw vanessa carlton at the four queens for like 20 bucks what a deal very good show. feel free to email me with questions on fremont street

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise, Noise 24/7”
Reviews.Author: Peri
Reviews.Content: Check in was very easy, parking garage with valet parking. and nice clean small rooms but I will not be able to ever stay there again. We were on the 17th floor facing Fremont street and there was music going 24/7 we had attempted to go to bed around 2 am but found out the first night that it was going to be harder than we thought. I would say we maybe got 1 hour sleep the first night and the next night we left the television on to help drown out the music and got about 4 hours sleep.
