(Mind you I am the one who is able to sleep through tornados). I dont think the music came from the four queens but unfortunately it does affect the patrons. I can only think that this noise is as bothersome to all the other hotel guests all the way down Fremont Street. If you plan on staying and want at least some rest make sure you ask for a room facing away from Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gracey1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice place to stay overall. The cleaning service was a bit slow and the people were not nice but it wasn't bad considering you're hardly in your room anyway. I would recommend any first timers to Las Vegas to stay on the old strip because it's not so overwhelming. Plus the light show was an awesome treat. I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl007_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Queens in the North Tower. The rooms were very clean and have been remodeled with flat screen TV's. We had no problem with the room, just the location. We figured the 19th floor would get us far enough away from the Fremont street experience. We were wrong. The show stops at a decent time, but the music goes on ALL NIGHT LONG. The bass could be heard over our noise maker and the TV we turned on in self defense. I don't know if this is just a Four Queens problem or a downtown problem. Why in the world would you play music at the decimal level able to rattle windows 24 hours a day? Even in the city of fun, you must sleep sometime.

Reviews.Title: “magnolia's restaurant/ four queens hotel”
Reviews.Author: redrookie
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Four Queens wanting to try the Fremont Experience. Overall the Four Queens was what we expected, the visit was pleasant and we had a great time in the casino, winning enough to keep playing. The rooms were small but we really weren't in the room expect to sleep. The visit would have been great however the 2 visits to Magnolias restuarant left a very bad taste. We first tried Magnolias at night, thinking we would get something and take to our room late one evening. We were seated and waited for about 5 minutes, the a waiter came out to take our order we informed him we wanted it to go, he promptly left our table without saying anything else. We waited for about 5 more minutes just about ready to leave another waiter came to our table to take our order, he took the order and then promptly told us to move from the table and move to a bench and wait. Not what I call customer service. We dined at the Fremont the next morning, and the Golden Nuggett at night. On the third morning we decided to try Magnolia's again for breakfast. The restaurant was not busy, however, we stood in line and waited to be seated. It was apparent the there wasn't a bit of sense of urgency present at all. Finally, we were seated, the service was much to be desired, my girlfriend and I both order the pancake special and requested more syrup however we never received it. Our husbands enjoyed the food, we would have too if able to eat our entire meal. The reason I write this is that I have over 25 years experience in the restuarant industry and I suggest you send someone into Magnolia's as a customer and let them observe the body language of your customers and their reaction to the service they receive. You have a little gold mine here and it full potential is not being achieved. Patty Burns dandpburns@netzero.com

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but avoid the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: natto-rice
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is nice. The casino has a wide-range of table and machine games. The restaurants are good and the service is friendly. The biggest gripe that I have is the hotel didn't warn me when I checked in that my room overlooked the Fremont Experience. I stayed out until late so I missed the loud shows from the Experience. But what I didn't anticipate was the music that's played through the speakers doesn't stop. So all through the night I heard the booming bass and the rest of the music. The hotel should advise guests that their room faces the Fremont Experience and that if they wanted to get some peace and quiet then they should ask for a different room. Since I don't think that this will happen, avoid the rooms in the hotel's North Tower, especially the rooms that face the Experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Stay”
Reviews.Author: snuqueen
Reviews.Content: We were heading to Vegas to meet my brother and his adult kids for a reunion. They were staying at the Nugget and had booked way earlier than we did. We tried to stay at the Nugget, but we didn't want to pay >$200 a day. So, we chose the Queens. Check in was fine...no problems, but not that friendly either. Room was fine. You can tell it is old and has been remodeled many times. That's what you get when you choose to stay Downtown! TV was great, bed was confortable, bathroom and shower was fine...isn't that all you need! Did not really gamble there. My favorites are across the street. Spent a lot of time at Fremont and the Shoe (Binions Horseshoe). Try the Binions Steak House...better than Hugos. Ate breakfast at Magnolia's. Service was extremely slow but food is always good. I think there is a shortage of lower end restaurant servers in LV. IMHO.......if you expect luxury and stellar service, stay on the strip. Downtown works for those of us who prefer a less pretenious experience. I would definately stay at the Four Queens again. Why spend money on lodging when you aren't in the room very much????

Reviews.Title: “1st time Downtowner and LOVED it......”
Reviews.Author: DeboTexas
Reviews.Content: 1st time to stay downtown and Four Queens made it perfect. The staff is very friendly and the dealers are sweethearts. The room is nothing fancy but clean. The walls are thin but I brought earplugs so no problem. It is great to walk right outside one casino and right into another one. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: Bisbeebee
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Four Queens Hotel in downtown Las Vegas in September. Hadn't stayed there for a long time, and we were really surprised at how nice a hotel it is now, compared to our previous visit. The rooms are not real big but have been redecorated , new furniture and LCD TV, and the beds were just super. Also had a coffee maker! Only problem was the small size of the bathroom, with a very noisy vent fan, but clean and adequate. ( We stayed in the tower with the elevators off the lobby, so all comments refer to that tower.). Enough elevators so you could move up and down pretty quickly. Food was good, particularly the specials at Magnolia's (take your slot card and get a discount.) And of course, the location is just right there in the thick of things. It is a busy place, but all the personnel in the casino and the hotel were very friendly and helpful..... We will return..

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying downtown and chose the 4 Queens for the great reviews it gets on this site. Booked a room for 2 nights. Check-in was quick and friendly and was given a North Tower room. I had heard that the South Tower was nicer but the desk clerk told me that they all had been renovated and the South Tower were all smoking rooms. Thought that to be strange, a whole tower dedicated to smoking rooms. The room was small but nicely furnished with a large flat TV which I never watched. The bed was very comfortable but the walls at least in my room were paper thin. Good thing I brought some ear plugs! Impressed with the in-room coffee maker. You don't see these in the strip hotels that charge 4 times the price. Casino was fun and the dealers were great. I didn't get to eat there because there was always a line at Magnolias but as an alternative I ate at the Bay City Diner and the cafe at the California. Parking gargage is very convenient. Downtown is a great alternative to the strip. Highly recommend the 4 Queens.

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: travel_trekkin
Reviews.Content: All I needed was a low priced hotel, a shower, bed, and tv and thats exactly what I got at the Four Queens. The room was nice and clean. The location couldn't be any better plus going to and from the strip is a breeze by catching The Duece about a block away (make sure you get the $5 pass that last for 24 hrs.) and I was able to check in about an hour earlier than scheduled. If you don't plan on spending too much time in your room and just need the basics the Four Queens should do.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: mfinn
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a eight day trip staying at three different properties while in town over the Labor Day holiday. This was our first time staying at this hotel, so we were anxious to see what it would be like since we had heard it was recently refurbished. We booked our room over the phone with a casino rate based on our play from our previous visit in May. We did not receive a mail offer and had to call to ask for the casino rate. Check in was very easy with no line at all. The front desk clerk was very cordial and made the experience very pleasant. Our room was in the south tower, room 1033 for four nights. We had a king, n/s room. The accommodations were nice, with new fixtures, beds and a smaller plasma television. They missed a few things when refurbishing this hotel, though. The shower curtain was old and in desperate need of replacement. There was a smashed spider stuck to the outside of it that looked like it had been there for a while. The air conditioner/heater unit and controller were disgusting and the smoke alarm also needs to be replaced (see photos). I don't get how they could spend so much on updating the rooms and forget the details. We didn't notice a work-out room or a swimming pool while we were there, so those are definitely negatives if those amenities are important to you. My sister and her family stayed at the Golden Nugget, so I went down to visit them at the pool while we were there. We stayed at the GN on our last trip to Vegas, and it was very nice. My in-laws had four free nights at the Plaza and were there for a slot tournament, so we had the room to ourselves. The location of the Four Queens is great since you are smack dab, right in the middle of things on Fremont Street. There is a McDonalds right across the street and a Walgreens within walking distance. We ate at Magnolia's, which is in the hotel, with a buy-one, get-one free coupon from the American Casino Guide (buy on the web or at book stores $14.95-well worth it!). The prime rib was excellent and very reasonable. I would highly recommend this restaurant. We did spend some time in the casino and when we went to the slot club to ask if we had any comps or cash coming back, the slot club attendants were VERY rude. They could really benefit from some basic customer service training. We noticed this on our last visit, and again on this visit. My father-in-law also commented on how rude they were to both he and my mother-in-law. Even though they missed a few things when updating the rooms and the slot club attendants were rude, we will definitely stay at this hotel again since the bed was comfortable and the location is good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend as long as they were not looking for a total resort type of hotel since theres no pool, spa or work-out facility on site. Please feel free to ask any questions regarding our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: froggy8997
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Four Queens Sept 13-16th. We have never stayed Downtown before and thought we would give it a try. For a great price we figured how bad could it be? FQ exceeded our expectations!! CHECK IN: The front desk check in was wonderful.... no wait...friendly..and they honored all of our requests. I had asked for a King bed, non smoking, facing the Fremont street side of the hotel. ROOMS: We received a room on the fifth floor (518). We loved facing the Fremont Street Experience it was great! The Four Queens is one of the only hotels downtown that actually has rooms under the "canopy" facing Fremont Street. We could watch the light show right from our room! (people watching was great too!) The even numbered rooms face fremont street. There was some noise from the light show and they play music all day long. It stops at Midnight. No big deal! We kind of enjoyed the music. CASINO The Casino was good. We saw many other people winning! We didn't!! PARKING Parking was easy. We self parked our car, but they had Valet also. On Saturday night they allowed us VIP PARKING even though the sign said the lot was full. NO POOL The FQ doesn't have a pool, but honestly...we were so busy, we didn't miss not having it. RESTAURANTS We ate at Magnolias twice, the food was average, cheap enough, the wait staff left a little to be desired, we had a little language barrier problem with the girl that got the drinks in the restaurant, but the server was average...... Overall it was AVERAGE!! DOWNTOWN AREA The Downtown area has honestly been revitalized. They have so much to offer. There was a Ariel performance, a Motorcycle stunt show, a stage with a variety of performers, plenty of Kiosks selling gifts and snacks. In the evening they brought out rolling bars selling adult beverages. It seemed like a big happy, party, with a fun atmosphere. I will say the FQ is not a Luxury Property, But they don't charge a Luxury price! It fit our needs and I would recommend it to people that are looking for a clean, nice, friendly hotel in downtown...... We have stayed at Flamingo, Harrahs, Monte Carlo,Luxor, and Palace Station. Just to give an idea of what we are comparing past stays to. The Four Queens is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “First class budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dia3864
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens is a great budget hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated in the Downtown area and leads directly onto the Freemont street experience (sound and light show). The hotel is clean and the rooms are well decorated and have recently been refurnished, including flat screen tv's, the beds are very comfortable! We joined the players club (free to join- get a free t shirt) and got great meal deals in the Magnolia resteraunt, situated in the casino, I can recommend the salads- enormous and delicious. We will definately return!! Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: judyj15
Reviews.Content: Returned 13 Sept from a three night stay at the 4 Queens. Traveled with my sister and a friend. It was my friend's first time in Vegas and my sister had not been there in about 15 years. We all enjoyed the 4 Queens. The check in staff was great. We arrived early and our room was ready, but it was on the 2nd floor so I asked for something higher up since my friend had never been to Vegas and I wanted her to be able to see the strip from our room. There was no problem, we only had to wait for a couple of hours before it was ready. The food at Magnolias is very good and the prices are great. Only encountered one problem. We had a very rude waiter one night. Not only was he rude to us, but heard him being rude to other people around us as well. The rooms are very nice and the mattress is very comfortable. There were three of us in the room and had to ask for extra towels, again with no problem. Our room was room 1842 in the south tower. It overlooked the mountains and the strip. Would stay at the 4 Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Stay in Downtown LV”
Reviews.Author: p_jay2001
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday (Fri., Sept. 7) from a stay at the Four Queens. Stayed in room 801 in the north tower, facing south away from the FSE. The room was nicely remodeled, with new furnishings, including a wide screen flat TV. It seemed to be a little larger than the rooms at the Fremont across the street, and a little smaller than the rooms at Fitzgeralds next door. The bathroom was clean and bright, no mold or stains in sight. Again larger than Fremonts, smaller than Fitzgeralds. Typical motel/hotel bathroom. Valet parking was quick an easy. Every employee encounterd was pleasent and helpful. This was my third stay at the 4Q's in the last 3 years, and I would certainly stay there again. The 4Q's (along with the Fremont and Fitzgeralds) is a solid, dependable value stay in downtown LV. A little play on their slot card will bring free and discounted room offers, but even the standard online rates are very reasonable. I was only staying one night, solo this time, so I did not try it this time, but in the past the $20 trick has gotten us a "free" upgrade to a petite suite. Magnolias Cafe and Hugo's are good casual and upscale dining choices. Had a bad experiance at the Chicago Pizza and Pub one time, but it may have just been a bad night.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise this hotel turned out to be!”
Reviews.Author: Wishin2travel
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated/remodeled rooms. Nice casino. This hotel is right at the center of the Fremont Street Experience (canopy light show.) All the amenities that are normal in non-casino hotels were in our room: Really comfortable beds, hairdryer, iron/board, COFFEE maker IN ROOM (unheard of in any other casino hotel I've ever stayed in.) Big flat screen TV. We called for extra pillows and they were delivered within less than five minutes. We stayed on weekday nights and at $30 per night had a better room than we've sometimes had at double or triple that rate. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best in 7 trips”
Reviews.Author: Marcel19
Reviews.Content: My father-in-law and myself are from Canada and we checked in Aug 24th to Aug 31st/07. Our first contact was the Valet Parking which was immediate. Actual check in only took moments and the room in the South Tower was very clean, spacious and well equiped with amenities. All staff we encountered during the week were courteous and helpful. The slot machines were generou as I hit 2 jackpots for which tax was withheld and 3 at $1175.00. After the first meal the staff in the restaurant Magnolia's remember us and with the food being so good and prices reasonable 90% of our meals were eaten there. I could continue on with compliments however I just want everyone to know after staying at 3 other hotels on the strip at much higher rates the Queens will be my Hotel of choice for future stays. Marcel Binette Thunder Bay, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Woderful Time, Better than the Strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: goatboy326
Reviews.Content: Two Friends and I recently stayed at the Four Queens for two nights on our Vacation to Las Vegas. We all work in retail and have very tight budgets to go on, so Price was a big concern for us which is we chose to stay downtown for two nights and on the Strip for two Nights. The Four Queens had some of the nicest rooms i have seen in Las Vegas (remember we aren't wealthy and can't afford over $50/night so the comparison is based on rooms under $50/night in Vegas) The hotel staff was very kind and helpful and acted like they actually cared! :-) All of our "Special Requests" were honored (adjoining Rooms, Non-Smoking, one with two queen beds and one with one king bed) We were on the 11th floor and the elevators worked great, not slow at all. I was afraid to stay downtown based on all the "Negative" reviews posted about how shady it is and how gross and disgusting the hotels and casinos are, But we had a blast, this was the funnest trip I have had yet, the only bad part about this trip was when we checked out and moved to the Imperial Palace on the Strip (Please read my review for that one) I can honestly say that we all had more fun downtown then we did on the strip and we spent a lot less time walking and a lot less money downtown than on the strip. I am planning on taking a birthday get-a-away in december and plan on staying at the FQ again!

Reviews.Title: “always the best in town!”
Reviews.Author: tamsterdee
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Queens, they have the best sevice and the most helpful staff in all of Vegas, my casino host (Brain) makes sure my stay there is always great! he is awesome!!!!!! thank you again! Tammy M.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Pages2
Reviews.Content: Aug 21 2007 - My husband and I went for a spontaneous weekend and had a fantastic time once again at the Four Queens. We have stayed here 3-5 times over the past year and have enjoyed every visit - The staff always make you feel welcome, check in is a breeze, Casino Hosts are awesome, Magnolias is great - food is good old fashioned cooking and the staff are very friendly. Can't beat the prices either. Rooms have been renovated and they are bright and clean - felt very comfortable in the room . For the most part we do o,k. on the slots here and this visit was no different other than I had a little too much liquid courage and so consequently felt a little braver than usual which I highly don't recommentd. Overall though a pretty great long weekend and we are already planniing on our next visit to Vegas and will most likely stay at the Four Queens again unless we decide to go to the Strip. Usually stay at the Golden Nugget but since reno's and new owners definetly not impressed anymore. Fremont Street is great if you don't want to do alot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service and A Great Coffee Shop! (Magnolia's)”
Reviews.Author: sanspeur15
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night a week ago today (8/11) and have stayed here over the years and find this Casino Hotel to have GREAT value! The front desk was very friendly, the room was clean (Rm 1211 North Tower), and had a view of the Golden Nugget and downtown... The mattress was extremely comfortable and clean, fresh sheets. The only problem was understanding how the bathtub drained, but that was rectified by the maintenance man who was there in less than 20 minutes. The Magnolia had outstanding service and served huge portions of freshly cooked entrees at very reasonable, working-man's prices. Everything was good! I missed going to the beer bar where they offer shrimp, oh well there's always next time! I encourage anyone to stay here because the 4 Queens offers great value, and you can walk or take a cab to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: almadelpueblo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens Aug. 7-11. We arrived early Tuesday morning but were able to get an early check-in. The personnel were very courteous and helpful and housekeeping did a wonderful job. Our room was small but comfortable and impeccably clean. We were given room 519 in the North Tower. Even though it did not have a good view, the elevator would take us straight to the casino and was close to the exit to the Fremont Street Experience. Fremont street beats the hustle and bustle of the strip and one doesn't have to do much walking to get from one casino to another. We enjoyed our stay at the Four Queens.

Reviews.Title: “All bets on 4 Queens”
Reviews.Author: Drumscott
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at the 4 Queens Hotel and Casino. The rooms had been recently renovated complete with 32" LCD TV. We stayed in a smoking room, which did not have the lingering scents of cigarettes most smoking rooms tend to have. The room was clean and the staff were very helpful. Check in went smooth and quick as we arrived on a Monday evening around 9pm. Although there are several restaurants on the property, we only dined at Magnolia's. It over looks the casino floor and has geat deals on Prime Rib $8.99 or a doulbe cheese burger for $5.95 for those who join the Players Club. The food was great with good sized portions. Food is much less expensive downtown than on the strip. We enjoyed the $9.99 lunch Buffet at the Golden Nugget , the $2.99 Big Shrimp Cocktail at the Golden Gate, and the Paradise Seafood Lunch Buffet for $17.99 at The Fremont Hotel. The Nugget's buffet was very good. However, if you like King Crab Legs go to the Paradise Buffet, they serve them cracked and chilled every Tuesday , Thursday and Friday. We also have to make mention of a secluded little downtown jewel; Mamacita's Mexican Restaurant is tucked in a row of sun bleached buildings on (611)East Fremont just 2 blocks east of the Fremont experiance. On our last night in town we decided to venture on the east end of Fremont st. We was a sign that said Mex Food and being a true gambler took a chance and came out a winner on this great little mexican place. The burrito was delicious and a big as the platter. A cuban sandwich made with real pork roast. On the strip we ate at the The Village Buffet at Paris. It was &15.99 for lunch and worth every penny if you like a great variety of french cuisine ...Desserts and cheeses to die for!!!! Gambler's Note: 4 Queen's Roulette tables have $2 min ..the lowest in downtown or on the strip!!!! VIVA LAS VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: caper2
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Vegas for a private weekend concert/party at Hooters, but after that event we stayed another 3 days. We prefer to stay in the downtown area rather than the being a part of the hustle and bustle of the strip. We found a great internet room rate at 4-Queens. After many years of coming to Vegas, I always thought of 4-Queens as an old run-down hotel, but was quite pleasantly surprised. The lobby and rooms had been completely refurbished with new furniture, flat screen TV, and very clean. The staff was friendly, the Bellman was very accommodating, the front desk personnel (while not smiling), did let us check in early. The casino has modern machines and adequate tables for gaming. There were lots of machines to cash tickets so no waiting in line. The food at Magnolia's was very good for the price and very generous portions. If you present your Players Card, you get an additional discount. Would definitely stay at 4-Queens again!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was burglarized, and I'm sure it was an inside job.”
Reviews.Author: JimAtLaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some friends at the 4 Queens. While there, our room was burglarized, and items stolen included a brand new laptop, new model BlackBerry, expensive sunglasses, and other items. It's a long story, but the pattern of what was taken and what was not taken led us to believe very strongly that it was an inside job, and that our room was actually cased the day before the burglary to prepare for the theft. Afterward, the hotel could not possibly have been less responsive or considerate - they did not even offer us a discount on the room (actually, I can't even recall an apology), and as far as we can tell, performed no investigation whatsoever regarding the theft - their only communication was to say they were not responsible, and I never even got so much as a follow up call from the manager or anyone else. Even if you didn't think it was an inside job, what does it say about the place that the hotel does not even care enough to follow up, let alone offer a discount or anything else you might expect, when people have thousands of dollars of goods stolen out of a locked room? If you value your possessions in the least, or decent customer service, I would strenuously advise against ever staying at the 4 Queens for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Try The Four Queens!”
Reviews.Author: deltadwn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens July 17 & 18th in the South Tower. My parents stayed in an adjoining room. Our rooms were 545 & 547, both non-smoking with two beds per room. My 80-yr-old mother has stayed in the FQ about five times over the years, and the last time was 10 years ago. She has always said how she loves the Four Queens! After reading the reviews here, I was apprehensive about the quality of the rooms, and the hotel as a whole. I didn’t know what to expect, since everyone’s idea of quality is so varied. I myself tend to be somewhat picky. Since my parents wanted to stay at the FQ because “that’s where we’ve always stayed”, I agreed to stay there. I can say with all honesty - I am so glad that I did! Our rooms were more than reasonably priced. The rooms were very clean and sparkling. I saw nothing dirty about anything that I used or looked at. Yes, it is an older-type hotel and rooms, but it is elegant too. The place has ‘personality’. I wasn’t exceptionally impressed with the registration desk clerks. They were not rude, but they were non-smiling, unfriendly and aloof. And it wasn’t that busy at the FQ during the week. Also during check-out, our desk clerk did not even mention that if we had a Player’s Club card (we did), that we should check with the Player’s Club Host to see if we may be able to comp our rooms (we were able to comp both nights and had a free stay at FQ). Had I not read it at this website, I would not have known to do it. The room had a new flat-screen T.V., which I only watched a little. The air conditioner kicked ‘tailfeathers’ and kept the room cool since it was 114 degrees outside. Our rooms looked out over the hotel canopy and partially over the Fremont Experience. Music started around 8 p.m. and stopped at 12 a.m. Who the heck is in their room sleeping at Midnight while visiting Las Vegas anyway? Take handy-dandy foam earplugs with you if you have a doubt. The casino was active and nice and had plenty of modern, fun slot machines, and was comparable to other casinos as far as variety and pay-offs. We ate at Magnolia’s Restaurant, and to me – the food was just ‘so-so’. I wish we’d ventured out to places to eat outside of FQ, but didn’t to save time. We did not try Hugo’s Cellar. Acting on the advice of other reviewers, I tried the Deuce (double-decker bus) to travel from the FQ in Old Vegas to The Strip. There is a lot more to traveling that way than meets the eye. Reviewers had described it as a convenient way to get around. I did not find that to be true. As a not-so-physically-fit 50-Something, to have to walk the distance from the FQ to the Deuce depot to catch the bus in the blazing heat of the late morning was almost unbearable. It was much further than described by an FQ employee. Once I arrived, I had to stand in a long line of others waiting to board in the heat. I was so glad that my mother had decided not to join me, as she would not have been able to withstand it. I did buy the $5 all day pass as I wanted to visit various places along the Strip. It is $2 each time you board if you don’t have the pass. The Deuce was cramped, crowded and slow. From the beginning boarding, to the final boarding, and the times in-between, it was the same. The seats were all full and people were standing in the aisles jammed together like sardines as the Deuce inched its way along the strip. Folks, this was during a weekday! One time I was standing at one of the stops to board, and there were so many people waiting to board, the bus stopped and took on about 4 people and pulled off. The remainder of us had to wait in the heat until the next bus came along and there was pushing and shoving to get on the next one. My return trip back to the Four Queens from MGM Grand took at least an hour. The only other option is to take a taxi. I believe if I go to Vegas again, I may opt for the taxi. The Four Queens may not be a 5-Star hotel like some of the newer ones, but it is certainly worth more than the charge to stay there. If I get the chance to go to Vegas again, I would definitely stay at the FQ. So should you. You won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: vegascrazy96761
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Four Queens from July 9th thru the 12th. This was one of the hotels I had never stayed at. We loved it! The first room we had overlooked the Freemont Street experience but only had one bed. We needed 2. Fron t desk switched us with no problem to a different room. They are all recently remodled very clean and quiet. We had room service the next day and service was very quick. They have a ton of different games and the food at Magnolias was excellent for under 7.00 with your club card. My parents drove up from Ca. I can never get them away from the strip and the Flamingo. They enjoyed downtown and the Four queens much better and they will stay there next time. We moved to the vegas club for the next 3 nights because of free room offer. Not that I dont like Vegas Club but it was a big mistake. Should have stayed at Four Queens since it was only 32.00 a night. What a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Way, Way better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: 404atlgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Four Queens July 13th -15th. It was our first time in Vegas and we enjoyed every moment. Checkin was so easy...no lines or waiting. The desk clerk was very accomodating when I requested to be as high up as possible. Neither one of us smoke so we had some hesitation when she said she had a smoking room on the top floor but we took the chance and accepted the room she offered ( room 1960 ). Amazingly the room didnt have a strong smoke odor at all, actually we didnt smell anything! And the view was such a pleasant surprise, a beautiful view of The Strip and mountains!!!! We had plenty of towels, the room was clean and cold considering it was 108 degrees outside.We ordered room service the next morning, they were so nice and pleasant as well as quick. We had a hot delicious breakfast at our room in about 15 minutes after we hung up the phone. The staff in the gift shop were also soooooo nice. The location was great not nearly as crowded as The Strip. The bus service called 'The Duce' was right on the corner and the day pass is the way to go if you want to visit The Strip. I would recommened Four Queens to everyone I know and ill make it my only choice for my future visits to Vegas BABY!!!

Reviews.Title: “worth the visit to downtown freemont street”
Reviews.Author: man_from_Brum
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel that we stayed in on trip to las vegas,to start with i was very impressed with the room it was comfortable and clean it included a 32" lcd tv (that we didnt use)all in all a great hotel for the price ($38) the only thing was the view that we had , it looked over the top of the freemont street canopy and it did look a mess it did'nt matter because we only used the room to sleep.tanyway the staff were friendlier than the strip ones and very helpful. I do recommend trying freemont street if you are visiting las vegas if only to spend a day there

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: justmewonderinginyuma
Reviews.Content: As first I was hesitate to stay here. I wanted to visit the area but wasn't sure I wanted to stay in the area. I was happy that I did, in more ways than one. The lights of the place are obviously exciting. The registration desk is very nice. The people were very friendly and eager to help. The room was nice, upgraded tv although we didn't watch it much. The bathroom is small. You have to close the bathroom door before you sit on the toilet! It was clean and well maintained. The casino is small, but I won a good chunk of money there! The buffet across the street at the Fremont is to die for. Walk out the front and the Fremont Street Experience awaits you at dusk until midnight. Lots of street fun going on too. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars for the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Ely240
Reviews.Content: Booked the Four Queens through Allegiant, on a last minute impulse trip. I was traveling with my father, thought the downtown area was a easier walk for him, since it was very hot. I was pleasantly pleased with the property. The check in was effortless, no wait, great customer service. We were given a room on the 1st floor. Room 145. It was a smoking room, but you could not tell at all. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The maid left us extra pillows and coffee at our request. No room safe, but we managed without one. The bathroom was clean and worked for the two of us. Join the players club and take advantage of discounted food in Magnolias. We had Pizza at the Chicago Brew Pub, it was excellent. I would stay at the Four Queens again, in a heart beat. We usually stay at the Golden Nugget, but the Queens had more comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fine room; bargain price; nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: When choosing a hotel in Las Vegas, it's important to consider what is important to you. If, for instance, you are not satisfied unless your bathroom is huge, made of marble, and equipped with a phone by the toilet, then don't stay at Four Queens. Similarly, don't stay there if you need 25000 thread count sheets and beds that are fit for Diamond Jim Brady. If that stuff is more your style, run, don't walk, to places like Bellagio, THE Hotel, and The Venetian. And bring a great deal of cash and your best posing clothes while you're at it. If, however, you are looking for a clean, abeit small room to lay your head for a couple of nights, and don't mind staying Downtown as opposed to The Strip, I found Four Queens to be excellent, and a superb value as well. My friend and I had a very good experience, starting with the price, which totaled $200 for three nights, including Friday and Saturday night, when Vegas hotels siphon money at the same rate as Keno. For that $200, we had NO WAIT at check in, and the woman who checked us in was kind, courteous, and even let us check in a couple of hours early. When I visited Paris to gamble the next day, I saw throngs of frustrated tourists waiting to check in...and probably paying triple the price. Yes, the room is fairly small, and yes, the decor is dated. But the room was immaculate, there was a plasma TV, and the bed was fine. Think about it: when you are sleeping, do you really notice how expensive the mattress is? The room was quiet, though to be fair, that may have had as much to do with who our neighbors were as anything else. We had a splendid view of a parking garage, but when in Vegas, the only time I stare out the window is to bemoan my blackjack losses. So for that, a parking garage seems appropriate. None of the noise from the hectic Fremont Street leaked into our room, but then again, that may have had as much to do with our room placement as anything else. The casino was friendly and accommodating, with plenty of cheap tables, even on the weekend. Plus, about 10 other casinos (literally) are within walking distance, and Golden Nugget is right across the street. If you really like to gamble and jump from casino to casino, Downtown has The Strip beat hands down. The crowd certainly is older and more "middle class" than down the road, but again, it's what you value in your Vegas trip. In addition, joining the players' club was a snap, and was given a free deck of cards for doing so, which not one other casino club did. Parking cost $3 a day, which I was more than willing to pay considering what our room cost. To sum: If you want a clean, comfortable room with a very accommodating staff at a bargain rate, Four Queens just might be King of Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: LVFUNTIME
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens June 17th thru June 21st 2007. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. This was our first stay downtown, we saw everything, ate at many places and gambled alot. It was fun, but I think it is back to the strip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Teddrr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to Vegas 3 times a year for ten years. We've always stayed in the Golden Nugget. This year we chose "Four Queens", and we are certainly glad we did! The people are much nicer. The beds were a thousand times more comfortable! We always have small room charges, usually no more than a 100 dollars. The Nuggett has NEVER chosen to comp our room chargers. However, our first stay and the Four Queens, said we'll comp your room charges. We will never stay at the Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “Vincent, the front desk clerk, was great.”
Reviews.Author: Alohajon
Reviews.Content: Vincent is a great desk clerk, who checked us in and is helpful. Enjoyed the food at Magnolia's Veranda. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lionsfan1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens on 5/30-6/01. First off, in Vegas you pretty much get what you pay for. I paid about $500 (for my wife and I) for a flight/room package out of Lansing, MI. We had stayed at this holtel before, and were happy with what we got. Our room was on the 4th floor in the South Tower. We never heard any noises outside, and felt safe the whole time, even though the chain on our door was missing!!. All the rooms have been "remodled", and include newer tables and chairs, and flat screen plasma tvs. The bed was fine, and the room seemed to be pretty decent. The shower and sink both drained ok, although both were in need of some cleaning!! We ate at Magnolias, located in the casino, the first night and had a nice prime rib dinner with all the trimmings. I think our total bill was under $20 for the 2 of us!! Can't beat that!! The casino is good size and 2 people in our party won a good amount of money. One place I recommend visiting downtown is the Main Street Station buffet. They have a filet mignon and shrimp scampi that was to die for!! If you look hard enough you can find 2 for 1 coupons right on Fremont St!!! I would recommend this place for people who like the old part of Vegas and also for people who are on a budget and don't mind rooms that are basically just for sleeping and showering!! One tip about parking at Four Queens, use the Valet, it is so much easier and worth the $2 tip. We had a blast downtown, and look forward to going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: eales87
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out the stay was awsome. We checked in at 7:30PM and sine I am a Diabetic I requested a refigerator for my medicine. We no more got to the room and the refigerator was there. The entire staff was great. The Magnolia was a great restaurant with very reasonable prices. Location Downtown was great. We normally saty at te Golden Nuggett but except for the ladies make up area the room was almost the same. The romms have been remodeled and had a flat screen TV ,new carpet and furniture. We satyed in the South Tower which was right next to the checkin area and casino. We stayed over the Memorial Day weekend and couldn't have been happier. Would definitely stay there again and plan on that on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Can_Cancun
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights on the strip and booked the Four Queens for one night to experience the downtown atmosphere. It was nice to be able to check in early 1pm and check out late noon. Room was clean had 2 comfortable queen size beds, view of the strip and a new tv. Ate at Magnolia's twice and enjoyed both meals. Downtown has a different feel compared to the strip. It was more relaxed and friendlier. It was really nice to be able to walk from hotel to hotel within minutes. We liked the location and the price was $200 less than on the strip, so that was just another bonus. On the downside, we were woken up at 5am as a large drunk group of people tromped down the hallway - so we found the rooms are not particularily sound proof. We would be willing to stay here again, however we prefered the location at Bally's on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: Maggs30
Reviews.Content: We just spent our eight night honeymoon at the Four Queens and loved every minute of it. The rooms in the south tower are very clean and modern. The onsite 24hr restaurant Mangolias was subperb (hint- join the players club to recieve a big discount). I really have nothing bad to say about this wonderful downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times”
Reviews.Author: honetmooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens 5/7 to 5/11 for our honeymoon and would come back again!. We loved the location best of all and enjoyed the great food at Magnolia's. We got a players club card and took advantage of the great discounts on food by using the card. We got a great rate online with an air package. We had a new room in the north tower on the 19th floor which was clean and comfortable. Yes, the bathroom is small but who cares when you've got live music every night outside and the action that is going on in the casino. This hotel is the way old Las Vegas use to be.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last time!”
Reviews.Author: michmi
Reviews.Content: This is the first visit where I had a renovated room. Great job! I generally stay downtown and the Four Queens is the main property I choose because of the location and value. On most trips, I also do most of my gambling at the Four Queens...great selection of table games and slots. I also saw a number of fairly large wins on this trip (not for me, unfortunately). Magnolia's Veranda is still a great cheap coffee shop with good food - you can't go wrong choosing the Four Queens for your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Just got Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bender9876
Reviews.Content: Jot got back this morning. Was there for our Ann. Everything was great. Rooms have been updated. Magnolia,s was very god, great service, food, and you have to get you Player,s Club Card, they offers discounts all the time. Ate at Hugo,s 2 times. The best. Cant belive that anyone would be dissapointed. You must try to stay there. The value is excellent. Nothing fancy, but with the friendly staff and location you cant beat it. Please try.

Reviews.Title: “FOUR QUEENS~WHAT A BARGAIN, WHAT A DEAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: supershe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Queens for four nights (4/29-5/3) and have nothing to say but good things about this hotel. Rooms were recently renovated, new beds, bed coverings, carpets, drapes, tv, with an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, and coffeemaker in each room. Bed slept just wonderful (we had two queens... two ladies travelling together) the registration desk people were wonderful, and check in and check out were fast and pleasant. Magnolia's personnel were friendly, fast, and competent, the housekeeping was impeccable... as were the cage, players club, and gift shop personnel. The casino itself is well set up and attractive, and it has a lot of the up to date slots as well as some of the older ones. I didn't make a bundle at their slots, but... I had a wonderful time, and I saw people hitting good numbers. I just wasn't one of them. AND their prices for the rooms are really a great savings!! I will definitely go back! They have a safety deposit box for you at the front desk too~!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MLwtn
Reviews.Content: First time staying downtown but I got such a good deal on my package with Hotwire it was well worth it. I was in Room 1501 North, King size bed was good and also had a good shower and coffe maker. I did have one breakfest and dinner at Magnolia which was great. The rest of the time I spent at other down town casinos plus hit the strip every day. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not even for the price”
Reviews.Author: mandlintx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, who usually stay on the strip decided to do the "old-time Vegas thing." We wanted to stay on Freemont Street and booked the Four Queens based on recommendations made on this site - big mistake! Although I'd booked my room six weeks in advance, when we arrived, they had no non-smoking rooms available (I was staying for 7 nights). They reassured me that they would have one the next day. The person at the counter told me that they had remodeled to rooms and the smell shouldn't be that bad - it was!! Not only was there the disgusting smell of cigarettes, but then someone had sprayed a ton of cheap-smelling offensive floral deodorizer all over the room - when I opened the door it was enough to gag us both. We opened all of the windows (we were on the 19th floor), and left for two hours hoping the smell would be gone when we returned (it was 4 am when we got back). I requested to be transferred to a nonsmoking room the next day - I was told I could get a room on the 7th floor - right about the same height as the canopy, light, and music show. I knew this wasn't going to work as the noise from the show was loud on the 19th floor - I knew it would be intolerable on the 7th (I was in Vegas to work for four of the seven days and needed to be able to sleep). I requested a room in the other tower and was told there were none available and so were stuck for six nights (I tried to move to another hotel, but due to a convention there were none available for the duration of my stay). The bathroom was disgusting - the caulk was split and mould was growing in the cracks, and there were chunks of dust and dirt hanging from the ceiling vent. We asked to have the vent cleaned - it never was. We had no heat in the room and froze every night we were there. We complained about this several times to no avail. We really did not appreciate the evening we came back from hours of fun on the strip to a 60 degree room - I guess the maid was hot. We called the desk to complain about the cold and asked to have someone sent up (at 11pm) to check on the heat. The engineer said the air was on the heater was not, and there was nothing he could do. The staff, except for Anthony the valet, was not friendly at all, and most (including the ones at Magnolia's) seemed inconvenienced by our very presence. The final straw was that on the day we came back from the Hoover dam and all of the guest elevators in the hotel were out of service. We took a service elevator to our floor and were "chewed out" by a cleaning lady for using the elevator that was for service use only. When I explained that my husband, who walks with a cane, has a rod in his leg and is in no shape to walk up and down 19 flights of stairs, she said that wasn't her problem - nice huh? We spent most of our time at Fitzgerald’s, the staff there was way friendlier, the food was better, and the slots were looser. I DO NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Minimalist room”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens is a great place to base your Vegas vacation, but you certainly get what you pay for. The room is average sized, but the bathroom is downright tiny. The flat screen TV was nice, but we were disappointed at the channel selection. The bed is not at all comfortable, and the room made lots of funny noises at night. The walls are pretty thin as well. There was no line when we checked in which was wonderful. The staff was prompt with requests (more towels, fix TV, fix toliet). The casino was just OK. The craps dealers weren't as friendly as the ones at Binion's. The 24 hour restaurant is bad. We were much happier with the coffee shop at Binion's. We spent lots of our time at the Golden Nugget. The pool, great bartenders, and other amenities ensures that we will spend the extra money to stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: PortlandJenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night. The price was great, but everything else was average. I didn't find the front desk staff to be very friendly, and the elevator waiting space was small and always very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leighy
Reviews.Content: I take my 79 year old mother to Vegas once per year. We have stayed on the strip and last year decided to try the DT area. Last year, we stayed at the Golden Nugget, which was fabulous. She likes to go DT now as it is so much smaller and easier for her to get around. This time we decided to try the Four Queens as they have boasted about renovating their rooms. I read good reviews from this site and was not too concerned. Our experience, however, was not the greatest. We were there from April 1-4, 2007. We were put into a room upon which when I went into the bathroom, a huge pubic hair was starring at from the toilet seat. Gross! Unacceptable! There was also long, black hair on the bathroom floor. I did not decide to request another room, however, until the toilet overflowed a few minutes later. YUCK! So, they put us in another room... no problem... until... that toilet overflowed too. It actually overflowed the following day. I suspect that the infostructure of that part of the city is just so old leading to plumbing problems. (At least there were no pubic hairs to be seen in this bathroom) I called about the toilet and they brought up some big and loud as crap machine to soak up the toilet water that made it's way out onto the carpet outside of the bathroom. They left the machine in the room for many, many hours while we were out gambling. When we got back to the room in the early morning the machine was still there roaring away. I unplugged it and put it out into the hallway. Was the toilet water drenched carpet dry? NO. It was better but certainly not dry. I suppose we could have changed rooms again but we were only going to be there for two more nights and my mother didn't want to bother with it. At least we had our house shoes to wear so our feet didn't have to touch that toilet water germ-filled carpet. The next day our A/C went out. I called about it and they sent someone up to correct the problem ASAP. It worked fine after that. I found the front desk staff to be very nice, friendly and helpful. Even though we had room problems, they were diligent about getting those problems corrected. We had fun in the casino but the the servers did not come around too often for drink orders. Had great luck at the ELVIS slot machine located near the players club desk. That machine seemed to be paying out the whole time we were there. I finally got a chance to get on it right before we left for the airport and won $160.00 playing pennies, not even max bet pennies, and still won. Might not sound like a lot but I am by no means a high roller and was happy to win that much. I only put $20.00 in. Had a blast at the BJ tables. Lost the first night but made up for it after that. We also played at Binion's which I love. Aways seem to find decent slot machines there and have a blast playing BJ. So, would I stay at the Four Queens again. NO. I would rather pay a bit more and stay at the Nugget. It is nicer and seems to be kept up WAY better than the Queens. Oh, one more thing, the rooms were indeed renovated and had the big screen TV. But, the choices of bedspreads and curtains were/are appalling. I know this might not matter to many people who read this but the fabric truly looked like it came straight out of the 1970's. Whoever was in charge of choosing those fabrics should be fired and required to go to interior design school. Look at the hotel photos on this site and you will see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: EWulf
Reviews.Content: In the past few years, we generally stayed on the Strip. We started a yearly tradition where we meet our sister and brother in law in Vegas in May for her birthday. They had always stayed downtown, so we also booked a hotel downtown. We have stayed at the Four Queens Hotel for the last three years, and we have reservations again this year to stay 7 days. We like the convenience of downtown because there are casinos just outside of each other. As for the Four Queens, the rooms are clean and very very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: AngieV
Reviews.Content: I was really worried that staying off of the strip was going to ruin my trip to Vegas--but i was wrong! We were there during the rodeo so all the hotels were booked, we got our reservation at the Four Queens which turned out to be a nice place to stay. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, and there was a great restaraunt right off the casino that was awesome! The Freemont Street Experience was really neat also. There were just tons of people enjoying the lights, music, drinks, and just having a great time together. I would recommend staying here if you don't want to be on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: RogerGHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an excellent few days at the Four Queens in February. The check-in was excellent and quick. All of the staff were very helpfull and friendly. The room was very clean (unlike some other Vegas hotels) and well equiped. The casino was good and not too smoky when we were there. Could not do much gambling as we both caught flu on the flight over! If you are looking for a good downtown hotel with excellent room rates the Four Queens can be highly recomended. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Hand
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the four queens during our annual trip to Las Vegas during the first Week on the NCAA basketball tournament. I've stayed at the Four Queens before, and when I received a discount flyer in the mail, I decided to give them a try again. I was extremely pleased with our accommodations and the great price. We stayed in one of the remodeled rooms with queen beds and a flat screen TV. An exceptional value for such a wonderful clean room. The Four Queens staff was extremely helpful taking care of our every need. We especially appreciated the Four Queen’s location on Freemont Street. Within easy reach of other casinos and entertainment on Freemont Street, and A short cab ride to the larger casinos on the strip. I know that I will stay at the Four Queens next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: chappy319
Reviews.Content: location outstanding dining outstanding, great prices, great food. room outstanding, any requests quickly filled. gambling outstanding with the exception of drink service.i got in at 10 pm and was looking forward to a drink, unfortuneatly,no waitresses around. i figured it was because of a sunday nite. i mentioined this to a waitress on monday, and she took good care of me, and i her. come tuesday, wed, thursday, only time i saw a waitress was in the morning. because of this, four queens lost a lot of my gambling money to the new york club. sorry. great trip and four queens is awesome, i will return again, everyone at hotel was so kind otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie56672
Reviews.Content: We just came home yesterday from a 4 night stay at the Four Queens. We had a great time. Rooms were clean and maid service every AM. Five minutes to check in. We arrived about 4:30 pm. We ate several meals at Magnolias and they were all good. Significant price reduction if you have a players card. Sign up for card online before you go to Vegas and receive an extra free gift. We got Four Queens caps for pre registering. Everyone gets a nice deck of cards in a tin. Nice souvenir. We are already planning to go back. Everyone was friendly and waitresses were around a lot with the free drinks. Love Fremont Street. I felt very safe there, no riff raff. The strip was fun but a lot more walking involved.

Reviews.Title: “Older But Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MissouriKringle
Reviews.Content: Antonio, Front desk was magnificent. check in was late-wanted to be of f Fremont St. (noise)- Wife is diabetic- Antonio Arranged for room with Refrigerator for insulin. Called to check on us after arrival in room. Good food (hugos cellar)-Magnolia coffee shop good also- Good gambling= small but Quaint- Would return- Like the laid back atmosphere of downtown'.

Reviews.Title: “Allstar Weekend at the 4 queens”
Reviews.Author: preshus_d
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through MLT. We only paid $260/person, which included flight from Tulsa and our room at the 4 queens. Check in was easy, we received adjoining rooms with no problems. Room was on the 14th floor, overlooking the Fremont Canopy. I have no complaints what so ever. It was clean and actually quiet, considering it being allstar weekend. It took about $16 to catch a taxi to the strip, the duece was $5 for a day pass. Did not eat inside hotel. Did go to Tony Romas...It was horrible, food was raw. Loose slots were at the Fitzgeralds. Plenty of entertainment right there, and you don't have to walk far to get to each hotel. I've always stayed on the strip at Imperial Palace or the Riviera, the Four Queens was better, and a better bargain, Save the money for gambling or to see a show(I recommend Princes' 3121 it was worth $125) If you like Prince, but if you cant afford that go see Purple reign the Prince tribute show for 5 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VegasgalFlorida
Reviews.Content: My family used to stay at the Hilton during our 3-4 trips to Vegas a year. Then we discovered the great 4 QUEENS. Everyone that works at the 4 QUEENS treats you like family. The tables are exciting and the dealers and pit bosses are very accomodating and eager to teach you any game. The restaurants are top notch. HUGO'S CELLAR is a five star restaurant in the basement. The comps are the best in town. The best thing is the safety and security. My last visit I had my purse out in the open and the security people watching in the ceiling called the pit boss and asked them to move my purse so I didn't lose it. We will never go back to staying on the strip. There are also many options of casinos within 2 blocks to walk to for gambling and the exciting Fremont Street experience complete with concerts is outside the door each night. An exciting time and family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Class of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: fremontfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Queens recently. I got a renovated room and was very pleased. Everything was new, which is nice given that this is an older hotel. It's nice to see a hotel owner invest some $$ to improve their property! The room was very clean, too. The hotel and casino have an elegant look, all shiny and brassy. I really enjoyed the casino: the slot mahinces here are loose! I won small amounts on different machines, and also saw others winning, as well. They also had alot of full-pay video poker. I signed up for a players club card and got discounts in their restaurant, which overlooks the casino. Good food and good prices. Overall I was very pleased with the Four Queens and would stay, and play here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: we booked a hotel downtown as it was so expensive to stay on the strip at christmas.we were very surprised with how good the hotel was.we arrived late and checked in with no problems.our room was spacious and recently redecorated to a good standard.the bathroom was small but had a fantastic shower,which was hot and powerful.room had all the usual for a usa hotel,huge bed,coffee maker,large tv,iron,hairdryer,ect.rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels.our room was above the fremont street experience so every hour for ten mins until midnight was noisy,so,the next day we asked could we switch to a room across the hall so we wouldn't be over the light show which was done without any fuss.reception staff were very polite and helpfull.would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great deal and good service”
Reviews.Author: davidparklane
Reviews.Content: november 2006 I stayed at the Four Queens with my brother and his lovely wife. We had a great time. Our rooms were clean and cozy. The Veranda cafe had great meals and prices. I loved to watch the tables while I enjoyed the 6.40 primerib, 4.00 burger and fries, and the 3.00 steak and eggs. The best rooms are in the tower facing the south side. The elevator was in the center of the casino and just a short walk to the main entrance to Freemont St. I would recomend this hotel. Make sure to join the player's club, this is how I got the good food deals.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: vegasluvr05
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the strip, but got an unbelievable package deal to fly and stay at 4 Queens. Check in took about 5 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. Clerk very friendly. Hotel was booked for the night and we received a room on the 5th floor of the South Tower (Rm 533). Many people have commented on how slow the elevators are. They didn't seem to bad when we used them. Requested a non-smoking king bed and that's what we got. Opened door and room was great! Carpet was new, as was the bed, bedspread, lighting fixtures in bathroom and had a new flat screen TV. Room was updated with the exception of the bathroom. Looked like it could use a little paint and some upkeep. Bathroom was very tiny, but worked fine. Room was very large and looked toward the FSE. Could hear the shows a night, but since our tower was farther away, it didn't bother us at all. Ate at Magnolia's 3 times. Very good food and service. Also, if you sign up for the player card, there are a few specials that you can get. For $6.40 we tried the prime rib special and also the baby back rib special. Came with salad, rolls, beans and choice of potato. Very large portions and food was very good as well. Casino had for the most part friendly dealers at the BJ tables and a nice selection of slot machines. Drink service was good at the slots (even penny and nickel ones) and was excellent if you were at the tables. Overall I was very happy with our stay here and would definately recommend to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: debmo1
Reviews.Content: We flew in from DFW on a Funjet charter. Took the shuttle bus ($12.00 per person) from the airport to the Four Queens. Check-in was a breeze. We were given room 1531 (a suite). It was a corner room overlooking the FSE. The room had two full size sofas, two arm chairs, coffee tables, end tables, a desk and chair, plus a fridge and a king bed. The bath had his and hers sinks and nice thick towels. The soap, shampoo and lotion were plentiful but not high end. There was a separate dressing area with a mirrored closet. We left the maid a $5 on the pillow each day and they took care of everything we needed. The casino is smokey but still fun. The dealers were for the most part friendly and fun. The cocktail service was excellent. The coffee shop, Magnolia's, is quite the bargain. Breakfast was $4.00 for your choice of ham or steak, two eggs, hashbrowns and your choice of toast, biscuits, english muffins, etc. Their dinner special was $6.40 for your choice of soup or salad, your choice of prime rib or baby back ribs, baked potato and the vegetable of the day. Again we had excellent service and a great bargain. This is not gourmet food but it is really good and you cannot beat the price. They also had a burger and fries special for $4.00 but we did not try it. We did see others who ordered it and it looked good if you were in the mood for a burger. You have to have a players card to get these speical prices. Just go to the promotions desk after you check in and sign up. Better yet, go on line to fourqueens.com and fill out their players club form, print it out, give it to them at their promotions desk and they will give you a nice Four Queens duffel bag/tote bag for free. Checkout is normally 12:00 noon but we asked if it would be possible to extend the checkout time. They let us check out at 1:00 PM instead. That extra hour made things much more convenient for us. We took a taxi from the FQ back to the airport and it was about $25 if I remember correctly. Overall, we had a great time at the Four Queens and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - A Las vegas Hidden Secret!”
Reviews.Author: lbellefl
Reviews.Content: My fellow travelers . . . Please don’t let older reviews of this property discourage you from staying at this property. I think it is a hidden gem in the sea of Las Vegas hotels. My husband and I stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend. Most room in this hotel have been recently remodeled and we received one of the new rooms. New carpet, paint and furniture and very clean. I think this hotel has the best location on Fremont street. A short walk to the main street if you wish to take the city bus to the strip, yet located right in the middle of Fremont Street itself. The hotel has a café style restaurant called magnolias and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. You can also order Microbrew beer from their Brewery also located in the Hotel. The Microbrew restaurant (I can’t remember the name for sure, but I think it was called Chicago Microbrew) also had excellent food and was a nice quit place to take a break. For a special treat, Hugo’s cellar is an excellent place for fine dining and one of the best places I think I have dined in Las Vegas. Last but not least we had the best luck in this casino for slot machine jackpots. I won $800 within the first 20 minutes I was there on the Wheel of Fortune Dollar machines located on the wall that faces Fremont Street. Our friends did very well on the poker machines located throughout the casino. Also the dealers were very friendly. After 25 years of visiting Vegas about three times a year, this has become our favorite hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to street Hotel Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fisherman167
Reviews.Content: Four Queens room 1501 in the North Tower was close to the elevator in the tower next to the Fremont Street Experience (FSE). You could close your hotel room door, take the elevator and be on the street within about 3 minutes and about 20 steps. This beats the block+ walk through Golden Nugget, Fitzgeralds, and Fremont to get to the street from their rooms. You could not really hear the FSE from the room, but you would on the rooms on the other side lower down. The window had a view of the Nugget and the other Queens tower and parking garage. The room is small about 15’x25’ total. The window is about 4’x15’. The bathroom is about 6’x 9’ and a large closet about 2.5’x 5.5’. The main room is about 15’x15’. The furniture is classy mahogany looking including 2’x4’ table, two table chairs, TV stand with 2 drawers, 2 night stands with 2 drawers, and one king bed. The closet doors are mirrors. The room has central air, alarm clock, hair dryer, standard hotel 3 cup drip coffee maker, $0.75 phone calls, good wireless internet $11.99 per day and room food service. Like most LV hotel rooms the lights were too low of wattage to read. Magnolias Café has excellent food and specials. There is a pizza place and coffee, donuts, ice cream parlor hidden in the corner where Burger King and sushi bar used to be. Maid service was polite, detailed, and excellent. The small 24” remote Philips TV had in room movies. The zip code for the online Yahoo TV schedule is 89101 and Cox Communications (digital) is the cable provider. The room TV stations are: 2.KVBC local 3.NBC KVBC local 5. Fox KVVU local 6. CNN 20 Atlanta 7. Keno 8. CBS KLAS local 9. TBSP Atlanta 10. PBS KLUX 11. CNN- 22 Headline News 12. ESPN 30 13. ABC KTNV local 15. KINC 15 Spanish 16. Hotel Dining 17. Hotel Gaming 23. Movie Previews The North Tower has red key cards and the South Tower has purple. The ice machines in th North Tower are on floors 2, 9, 10, 12, 16, 18, and 19 while the soda machines ($1.50 coin) are on floors 5, 8, 11, 15, and 17. I will stay in the North Tower again since it is so close to the street and other casinos. The room was closer to the front doors and casinos of the Fremont, Binions Horseshoe, and Golden Nugget than the rooms in their own hotels. The down side was the central air could not get the room temperature below 70F easily and the small room and bathroom size. The room check in (on Sundays to get keys to go into the room) could not be before 2 PM and room not guaranteed clean until 4 PM so use the bell hop and wait around with a dirty room or forget the early arrival flight on Sundays. On Monday I saw people checking in starting at 8:30 AM. There was a new airport boarding pass printing machine near the reservation desk for about $1 per minute plus $0.50 per page.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ADW1954
Reviews.Content: I booked a 7 night stay via a UK Website, and was a bit wary after reading reviews abouth this hotel. I was pleasently surprised when checked into my room ,it was recently refurbished and was extremely pleasant, the housekeeping was exceptional, and by joining the players club I obtained excellent discounts in the restaurant....upto 65% wow!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: cheryl46
Reviews.Content: We just returned Nov 11th from a 7 night stay at the Four Queens. Our room was in the North Tower #516 facing Freemont St. just under the canopy. The room was recently renovated very nice, very comfortable bed and very clean. Maid service was timely each day. The room was small especially the bathroom and as you entered the room other than that area it was fine. I was concerned with noise from the street but most nights after a busy day in Vegas we never had any trouble sleeping. We ate breakfast most days at Magnolias and had a couple of dinners as well with the players card breakfast was very reasonable and all meals were very good. We had rented a car this trip and parking was easy and free. It was another great trip and I would recommend the hotel and would stay again. Previously most of our visits have been at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: KingLauraL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day trip to Las Vegas and we stayed the 4-Queens Hotel and Casino on Fremont Street and I must say that I would not stay there again even with the daily rate of $50. The hotel is shabby and showing its age (even with the renovations that are going on). Our room was comfortable, but the bathroom as so small one could barely move in it and the bathtub had mildrew all the way around the edges. The furniture was cheap and there was cigarette burn marks on the carpet and comforter. And I would not recommend this hotel or area if you are under 65 years of age. Don't get me wrong, I have nothing against the elderly, but if you are looking for a rockin good time, DON'T stay on Fremont street On the up side...the staff was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the buget gambler”
Reviews.Author: Rockn1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10/30 & 10/31 at the 4 Queens, first time there, and we were pleasantly surprised. First off, this is not a 4 star property, but you get what you pay for (and in our case nothing, since we got our stay comped for our play, which is GREAT!). So if you want “resort” quality, stay on the strip if you can afford over priced rooms. Our room was OK, nice king bed, enough room, the bathroom a bit small, but we only got the $49 a night room, so that is expected. Old looking, but most of downtown in old looking, that’s kinda of the charm of it. Old Vegas feel, before Meg Resort Boom. We were on the first floor of south tower (“newer” tower), so the elevators weren’t an issue for us. Hugo’s was very nice place to eat for the price ($100 for 2). Had a better meal there than at the Eiffel tower at the Paris (but without the great views). Casino was nice, not huge so you can get lost, be enough open tables and slots (could use a poker room). All TITO slots, not too tight and low table mim gave us a lot of play for our budget. Mostly friendly dealers and staff, small enough were the Hosts and Dealers would remember your name (and get better comps that way). Just a few steps outside to Freemont St and all the other downtown properties (and right next door to the Golden Nugget), so you could take an easy walk to another property and not worry about anything. I’d rate it 2nd best on Freemont Street, right behind the Golden Nugget, which is probably the crown jewel of Downtown Vegas. Hopefully get to stay there again (or maybe try out the Nugget next time). To sum up, great place to stay for a short trip to downtown Vegas, just don’t expect anything like the Mega resorts on the strip. See ya next time in Vegas, baby..:-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: th35
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the last weekend in Oct. The overall upkeep of the hotel and the rooms were quite well. The rooms exceded what we expected and are still being upgraded with flat screen tv's. What is real nice is the 4 Queens has one of the show tciket sellers on property where you can buy tickets for any show in LV. The only complaints were that the daytime cocktail waitresses seemed quite rude as a whole and there was not much winning going on at the slots. Also, the resturants are fair at best and attitudes were disappointing. However, restaurants in the Fremont strip area are very good and you can't eat and drink cheaper than on Fremont. This was my first time on Fremont and I wouldn't hesitate to do it again, a great deal and very easy to get around. You can always drive up to the "big strip" if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kattim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Queens from October 12 - 16th. While it is not a five star property, it certainly exceeded our expectations, particularly after reading some of the reviews on this site. The staff was attentive and met our expectations. The first night, we smelled a lot of cigarette smoke in the room (despite being on a non-smoking floor). The next day we asked to be moved and were given another room on a different floor without any hassle at all. The rooms (both of them) contained king sized (quite comfortable) beds. They were clean and reasonably well-kept (although somewhat showing their age). We also enjoyed gambling here - they do actually have one $2 blackjack table and you can often get on, if you don't mind waiting for a bit of time. I am new to blackjack and didn't want to spend lots of money learning the ropes. Don't bother with the breakfast (even the $4 special rate if you become a players club member)...the $5.99 buffet (weekdays) at Main Station far exceeds anything you can get at the Four Queens and includes juice and coffee (unlike the $4 breakfast special at the hotel restaurant). All in all, we will stay here again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing was the food”
Reviews.Author: mrs.bolivar
Reviews.Content: We reserved a non-smoking room. My husband is allergic to cigarette smoke. Upon arrival we were told that there were no non smoking rooms left but there was one smoking room available that had recently been remodeled. They would move us to nonsmoking the following morning. The first room had nice decor, was a comfy room overall, but it still smelled of stale cigarette smoke. We would have happily stayed in that room if the smell had not been there. They moved us to a nonsmoking room after being reminded that they needed to do so the next night and the bed in the second room honestly felt like two box springs on top of each other. We asked to be moved and were told they had rented out all the other nonsmoking rooms. We asked if the mattress could be switched out (another employee had told us 4Q was renovating all the rooms and new mattresses were available, all we had to do was ask) and were at first told this would be no problem.
