Got to the room to wait for the new matress and were then told that this could not be done because "only engineers are qualified to do that". We complained again and miraculously they found us another nonsmoking room with a bed that was not quite so bad but still both of us woke up with aches and pains. There were holes in the towels, sheets, and pillowcases as well in the third room. There were also gouges in the drywall of the room and lukewarm water. The staff acted like they could have cared less for the most part about any of our concerns. Also, don't fall for the time share people in the lobby. We were told that if we went on their sales pitch tour we would get sixty dollars cash. We were thinking of getting a time share eventually anyway so this sounded pretty good to us. And it was a free trip around Vegas so why not! The voucher we received was not redeemable for cash, hotel credit only. When we complained to the supervisor he seriously rolled his eyes at my husband. We ended up using the voucher to eat at Magnolia's, the 24 hour restaurant inside the very smoky casino (they have a glass wall seperating the casino from part of the nonsmoking section), and had a great meal. Service in the restaurant was wonderful too. We also tried the pizza place and really liked the food there. I would some it up as poor customer service in a run- down hotel. Their slogan is "The class of Downtown" but we sure didn't see that at all. They need to start renovating at warp speed or change their slogan. Either way we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: circusisintown
Reviews.Content: To begin with, the hotel is far from a 3 star. At the most it is a 2 star. Second, the hotel is run down and old. Needs to be either torn down or renovated. Rust stains in shower, cracked tiles in the bathroom, hair in the sink, carpet was stained, are just a few of the features we found not so desirable. We were given an adjoining room with noisy neighbors that felt it was ok to smoke on the non-smoking floor. It was so bad by the 3rd night of our trip that the smoke was seeping underneath the adjoining door and was making our room hazy. When the front desk was notified, they simply let us know that they could not tell people what to do in their rooms. That was absurd. Upon checkout, we asked for a manager and notified him about our complaint, but we were blown off as well. We let him kindly know that we would not be staying at their hotel in the future. Point is, if you ask for non-smoking at any establishment, if someone lights up a smoke next to you in the non-smoking section, they will be asked to put it out, after all, it is the non-smoking section. Apparently, this hotel does not see it that way.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: mikelam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not good at all. The bed is dirty, and the bathroom is bad. We used to leave tips at every hotel, but this one, no way!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Room for the Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Compared to some of the reviews I've read, I want to give this hotel five stars for beating my low expectations--let's face it, I was a little frightened after Hotwire revealed the name of the hotel. but don't believe the bad reviews. I stayed in the North Tower, on the 8th floor- exactly level with the "fremont experience." I don't know what noise people were complaining of- it was fine. and the lights were pretty through the sheers, and completely hidden when the heavy curtains were pulled. The room was clean, the furnishings not fashionable but decent and in good repair, and the linens were surprisingly soft, great pillows even. The staff were friendly and kind, and I even had a housekeeper interrupt me from returning to my room after brunch to warn me that she hadn't straightened my room yet, and would I like her to do it now.... The place is NOT a three star, probably a 2.5. The Days Inn comes to mind. And the only thing the TV is good for is for puchasing videos- it can do nothing else. but unless you're staying at the Nugget (was sold out) what else might you expect downtown? it's not posh, but it's a Vegas experience for a bargain. Further, you can take the Deuce ($2 double decker bus) down to the Strip- which CAN take forever in traffic, but good views along the way- which is all of a 3-4 minute walk from the hotel front door, THROUGH the Fremont experience. If you haven't been, picture an outdoor shopping outlet with panels way aloft that provide the show in the evening but provide reasonable shade during the day--there are speakers playing a variety of music mounted on posts every 50 feet or so, and as you walk what is essentially a pedestrian mall between the casinos, you'll run into street performers (artists and the like) and vendors of every touristy/mall sort. and don't forget the guys selling cocktails on the street- big plastic yard-long margaritas. So the woman who wrote that you get to the bus through a scary part of town clearly got lost. (how?) Magnolia's is not what people have made it out to be, but prime rib for $6- edible. The breakfast was much better. All in all, so much better than I had anticipated. And perhaps one of the BEST parts about the hotel room? I requested a non-smoking room and I got it. No trace of the scent to be found, and that IS a sticking point with me. I am pleased with my experience overall and wanted to set the record straight, because the 4 Queens is getting a reputation it doesn't deserve.

Reviews.Title: “4-Queens & Downtown has it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: cartert2
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first two nights of our trip on the strip at the Aladdin. Then stayed two nights at the 4-Queens. Upon arrival I felt as if I were home. The stress of the crowds and walking that accompanies the strip were gone. We arrived earlier than check-in time. They gave us a room anyway. We were put on the 6th floor next to the elevators. With a view of the roof but, who goes to Vegas to look out the hotel window! Unlike some reviewers that states problem with noise. We had two quite nights. The room was a bit small but, clean and comfortable. Maid service, like the rest of the staff was excellent! As for no doorman or bellhops. I did not receive these services at the Aladdin either and the room price was much higher. Gambling in all the downtown casinos was more favorable. If your looking for a posh hotel, stay on the strip. Just make sure to bring plenty of $$$. If your looking to beat the stress and the crowds make the smart choice. Stay downtown at the 4-Queens!!! We seen Gordie Brown next door at the Golden Nugget. Excellent show! The best of the 4 we seen. Proving the 4-Queens and downtown has it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “A room is just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrsOtter
Reviews.Content: We stayed with another couple over Memorial Day weekend, so we chose 4Q because of the price. We ended up on the 10th floor with a perfect view of the top of the Fremont Street Experience. As this is an older hotel, the windows aren't sealed as well as newer hotels....we could hear the very early morning street cleanup as well as music rolling from the casinos floors through the windows. The beds were clean but not entirely comfortable, the floors were not filthy but worn, and the bathroom was small. The shower was very small...needless to say, a hotel room is just a place to sleep and that is exactly what we got. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from Las Vegas June 2 after staying 3 nights at the Four Queens. I loved staying on Fremont St. and the hotel was great. The rooms were nice and clean and they included irons, coffeemakers and a hair dryer. The staff was friendly and the service was good. My fiancee and I spent most of our gambling time at the Four Queens. We did look at other places nearby but for nickel video poker the Four Queens is the place to play. The waitresses brought us drinks regularly (all you have to do is give them a nice tip and they keep coming back). Another pleasant surprise was the comps. We came home withe duffel bags, t-shirts etc. We were also treated to a few free meals at Magnolia's Veranda. Next time I plan to go back I will stay at the Four Queens again.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems at Four Queens”
Reviews.Author: dotnchuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Four Queens with 4 friends. We has an excellent time and was treated well. The Trip Advisor user that stated it as being typical Holiday Inn fare was very accurate. It was clean, comfortable and good value for the price. There are no doormen or bellhops, you just need to be able to take care of yourself. If you want more you will need to go elsewhere. Slots were good, they were a little looser than the strip, the Nugget and the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: babs53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend at the Four Queens. We had a room at the top with a wonderful view of the mountains!! We awoke every morning to music floating up from the Freemont Experience. A older hotel, but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but very clean. We were there for four days and the beds and towels were changed every day. Bathroom cleaned. Front desk very friendly. We would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good price was our objective when booking three rooms at the 4 Queens for a one night stay in the middle of a three day weekend. We were pleased to find updated rooms, pleasant staff and two rooms were even upgraded to to accommodate our no smoking request. The downtown area was a fun reminder of the past and the hourly street scene performance was great. All three couples agreed that they would return. Only negative is that the elevators are a bit on the slow side, but think of all the money you aren't spending while waiting.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was me and my boyfriend's first time outside of Iowa. We were going to Vegas to get married. We booked with Four Queens because of the price. We were very happy. Our maid was excellent and the service was great. May I suggest the pizza from Old Chicago?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yaeneth
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The check-in was very quick and the staff was very nice. The only complaint I had was the rank smell the room had. It smelled so bad we had to Febreeze it several times to get the stench out. Overall, a good place to stay for the price and it's right on the Fremont experience which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the West!!”
Reviews.Author: alfrae
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Four Queens for quite a few years now and we love it, wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 29 bucks...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in room 819 on a Tuesday night booked directly through the hotel website for 29 bucks. Check in was less than a minute. Casino is easy to navigate and elevators for both towers easy to find. No security whatsoever checking keys at the elevators. Room was smaller than average motel 6. Bed was similar to sleeping on the floor in comfort level. TV had about 6 or 7 channels. I ended up watching the hotels ammenity channel over and over because the goon and his wife featured were funny to watch. They were SO excited to be at this hotel, it was comical. The worst part of this room was the bathroom. It was the smallest I have ever had. The missing shower tile had been placed on the toilet tank, probably by a guest years previous. The shower drain backed up in less than a minute so you would be mid calf deep in water. The water temp and pressure sucked big time. If you turned the temp up to a decent level, the plumbing behind the wall would vibrate VERY LOUDLY. This would continue to get progressively worse until the knob was backed off enough to give you a nice refreshing ARCTIC BLAST. It would cycle like that throughout the shower. I would not stay again, regardless of the 29 dollar Tuesday. As a side note, the Chicago Brewing Company located inside the casino has excellent pizzas and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens-Great place to experience Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Vickie712
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens for two nights. We had stayed on the Strip previously and wanted to try downtown this time. We weren't disappointed. We got a great rate on the room. Since the previous reviews weren't that good, we were quite surpirsed at how nice the rooms were. We were on the fourth floor and there wasn't much of a view but we were there to see Vegas, not look out the window. Check-in was fast, parking was free since we were guests. The room could have used new carpeting but other than that, everything was fine. We drove to other casinos without having to drive the strip with no problem. Nice being able to gamble, go out and see the light show and go back to gambling again. Would recomment the Four Queens to anyone who is on a budget and wants a nice, clean place to stay. We'll be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend a night here during Memorial Day Wknd. Had a great view of freemont street and the light show from our window. The room was small but clean and had an ironing board. The bathroom was clean though somewhat cramped. The price was right for the stay, I wouldnt stay here again as there's no pool and I need more space, however if you want a clean place to just lay your head for a night, this may be a good place for you. The staff is friendly, the casino is nice though smokey and the restaurant downstairs is really great, hugos cellar.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: VegasDude66
Reviews.Content: On of my two choices when staying downtown on my frequent trips into Las Vegas. I travel on business, but do drop a few bucks in the casinos during my down time and choose 4 Queens or Fitzgeralds for about 80% of my visits. Both hotels have their pros and cons. The 4 Queens has, by far, the better front desk staff...friendly and accomodating (can't say that about most of the staff at the Fitz). Rooms are clean, although a bit outdated, and comfortable with the basic ammenities. The shower generally has poor water pressure and the bathrooms are overall smaller than they should be. Lower floors in the North Tower can be less than peaceful at night during the Freemont St Experience shows so don't plan on a early night's sleep...the noise drops off around midnight...but hey, this is Vegas...who's in their room at midnight (me, unfortunately...when there's business to take care of the next AM). A gift shop near the front desk is open late and 24 hrs on weekends. There is a Subway/Noble Romans Pizza/TCBY location off the lobby, a 24 hour cafe with quality food at reasonable prices, a Chicago Brewing Company with a variety of beers and pizza, and Hugo's Cellar which is a mainstay downtown and known for it's fine dining experience. The casino is small but offers great variety with a wide range of monetary denominations. Dealers are friendly and helpful. The players club is probably the best cash-back program downtown but any comps must go through a host or pit boss. Overall, a good value for the money. For those wishing to stay in the coziness of downtown...4 Queens isn't a bad bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for a very low price!”
Reviews.Author: Steph-Germany
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much as we had only payed 20 Euro for the night at the 4 Queens. Therefore, we were happy with what we got. The staff at reception was very friendly and helpful to us! The room didn't appear too inviting, it was small with a very small bathroom, kind of old and worn - but clean! For hotel guests the parking garage costs $ 3,- when you show the ticket at reception. We spent one day and night in Downtown which we found enough to see what you have to (Fremont St. Experience, Casinos, restaurants, street musicians). For such a short stay we would come back to the 4 Queens, was a gread deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on a weekday so the noise from Freemont street wasn't too bad. But I imagine that Weekends would be very noisey very late. Our room was on the 5th floor of the North tower so our window overlooked Freemont street, and was just under the Canopy that covers the street, which is really cool at night with all the lights of Old Las Vegas. If you want silence then ask for a room in the South tower. The room was Smaller than some but still big enough not to be climbing over your partner. The carpet was clean and looked fairly new as was the paint and the bathroom looked as though it may have been remodeled recently. The bed was comfortable. The chairs, desk and table looked a little older. As for location the only drawback is that you are not on the strip. However, it's a relief not to walk a mile from the elevator to the casino, and then another mile to get to the next casino. Exiting our elevator we were 5 feet from the casino. 20 feet from Fremont street. All the casino's are packed in next to each other. So you can hit the next casino in two minutes time. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Snowmonkie44
Reviews.Content: The Four Queens was a pretty nice place to stay if your budget minded, and don't care about the little things. Personaly I am a house keeper and I know the ins and outs of the hotel busness. The room was small but that I didn't mind, but the first thing when I walked into the room is that I smelled smoke. This would be ok if I smoked but I don't. The floors and the bathroom were just about spotless! The tub seemed to be washed out everyday, which is nice. But the sheets on the beds where not changed everyday (which is a standered at the hotel I work at, and I am a stickler for). For all the money I expect goes through a hotel/casino I kinda expect the desk chairs and blankets, etc to be in better shape. Check in was so quick and the frontdesk attentents where very nice. We came in really early and they had a room right away for us. The only thing about them I didn't like is that I asked for a hair dryer and I didn't get it. It's a nice place to stay if you want somthing quiet too! I slept rather well! Our room had a decent view of adjacent casinos (i could see the desert but i had to hang part of my body out the window) But if you want to play on the strip and your a cheep person i wouldn't advise to stay downtown. the taxi fare ranges $1o-$25. and i can't stress this enough make sure your driver understands the place you tell them to take you to! I've had this happen and the bill came to about $25! In closeing don't expect somthing lavish! they don't have any internet service, nore complete cable, and don't expect a fancy room, and theres not breakfast. But my boyfriend on the other hand thinks it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “4 Queens Great For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay for one night before my reservations at Lake Las Vegas as I got into town early. It had been about 3 years since I had been downtown so I thought I would give it a try and the price was great. For $26 our room over looked freemont street. We were under the canopy so were able to see the light shows from the room before we went down to roam around. The room had the basic furnishings and is old, but it was clean. The bathroom is very, very tiny but had everything. The only downfall to the room was the fact that it was noisy due to being under the canopy. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. I did not eat at any of the restaraunts so can't comment on them. If I am ever in need of a place for a night or two and don't want to spend a fortune for a room I am never in anyway, I will book the 4 Queens.

Reviews.Title: “not what we ask for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: seven of us ladies, visited four queens, downtown las vegas, in april, 2005. we reserved three rooms, ask for the same floor, now smoking. we good three different floors, smoking rooms, very few towels, not real happy with our rooms. the hall way to the elevator was not clean and was HOT, as well as not able to get ice and vending machines on each floor. I would not stay at four queens again.

Reviews.Title: “4 queens is awesome for the price”
Reviews.Author: fuel90000
Reviews.Content: our stay at the 4 queens was outstanding. check in was fast and the rooms were a decent size and verry clean. the only downside to this hotel was their is no pool. it was only a 11 - 15 $ taxi ride to the strip. it was in a great location downtown and was verry reasonably priced. the food in the resturant was excelent. we all had the prime rib special they had and was awesome. over all it was an awesome place to stay and would deffinatly stay here again if i wanted to stay downtown. but this next time im going to las vegas in sept we r going to stay on the strip and take a chance at the westward ho which i read som mixed reviews on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: snowangelx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 4 Queens late March of this year for a few days with my sister and father. I paid a budget price and was pleasantly suprised. I am a travel agent, and while I will still recommend this as a budget property, I think that of all of the cheaper downtown properties, it is worth the money paid. The front desk staff were very helpful, storing our luggage on the day of arrival until check-in time, and allowing us a late checkout the day we left. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms clean. The restaurant open 24hrs was standard, chicken fingers, hamburgers but very good. Overall I had a great time In Vegas and it was nice to have a clean, comfortable place to lay my head.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: jammb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. It was OK, but I would not stay here again. We checked in and went up to our room, which had a lovely view of the roof-top air conditioning unit on the building next door. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, and had obviously been poorly patched in the past. The bedspread had cigarette burns in it. The cold water in the bathroom sink would not shut off. I ended up turning it so much that it broke - we had to call maintenance. There were not enough plugs near the back of the bed, so we had to make a choice: 1 light on each side of the bed, or 1 light total and the clock. We ended up moving the clock to the plug where the coffee maker was across the room, but that meant resetting it everytime the wall switch was shut off from near the door. I called about that to see if they could get me an extension cord with multiple outlets, but was told, "Yep - that's the way our rooms are." Parking is $3 / day for hotel guests. On the plus side, the room was by far the cheapest available anywhere that I could find (except for the skanky no-name motels). Also, it is very well situated to take advantage of everything downtown has to offer. If I had to do it over again, I'd try the Fitzgerald or spend a bit more and stay at the Golden Nugget. So, you get what you pay for. If all you are looking for is a place to crash just for sleeping, then this might do the trick. If you are looking for more, you'll need to spend more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “four queens downtown”
Reviews.Author: steeple002
Reviews.Content: stayed at four queens for two weeks in may 2005.great hotel for price, we got $44 per night.not one negetive to say about staff,very friendly.all in all great holiday got royal flush twice on vidio poker so as macarthur said we will be back.thank you all@four queens

Reviews.Title: “Want an average place to stay?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hesistant to book this reservation in downtown Las Vegas, but it was the cheapest rate that I could find for a weekend rendezvous. Driving through downtown LV to get to the hub of the Fremont Experience is pretty scary and ugly. However, when you get past the ugliness and enter the area of the major downtown LV hotels (Fremont Experience) it gets a lot better. The front desk was nice and the standard room was average. The best part about this hotel was that the Fremonet Experience was just outside the casino doors. Overall, it is an average place to stay where you can find lots to do right outside the casino doors.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Queens one night and we were a little disappointed with our rooms. My sister and her husband had one room and it was not really that clean, alot of stains on the furniture, ours was a little better. Linens and bathrooms were clean. Very noisy as we had rooms overlooking Freemont Street. Good Casino, friendly staff. Be sure to ask for back rooms if you need your sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Tonya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Four Queens Tuesday, April 19. We decided we would change our flight if we could find a decent place to stay that was pretty cheap. After reading all the reviews on trip advisor I decided we would give the Four Queens a shot. I called and made the reservation getting a rate cheaper than was on the internet. It was $49 without tax. I requested a king, non smoking in what is supposed to be the nicer tower, ( I can't remember which one it is now). She said they couldn't guarantee that, but they would make the request. I told her the main thing was a non-smoking room. I also advised that our flight would not arrive until 10:00 pm, she made that note as well in case we had flight delays, they would not give our room away. Check in was easy, we got the room we requested (there is only 1 king bed on each floor is what I was told). We took our bags to the room. It was spotless. I was very pleased. We could tell the light show was going on, we could see the top of the canopy, but we hung out in the room for a while, before heading back out to grab a drink and watch the midnight show. It was great to walk out the doors and be on Freemont Street, it was the middle of the week so not very crowded. After the show, we grabbed a bite to eat at McDonalds which was next door and still open. Then went in and crashed, after all it was probably 3am my time. Slept great, the next morning we decided to see if our room at TI was ready, it would be by the time we got there, so we washed our face, brushed our teeth and waited until we got there to take a shower. We didn't use the shower so I don't know about drainage problems. Overall, I would definitely recommend Four Queens and I would stay there again although, I would not spend more than one night, but it was a great experience. We may actually start doing that, taking a late flight and staying downtown for the first night, it was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In Downtown”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMO
Reviews.Content: It was an ok Hotel, Im thankful I got the room for about 60.00 a night. I would have been upset to pay some of their prices Ive seen them charging on the web. The hotel is in ok shape the rooms have alot to be desired...the beds were sunken and worn. Bedspreads have cigarette holes in them, Showers need caulking and a better scrubbing, toilet had a hard time flushing. Could hear noise every morning so we ended up having to get up about 7:30-8 every day. which is tough when you stayed up all night. We did not really like the atmosphere of the casino downstairs. That wasnt the hotels fault it was the type of people in the casino so we left and went next door to the Golden Nugget which had better atmosphere and seemed less seedy with nicer bars and a great buffet for 7.99. Our friends were staying in the Golden Nugget and I did see theyre room which was a much higher quality than ours. If you are going to stay at the Four Queens bring ear plugs to sleep with and youll be fine. but if you pay over 100 bucks you may be disappointed. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “great price and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgirl
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us stayed here friday & saturday this past weekend. We had a blast. The four queens is located right in the middle of all of the action. Our room was average with the basics but we were only in there to sleep so it didnt matter. The cost of a cab from the four queens to circus circus was only $11.00 for the 4 of us (what a deal). If we would have taken the "so called bus", it would have taken over an hour (due to all of the people that were waiting). Overall we had a great time and great location. I will definitely be staying at the four queens again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the Four Queens exactly 7 years ago today. Last minute change to plans-most hotels we wanted were sold out or WAY too expensive...thought we should give this a try. A LONG day of travelling (delays, bad turbulance, etc) and a late check in later, we arrived in our room to find it dirty. I was exausted...and stressed...and emotional...so dear hubby to be calls to front desk. They send someone up, and they upgrade us to a Fremont Street - facing suite. Decor outdated, sure. But it made my day. Casino nice enough-at the time I was all about the blackjack and I found a dealer who I LOVED. Funny, fast, knowledgeable...kept us all interested, laughing, and most importantly for the casino...at the table! I wish I could remember his name, but I do remember that my hubby kept borrowing money from me when he was down...and every time he would win a few hands, the dealer would stop, tell him to give me my "loan" back, and say "No Money...No Honey." The Four Queens has its good and not so good points. But it is a decent value for those who go for the experience and the sightseeing...not to spend their money on a room alone. We've stayed there a few times, and we've stayed other places too. Would recommend and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasYokel
Reviews.Content: Weekend of March 18, lots going on in Vegas and even a couple months early stuff the quality of Treasure Island or Stratosphere was 250, sometimes more. Hotwire had a 4 star (they always over "star") for 85.00. Figured it was the nicer GOlden Nugget so I bit. Early check in was fine, nice young man and got my key. North tower is right off the casino, very convenient for gambling. Facing away from Fremont on the 8th floor wasn't very noisy at all. Clean room with all the basics, good housekeeping. Casino was okay, had the prime rib special in the restaurant and it was lame. Still, a far better experience than say the San Remo. No pool, but might not have used it any way.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 2honeymooners
Reviews.Content: Really great price- around $30 per night. Upon request, you can stay on the top floor and get a great view of the desert. The food in the casino is not the best, we ate at the Chicago style pizza-- it was just ok. Their microbrewery is just ok as well, neither I nor my spouse were fans of their beers. For you money, go to the Fremont Casino's buffet across the street-- the best buffet we found at Vegas! The room was clean and the staff was relatively friendly (keep in mind that the staff in Las Vegas are somewhat jaded no matter where you stay!) Yes the rooms are a little noisy-- but that's only if you go to sleep before midnight! The only complaint I have is that the room service clean up is really slow. The same plates sat outside the hotel room for 4 nights! But you can't expect everything to be perfect at this price! Also, there is no pool, or transportation from the airport. But once again, what can you expect at this price??

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Kaukauna54130
Reviews.Content: 3/16/05 Clean and spacious.....probably the best value in Las Vegas. We have been to Vegas 11 times staying at all different places and this is the best for the money that you can get! There is no pool..... Our rooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable. Towel sevice was great...maid service better than average. Dress was casual.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens ain't Four Stars but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The title of this review may suggest that the Four Queens was inadequate but truthfully, I enjoyed my experience in Vegas...especially the Dowtown/Fremont area. If you have never been to Las Vegas (and before going with my girlfriend in August, we had never been either) you will undoubtedly be encouraged to stay on the Strip. That is for good reason. The Strip is as amazing as you have heard about and probably more...still, when we arrived we had no idea if staying Downtown was a good or bad thing. Instead of just simple narrative, I will break down the Four Queens, my trip and Vegas in general like this, LOCATION: We arrrived at the Four Queens on a Friday night and were immediately in wonder of the bright, vibrant lighting. The Four Queens is located in the heart of the Fremont Experience, adjacent to the Golden Nugget and Binion's Horseshoe. The Fremont Experience is a collection of gaming, restaurants, shopping and entertainment in Downtown Vegas, approx. two miles from the Strip. We had heard complaints about getting to and from the strip but honestly, the inexpensive bus ride is no more than ten minutes and most of that time is because of stops and rediculous traffic. No problem really. People will say that staying on the Strip is the thing to do but we didn't mind the back and forth travel. In fact many people we talked to on the Strip never made it Downtown, so we felt we got the best of both worlds. ACCOMODATIONS: The Four Queens is definitely "old-school" Vegas. We stayed in a standard room on a high level floor. The room was seemingly stuck in 70's decor but it was clean and not tiny. The ceiling in the shower had a tinge of rust, which I didn't care about but my girlfriend was not pleased. Our view was relatively bland, however, the mountains in the distance were beautiful. Because we spent very little actual time in the room, I can't tell you what room service is like. I can tell you the restaurant in the casino is good. And for that matter the casino itself was cool. (A lot of people we talked to at the tables and slots were staying at other hotels) Overall, I have nothing bad to say about the room, staff or casino. In fact, we when I broke down the price of the package, our nightly rate for hotel was approx. $16!! Can you really go wrong? And furthermore, what would you expect? WHAT ELSE: The Four Queens was nothing spectacular but it was not bad at all. When you visit the hotels on the Strip you will be blown away at the lavish designs and over-the-top construction. Beautiful giants such as the Bellaggio, Mandalay Bay and Ceasar's Palace are so plush, places like the Four Queens appear drab and pathetic. Still, because the location was downtown away from the madness of the Strip, the Four Queens is a reasonable, low-maintenance option for those who are the chill, low-maitenance type.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs down to the casino staff.”
Reviews.Author: knagl
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in this hotel, but I did visit its casino on the night I ventured downtown. The whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth, and I will not return to the casino or the hotel again. A slot machine malfunctioned. I was attempting to press the "select lines" button on the screen, but the touchscreen was mis-aligned, and pressing the "select lines" button actually equated to a press of the "Max Bet" button -- something I most certainly didn't want to do. I immediately stopped and had a friend watch my machine while I attempted to located a slot attendant. Not seeing one, I asked the nearest employee - a security guard. "Excuse me -- are there any slot attendants floating around here?" He replied rather gruffly, "I don't know." I, now peeved, replied, "Do you work here?" He replied, "Yeah, but not in that department." Thanks, buddy. I walked to a different part of the casino and located a slot attendant. She walked over to the machine, I explained the problem, and then she pressed the "select lines" button -- the exact same thing happened -- another (unwanted) max bet (now I'm down two max bets on this machine that I was attempting to just play down a couple of credits and cash out with). After a minute, she called her supervisor over. The supervisor came over, but didn't understand what the problem was. She then insisted that I was playing the game wrong and that the machine in fact was not malfunctioning. I even explained that her co-worker had witnessed (and caused) the machine to again malfunction because of the faulty touchscreen -- she didn't understand (or care), and proceeded to press buttons and spin the reels. She finally assured me that I would get my credits back, but because of her lack of understanding the situation, she wound up short-paying me by six credits, despite the fact that I kept insisting the exact amount that I had. As I cashed out at the cage, I asked if there was a business card available for the casino manager. The cashier (the friendliest person I encountered the whole time) was very apologetic and asked if she could help me with anything. I explained the situation, and she said she'd call the slot manager over. The slot manager came over, I got partway through my explanation of what happened when the original supervisor came over. He stopped listening to me and asked her a few questions (to which she basically said, 'he had a problem with the machine and I paid him), asked me exactly what the problem was, to which I replied, "Your machine malfunctioned -- the touchscreen is mis-aligned. She didn't understand or didn't care to understand what the problem was, told me I was playing the machine incorrectly, and then shorted me money paying me." Once he understood that I was shorted, he offered to pay me the six credits, but at that point I was so sick of the ordeal (and wanted to prove a point) that I told him to please keep the money and just fix the problems (the machine and the staffer). He told me he would, and I left. ...and that is why I will not visit the Four Queens again, and encourage other people to visit one of the many other fine hotels/casinos in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!!”
Reviews.Author: jungle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Four Queens..very qiuick and efficient. check-in...excellent room, although the bathroom was very small...had to close the door to get into the shower or bath....large room with a great view (1433)..housekeeping very good...excellent casino with all the new slots...food very good...the only problem I had was the bell desk...both times the guy didn't seem to want to get out of his chair to check or retrieve luggage or let me know where the airport shuttle would be picking up......grunted a little ..was sorry later that I had tipped him...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome affordable whirlpool rooms”
Reviews.Author: brendelb
Reviews.Content: For someone looking for a reasonably priced hotel, try the 4 Queens in the downtown. We actually started in a standard room which was okay, but the second day, we upgraded to a deluxe whirlpool room, which overlooked the Fremont Street experience and had a city and mountain view. This room made the whole trip!!! Didn't think we would use the whirlpool much, but after a day of walking (everyday), it was a great way to relax before doing the night shows, gambling, and just people watching. The downtown casinos really all look alike, but the table game minimums are lower than on the strip and it is a much shorter walk to more casinos & resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Four Queens very surprising but Great choice”
Reviews.Author: lwag725
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent who went out on Jan 2-6 2005 just got back. And I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. First night coming in I had gotten the flu and spent most of the night in the room. It was clean and the bed comfortable to my surprise. On the next day went out for the day coming back realized our bath flooding and reported it to the front desk and also said that the room never been cleaned. We went to dinner and gambled some more came back to the room and found it in the same shape called down again and complained and got action right away. Maintaince came up and could not fix the bath and called down and had us moved to a Suite. It was great hugh room with a large bathroom and entry area. I had stayed at the Rio Suites 2 nights and the suite that we had at the Four Queens was larger and the bathroom was also larger. The fan in the bathroom was very noisy though. I was surprised they did make things better very quickly and we enjoyed the suite. Beside this mishap the rest of our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Rodeo was a Bonus”
Reviews.Author: DaveSandra
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights at the 4 queens downtown on Freemont street early December. We were very lucky as unknown to us the National Rodeo Finals were in town , Lots of cowboys with their new weapons! ( mobile phones hung on their belts) There was free entertainment on Freemont street with acts from around the world from 6-12pm. The 4 queens was quite good but next time we will stay at the Golden Nugget, ( best Hotel Downtown!)

Reviews.Title: “best in vegas, but do not eat there!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I usually stayed at the golden nugget, but they were booked and would not make space even tho I had stayed there 2times per yr. for 15 years. With trepidation accepted accomodation at the four queens....casino and rooms better than the nugget, but the restarants are the pits..

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Gamble - $.50 to $2 min bets okay!”
Reviews.Author: PleaseTakeMe2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently gambled at the Four Queens. We had a great time! Although we stayed on the Strip, we chose to gamble downtown. On previous trips to Vegas, we gambled at the larger hotels on the Strip. We have found that you can gamble more for the money downtown, especially at the Four Queens. We learned to play Roulette and had a great time betting $.50 chips, instead of the larger hotel's $1 and $2 chip minimums. Blackjack could be played for as low as $2 a hand. Gaming areas not as large as the Strip hotels, but enough room for all who wanted to participate and those looker-ons. Hotel has great restaurants too. I would recommend those who have not tried the downtown casinos to give them a try. Parking available in the hotel's deck. Be sure to take your parking ticket for validation inside the casino at any of the tables you play at. The validation is in 3 hour increments. We played at the Four Queens one day for over 12 hours, and with validation, our parking was Free! Parking elsewhere would have cost us over $20. Binon's Horseshoe Casino is another good one. Also, don't miss the light/music show in the lighted sidewalk just outside Four Queens and Golden Nugget. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LoveCo50
Reviews.Content: 4 queens is a cheap place to sleep. It's adequate for the price. But I am very dissappionted that I asked for a high floor,non smoking room with king size bed and got a stinky smoking room on the 3rd floor with 2 queen beds. That could be because we asked my father to go at the last minute and wanted ajoining rooms, which we didn't get, but they were across from each other. I also don't like to pay for parking in the hotel where we are staying. The little resturant had nice food, so much we shared a meal. It's nice to have the Fremont Street experience right out the door. You get what you pay for and since we go as cheap as we can we will probably stay at 4 queens again.

Reviews.Title: “4 queens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent four days at the 4 queens.The rooms were comfortable with a nice king size bed.the waitresses were friendly and fast.Overall it was a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “save dollars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have too much money stay at the 5 star group but since I only sleep in my hotel I prefer to spend the $150.00 difference/night on food and entertainment. The above is clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino - lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: blkjck
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed the gaming atmosphere in the Four Queens casino. You have great, friendsly, and knowledgable staff who knew how to keep the games flowing. The casino room itself is bright and cheery, and gave the impression that the hotel room themselves would be the same. Not so fast. I was given a room on the 4th floor of the north tower. When I got off the elevator after checking in at 3 pm, lying next to the ice machine were some dirty dishes, probably from room service. Not a good sign, but nothing to get excited over. Then you notice the paint job on the room doors were of dubious quality, and black marks on the hallway walls were all over the place, and there was a bad patch job of a hole in the wall of my room. When I came back to my room 12 hours later, the same dishes were still next to the ice machine. Obviously, no pride by the cleaning staff to get that taken care of. I will continue to gamble at the Four Queens, but I'll go elsewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back from Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: dellis31
Reviews.Content: Had a great time on Freemont Street. Nice place to stay. Didn't care for the rooms or staff at the Four Queens (rude and not helpful with directions or questions, and the rooms were kinda shabby). The cashiers were very nice... maybe they should work the front counter! Anyway, we will stay on Freemont Street next year, just a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review titled "Thieves", etc. I had a similar experience with a cashier. She gave me the wrong amount of money even though the money counter machine displayed the correct amount. When I confronted her, she said oh yeah and gave me the right money. I feel she was trying to cheat me and if I didn't catch the mistake, she would have pocketed my money. I spoke to the manager in charge and of course he defended her saying she couldn't have kept my money. The cashier's cage has cameras all around, etc. etc. As he walked away from me, I noticed he went over to her and said something. I have never never experienced that situation in a casino before.
